sections.title: About Karnataka Bank Personal Loan:

elements.body: A personal loan can be a real life-saver during a financial crisis. Besides, it helps you to fulfill your various dreams. With Karnataka Bank, you can enjoy personal banking, professional banking, online trading, online shopping and a lot more services. It is one of the major private banks in Karnataka, located at Mangalore. The bank has a national presence with a network of almost 628 branches spread across to 21 states and two union territories in India. Karnataka Bank is ranked as “A Class Scheduled Commercial Bank” for the quality service it provides to its clients. The bank has been operative in India over 88 years. Like all other banks in India, Karnataka Bank also understands the importance of Personal Loan in your life, and hence offers personal finance for various purposes.

sections.title: Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Features:

elements.body:
Both salaried and self-employed individuals can apply for Karnataka Bank personal loan. The bank offers two types of personal loans:

KBL Salaried Persons Loan which is a scheme to finance salaried individuals

K-POWER which is a personal loan scheme to finance both salaried and self-employed individuals.

Karnataka Bank personal loan comes with a lot of attractive features which include:

  • Both salaried and non-salaried employees can avail Karnataka Bank personal loan.
  • Best quality customer service with 24/7 customer support available.
  • You can apply online.
  • You can get loan amounts varying up to Rs. 5 lakhs.
  • ATM withdrawal of funds held in the personal loan account is available.
  • KBL Salaried Persons Loan can be availed for up to 5 years.
  • With K-POWER, you can draw up to Rs.25,000.
  • Karnataka Bank offers floating rate of interest for personal loans.
  • The bank charges 0.50% processing fee for personal loans subject to a minimum of Rs. 250.
  • You can avail K-POWER for 12 months. Also it is subject to renewal.
  • You need to provide security for KBL Salaried Persons Loan.

items.title: Why Choose Karnataka Bank Personal Loan?
items.body: Choosing Karnataka Bank’s personal loan can help you to fulfill your various requirements. The bank offers low interest rate and charges minimum processing fee. You can use this loan amount to perform various tasks such as buying household objects, educational needs of children, wedding, medical expense of self and dependents, house repairing etc.

items.title: Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Interest Rate:
items.body:
Karnataka Bank Personal Loan MCLR and ROI

All the loans which are sanctioned post April 2017 has to follow the new lending rate system - MCLR (Marginal Cost Based Lending Rate). This is a tenure based benchmark. Existing Karnataka Bank Personal Loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations.

The current interest rate based on MCLR = 10.25% p.a.

Karnataka Bank follows the following MCLR rates:

TenureMLCR Percentage
Overnight8.40%
1 month8.45%
3 months8.55%
6 months8.70%
1 year8.90%

Note: All rates mentioned above are applicable as of April, 2017. Karnataka Bank can change these rates at its own discretion. Borrowers are advised to check prevailing rates while applying for a loan.

Check more details about Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Interest rates

items.title: Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Eligibility:
items.body:
Salaried, professionals and any individual earning regular income from pension, rent etc. are eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan. The eligibility conditions for KBL Salaried Persons Loan include:

  • You need to be a permanent employee of listed companies, colleges, schools, and universities.
  • Your maximum age should not be more than 55 years.
  • Your minimum age should be 21 years.
  • You should have minimum 3 years’ service period left from the time of taking the loan.

The eligibility criteria for K-POWER includes:

  • Any person with SB or CA is eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan
  • Salaried individual, professional and any individual receiving income from rent, pension any other sources can apply for this loan.

Know more about Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Eligibility for taking Personal loan

KVB offers personal loans up to Rs.10 lakh under six categories:

While these loans are designed for specific purposes and have different terms, conditions, and features, Karur Vysya Bank offers them under their personal loan product portfolio.

sections.title: Personal Loan Schemes offered by Karur Vysya Bank

elements.body:
1. Bon Voyage 

This loan has been specifically designed for funding your travel expenses to a foreign destination, either for business or personal purpose. The main features of the KVB Bon Voyage have been given below:  

  • Any creditworthy person who is also a relative of the borrower can act as a guarantor for the loan. 
  • The repayment tenure on this loan is 36 months. 
  • The borrower should be an Indian citizen or residing in India to avail the loan. 
  • Salaried individuals should have a minimum take home salary of Rs.1.8 lakh p.a. 
  • The eligible loan amount will be determined after deducting the stipulated margin from the eligible costs.  
  • Employed individuals should provide an undertaking letter from the employer to allow deduction of monthly instalments and make direct payments to Karur Vysya Bank. 

2. Swarnamitra

It is a short-term/overdraft loan offered by Karur Vysya Bank to individuals who possess gold jewelry. The loan availed can be used for personal purposes. The scheme has the below-given features: 

  • The minimum amount that can be availed as loan under Swarnamitra is Rs.5,000 while the maximum loan amount is Rs.75 lakh. 
  • The repayment tenure on the loan is 12 months which can be renewed for a further 12 months at the discretion of the bank. 
  • The primary security for the Swarnamitra loan is gold jewelry with at least 22 carat purity.  
  • Gold Ingots bought from banks can also be pledged as security to avail this loan. 
  • The servicing on the interest must be done monthly. 

3. Insta Loan

This is an instalment loan primarily meant for the employees working in reputed firms, schools, government institutions, etc., so that they can fulfil their expenses related to education, housing, health, etc. The main features of this loan have been given below: 

  • To avail this loan, applicants should have at least 2 years of confirmed service and one year of unexpired service.  
  • Applicants should not be a defaulter with any bank or financial institution if he/she desires to avail this loan. 
  • Borrowers should provide an undertaking letter from the payment disbursing authority. 
  • The maximum repayment tenure on the loan is 72 months or remaining service period, whichever is lesser. 
  • The net take home salary of the borrower to avail the loan should be at least 25% of the gross pay. 

4. Personal Loan (Secured and Unsecured)

This is a short-term loan that can be availed to fulfil unforeseen exigencies and personal financial needs. The key features of the schemes have been listed below: 

  • The maximum loan amount that can be availed under this scheme is Rs.10 lakh. 
  • The entire process is paperless, quick, and hassle-free and in principle, sanction can be done in 15 minutes based on the credit rating of the borrower. 
  • The loan can be repaid in tenures ranging between 1 year and 5 years. 
  • If the borrower wishes to provide a security for the loan, he/she can provide bank deposits, government bonds, land, buildings, etc., as security. 
  • To establish the repayment capacity of the borrower, the bank will require him/her to provide a salary certificate. 
  • Self-employed individuals should provide IT returns for the bank to ascertain the income and repayment capacity. 

5. Quick Loan

This loan can be availed by those who need short-term or long-term funds to meet their personal or business needs. The unique feature of this plan is that the repayment can be done in instalments or in full when the loan tenure ends. The other features of this loan have been provided below: 

  • The maximum loan amount that can be availed under this scheme is Rs.25 lakh. 
  • Bonds issued by central and state government, KVPs, NSCs, etc., can be pledged as primary collateral for availing this loan. 
  • If the borrower wishes to make the repayments in instalments, he/she can do so up to a tenure of 60 months. 
  • Overdrafts are allowed for up to 1 year and during renewal, the rate of interest needs to be re-fixed for the overdrafts. 
  • LIC policies will not be acceptable as securities for availing this loan. 

6. IPO Funding

This short-term loan is especially meant for those who need funds to invest in the Initial Public Offering (IPO) of a company. The amount availed as a loan under this scheme can be used to buy stocks or equity shares of a company. The scheme has the below-given features: 

  • The minimum amount that can be availed as a loan under this scheme is Rs.5 lakh. 
  • The loan has to be repaid within 15 days from loan disbursement date. 
  • To avail this loan, the borrower should hold a Savings Account with Karur Vysya Bank. 
  • The borrower should also have a demat account with Karur Vysya Bank or Depository Participants such as Karvy Consultants, Stock Holding Corporation of India Limited, Geojit Financial Services, etc. 
  • The shares allotted will act as a primary security for the loan.

sections.title: Documentation

elements.body:
The documents required for availing a personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank will depend on the type of loan. However, the basic documents required have been listed below:

Photo ID proof

Passport, PAN Card, Driver's License, Voter's ID, etc. 

Proof of Address

Passport, Driver's License, Voter's ID, etc. 

Proof of Age

Valid Passport, Banker's Certificate, Driver's License, Birth Certificate, etc. 

Salaried individuals may have to provide additional documents such as salary slips, bank statements, Form 16 while self-employed individuals have to provide proof of income, proof of continuity of business, proof of office ownership, etc.

sections.title: Why choose Karur Vysya Bank Personal Loans

elements.body:
There are certain large, unavoidable, and obligatory expenses that arise in our everyday lives. 

As Indians, we have certain obligatory expenses that may cost more than what you can afford with your planned savings – like giving your daughters their dream weddings or funding your child's higher education abroad. Sometimes, even savings and meticulous planning aren't enough to pay for things like large assets for your business, a long-overdue international family vacation, or even remodeling your home. Whatever the reason for your loan application may be, Karur Vysya Bank has a few options on offer that could be well-suited to your needs. 

The range of personal loans from Karur Vysya Bank enables all those activities for which you don't have the funds. Travel with the Bon Voyage loan, get a loan in instalments with the Insta Loan, meet unforeseen expenses with the Personal Loan, and exploit the repayment flexibility of the Quick Loan.

sections.title: About Karur Vysya Bank

elements.body:
Personal loans offer a great way to fund your personal expenses when you find it challenging to fund it with your regular paycheck. These loans can be availed to fund that dream vacation you have always wanted to go to, that gift you wanted to buy for your special one, or any other desire you have but was not able to afford. Personal loans can also save your day when you are in sudden need of money such as medical emergencies, sudden travel plans, etc., and you do not want to rely on friends or family to borrow from.  

When it comes to taking a personal loan, you will always prefer to take it from a reputed lender who offers attractive interest rates, and involves minimum hassle. This is where the personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank (KVB) fits in. Karur Vysya Bank is a private-sector bank headquartered in Karur, Tamil Nadu. The bank carries with it a tradition of 96 years and yet is young enough to adapt itself to the rapidly changing scenario in the banking industry. KVB offers several deposit and loan products, tailor-made to cater to the specific needs of customers

items.question: Am I eligible for a personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: Salaried individuals drawing a monthly salary that is over the minimum stipulated amount are eligible to avail personal loans from Karur Vysya Bank. The monthly income drawn by the applicant should be at least 25% of the gross pay. If you fall under this category, you surely can avail personal loans from Karur Vysya Bank.

items.question: How can I repay the personal loan availed from Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: The repayment towards Karur Vysya Bank personal loan can be done through equated monthly instalments or EMIs either by issuing post-dated cheques or by using the ECS (Electronic Clearance Service) facility.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount that I can avail as a personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount that you can avail as a personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank will depend on your repayment history and financial record. Karur Vysya Bank offers personal loans up to a maximum of Rs.75 lakh.

items.question: What is the repayment tenure for Karur Vysya Bank personal loans?
items.answer: Karur Vysya Bank offers personal loans with repayment tenures ranging from 15 days to 72 months making it ideal for all kinds of loan seekers.

items.question: What is the MCLR for Karur Vysya Bank personal loans?
items.answer: The marginal cost of fund-based lending rate (MCLR) for Karur Vysya Bank personal loans for 1-year tenure is 9.65% p.a. For overnight, 1-month, 3-month, and 6-month tenures, the MCLR is 8.55%, 8.55%, 8.90%, and 9.35% p.a. respectively.

items.question: What is the maximum amount of loan that can be borrowed from Karur Vysya Bank as a personal loan?
items.answer: Rs.75 lakh is the maximum amount that can be borrowed as a personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank. However, the loan amount actually sanctioned to an individual will be based on their repayment capabilities.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure for loan repayment for this personal finance option?
items.answer: A borrower can take a maximum of 72 months or 6 years to repay the loan amount to the bank.

items.question: How much will I be charged as processing fees for this personal loan from Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: The processing fees charged on the personal loans from Karur Vysya Bank will depend on the kind of loan the borrower is availing. It starts from Rs.500 and can go up to 0.50% of the loan amount.

items.question: What are the possible collaterals that can be registered for a personal loan from this bank?
items.answer: It is subject to the bank's expectation or requirement from the applicant. However, NSC/KVP/LIC policies, bank deposits, land or estate property may be used for the same.

items.question: What does the net take home pay generally amount to?
items.answer: Generally, the Net Take home Pay amounts to 25% of the gross pay after deducting the proposed Loan Instalments.

items.question: What is the additional document necessary for establishing application for a personal loan with Karur Vysya Bank for a self-employed applicant?
items.answer: IT returns need to be submitted to ensure income and repayment capacity of a self-employed individual.

items.question: According to Karur Vysya Bank, who can stand as a guarantor for a personal loan?
items.answer: Any individual with adequate net worth can act as a guarantor for the borrower of the personal loan. Spouse, family members, and friends are usually preferred by the banks to act as guarantors.

sections.title: Features and Benefits

elements.body:
• Loan quantum: The personal loan offered by Lakshmi Vilas Bank is highly flexible in terms of the loan amount one can avail. While the lower limit is Rs.10,000, there is no maximum limit on the amount that can be availed.
  • Utility: The loan amount sanctioned by the bank can be used by the borrower for any expenditure or investment.
  • Margin: The margin is decided based on the type of security pledged. In case of an LIC policy, the surrender value of the policy is considered the margin. In case of Kisan Vikas Patras (KVPs) and National Savings Certificate (NSCs), 10% of the accrued value will be regarded as the margin. The margins will remain the same for Secured Overdraft (SOD) and Demand Loans (DLs).
  • Attractive interest rate: The interest rate is conveniently low. This way, the borrower need not shell out too much while repaying the loan.
  • Repayment period: Two months prior to the maturity of the KVP/NSC/LIC policy, or 5 years, whichever is earlier, is the maximum time the individual has to repay the loan.

sections.title: How the EMI calculation of Lakshmi Vilas Bank Personal Loan work?

Lakshmi Vilas Bank asks loan applicants to pledge their NSC, KVP, or LIC policy in return for the requested loan amount. The amount can be returned on a monthly basis as per the EMI schedule provided. The EMI payable is calculated based on the interest rate, processing fee, and loan tenure. Take a look at the example given below to understand how personal loans work.

Mr. Rao had plans to start a business but was short of Rs.3 lakh in funds. Hence, he approached Lakshmi Vilas Bank for a personal loan. As he had an LIC policy that he could pledge, the bank approved the application for Rs.3 lakh loan at 11.4% interest p.a. The processing fee charged for the loan is 0.25% and the loan tenure was decided to be 1 year.

items.question: How do I repay the loan?
items.answer: You can repay the loan through equated monthly instalments (EMIs) as per the schedule given. In the example given above, the EMI payable was around Rs.26,570. Make sure you don't miss any of the payments.

items.question: What reasons could lead to the rejection of the loan application?
items.answer: The bank may reject the application if the applicant's credit score is low, the loan amount is too high for the tenure chosen, or the applicant does not have sufficient income.

items.question: Can I avail the Lakshmi Easy Loan without pledging any security?
items.answer: Lakshmi Vilas Bank specifically needs loan applicants to pledge government securities to get a personal loan. So, you have to provide any of the mentioned government securities to get the loan amount.

items.question: Can I get a Rs.5 lakh loan for a single government security?
items.answer: The bank will decide the loan amount that can be sanctioned based on the government security being pledged. If the value of the security you hold is estimated at Rs.5 lakh, the application can be approved.

items.question: How is the interest rate determined?
items.answer: The personal loan interest rate is determined by the bank based on the Marginal Cost of fund-based Lending Rate (MCLR). The Lakshmi Easy Loan, for example, is 1.50% over the one-year MCLR fixed by the bank. The bank decides the MCLR based on the repo rate fixed by the RBI.

items.question: What if I am not a Government Employee? Can I avail a personal loan from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: Yes, you can. The basic eligibility criteria set by Nainital Bank to avail a personal loan is to have a permanent job with a regular monthly income to ensure that you can pay the EMIs (Equated monthly installments).

items.question: What is the maximum personal loan amount that one can avail from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount that one can avail from Nainital Bank depends on the profession and income of the applicant

items.question: Is the interest rate for the personal loan for Nainital Bank fixed?
items.answer: The interest rate offered by Nainital Bank is subject to change from time to time and as per the terms and conditions set by Nainital Bank. In addition, the interest rate depends on the MCLR which is set by the Reserve Bank of India.

items.question: How can I pay my EMIs?
items.answer: You can pay your equated monthly installments through your net banking account, ECS (Electronic Clearing System) or via cheque at the Nainital Bank branch.

items.question: What could be the reason If Nainital Bank rejects my personal loan application?
items.answer: It is possible that your income, profession, age, CIBIL score, or your perceived inability to repay the loan could be a few reasons why your personal loan application could be rejected by Nainital Bank.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on Oriental Bank of Commerce Personal Loan

items.question: Why do I need to provide documents for KYC?
items.answer: A: KYC stands for 'Know Your Customer'. It is a compulsory process through which banks gather information about their customers. These include the identity and the address of the customers. This process has been mandated so that the services provided by the bank are not misused by the customers.

items.question: Can I apply for a personal loan from Oriental Bank of Commerce online?
items.answer: A: Yes, you can apply for a personal loan from Oriental Bank of Commerce through the bank website. On the home page of the website click on the 'Apply Online' option on the main menu bar. Under this option click on the 'Other Retail Loan' option from the drop-down menu. After this, you will be required to enter your mobile no. for registration. You will be able to get the access to the application form after the registration process is done.

items.question: Can I check the status of my Oriental Bank of Commerce Personal Loan online?
items.answer:
A: Yes, you can track your personal loan status on the bank website itself. To check the status of your application form you will be required to follow the steps mentioned below: 

  • Visit the official website of Oriental Bank of Commerce at www.obcindia.co.in. 
  • On the home page, click on the 'Other Retail Loan' option under the 'Apply Online' drop down option from the main menu. 
  • On the next page, click on the 'Application Form Status' option.

items.question: Can I use my reference number to check my application form status?
items.answer:
A: Yes, you can check the application form status using your reference number. Follow the steps mentioned below to check the status: 

  • Visit the official website of Oriental Bank of Commerce at www.obcindia.co.in. 
  • On the home page, click on the 'Other Retail Loan' option under the 'Apply Online' drop down option from the main menu. 
  • On the next page, click on the 'Application Form Status' option. 
  • Check the box next to the 'Reference No.' option. 
  • Fill in the details under the 'Enter your Loan reference no.' or 'Lead Number' field. 
  • Enter the 'Captcha Code' and click on the 'Submit' button.

items.question: Can I use my mobile phone number to check my application form status?
items.answer:
A: Yes, you can use your mobile number to check the status of your application form. You will be required to follow the steps mentioned below: 

  • Visit the official website of Oriental Bank of Commerce at www.obcindia.co.in. 
  • On the home page, click on the 'Apply Online' option from the main menu. 
  • Under the 'Apply Online' option, click on 'Other Retail Loan'. 
  • In the next page, click on 'Application Form Status'. 
  • Check the box next to the 'Mobile No.' option. 
  • Enter your mobile number in the field provided and click on the 'Send OTP' button. 
  • You will receive a One Time Password or OTP on your phone number. 
  • Enter the OTP in the field provided under 'Enter OTP' and click on the 'Submit' button.

  • Multipurpose Personal Loan: Punjab and Sind Bank Personal Loan can be availed for any genuine personal credit need including educational expenses, wedding expenses, travel costs and to meet the expenses of emergency medical needs.

  • High Loan Quantum: Borrowers are offered a high loan quantum of up to 18 times the net monthly salary and up to 15 times the net monthly pension for pensioners.

sections.title: Documents Required

elements.body:
Most lenders in India request applicants to provide a set of documents to apply for a loan to keep a record of the person's identity and verify his/her credibility. Here are a few general documents that applicants may be requested to submit: 

  • Identity proof such as Aadhaar or PAN 
  • Proof of residence

faq.title: Punjab and Sind Bank Personal Loan FAQs

items.question: Is it mandatory to submit income proofs in order to apply for the personal loan?
items.answer: Yes, the bank will ask for income proof to gauge the repayment capacity of a borrower.

items.question: What is the maximum and minimum loan amount one can avail through a Punjab and Sind Bank personal loan?
items.answer: The maximum amount depends on the applicant, with salaried applicants eligible for loans up to Rs.3 lakh. The loan amount for pensioners depends on their age, with those under the age of 65 years eligible for a maximum loan of Rs.3 lakh while those over the age of 65 years eligible for Rs.1 lakh. The bank has not prescribed any minimum loan amount, and an individual can opt for a loan below the maximum specified limits.

items.question: Who can act as a guarantee to the loan?
items.answer: A third-party, spouse, major son, or mutual guarantee can be named as the guarantee under the loan.

items.question: Is the processing fee a one-time payment?
items.answer: Yes, the processing fee equal to 1% of the loan amount is a one-time payment.

items.question: How is the interest rate for personal loan calculated?
items.answer: The interest for personal loan is calculated based on the one-year Marginal Cost of Funds based Lending Rate (MCLR).

elements.body:
Punjab National Bank offers personal loans up to Rs.10 lakh at interest rates starting from just 10.45% p.a. The repayment tenure extends up to 60 months, and the processing fees levied are just 1.80% of the loan amount. 

This lender offers personal loans to help you meet your immediate financial expenses. Whether you need to consolidate your debt, pay for your child's wedding, take off on an exotic vacation, or anything of the sort, personal loans from Punjab National Bank can be availed at attractive rates to help you fulfill your dreams.

elements.body:

sections.title: Loan Amount Details for Various Schemes

elements.body:
Personal Loan Scheme for Public
  • Rs.50,000 to Rs.4 lakh or 20 times monthly income, whichever is lower.
  • Rs.50,000 to Rs.5 lakh to 20 times monthly income, whichever is lower for salaried individuals who have finished 3 years of service in their current company. 
  • Rs.50,000 to Rs.10 lakh or 20 times monthly income for employees who draw their salary through PNB and have completed three years of service in their current company. 
Personal Loan Scheme for Doctors
  • Rs.2 lakh to Rs.15 lakh or 20 times monthly income, whichever is lower. 
  • 15 times of monthly income for loan amounts ranging from Rs.5 lakh and Rs.10 lakh. 
Personal Loan Scheme for Pensioners
  • Rs.25,000 to Rs.10 lakh or 18x monthly pension for pensioners who are less than 70 years old. 
  • Rs.25,000 to Rs.7.5 lakh or 18x monthly pension for pensioners who are between 70 and 75 years old. 
  • Rs.25,000 to Rs.5 lakh or 12x monthly pension for pensioners who are older than 75 years of age.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria

elements.body:
Here are the eligibility criteria for Personal Loan Scheme for Public:

  • Must be a permanent or confirmed defence personnel, such as officials of Central Reserve Police Force, Military Station Headquarters, Indo Tibetan Border Police, Central Industrial Security Force, Border Security Force, etc. 
  • Must be a permanent or confirmed employee of the State or Central Government, Public Sector Units, or reputed institutions or colleges including schools, autonomous bodies, universities, nursing homes, hospitals, etc. who draw their salary via Punjab National Bank accounts. 
  • Must be professionally qualified doctors whose annual income is Rs.4 lakh or more. 

Eligibility criteria for Personal Loan Scheme for Doctors:

  • Must be a professionally qualified doctor whose net annual income is Rs.5 lakh or more. 
  • Must have a continued occupancy at the present residence for at least two years. 

Eligibility Criteria for Personal Loan Scheme for Pensioners:

  • Must be a pensioner who draws pension through a Punjab National Bank branch.

sections.title: Documents Required

elements.body:
• Duly completed loan application form with photographs 
  • Form 16 or latest salary slips in case of salaried individuals 
  • Income Tax Returns for the past 3 financial years along with address proof and age proof in case of self-employed individuals 
  • Any other documents as requested by the bank

items.question: Are there any extra fees or charges applicable to a Punjab National Bank personal loan?
items.answer: Yes. Customers who avail a personal loan will have to pay processing fees which will be deducted from the loan amount at the time of disbursal. Those who avail the personal loan scheme for public will have to pay 1.80% of the loan amount as processing fees, while those who avail the personal loan scheme for doctors will have to pay 0.90% of the loan amount as processing fees. Customers who avail the loan scheme for pensioners will not have to pay any extra fees or charges when availing the loan.

items.question: How will the disbursal of my personal loan take place?
items.answer: Usually, your personal loan from Punjab National Bank will be disbursed to your bank account after your application has been approved and you meet all the eligibility criteria established by the bank.

items.question: I am a doctor who wants to apply for a personal loan from Punjab National Bank. Is it advisable to go for Personal Loan Scheme for Public or Personal Loan Scheme for Doctors?
items.answer: Doctors are advised to go for Personal Loan Scheme for Doctors as the interest rate applicable to it is slightly lower in comparison with the Personal Loan Scheme for Public.

items.question: How do I get the best interest rate on a Punjab National Bank personal loan?
items.answer: In order to get the best possible interest rate on a Punjab National Bank personal loan, you will have to ensure that your credit score is high. You will also have to ensure that you have little to no liabilities in the form of other loans or credit card dues. Your income will also play a crucial role in determining the interest rate applicable to your personal loan.

items.question: How do I apply for a Punjab National Bank personal loan?
items.answer: You can apply for a personal loan from Punjab National Bank by visiting a branch of the bank or online through the website of the bank. You could also apply for a personal loan through third party sites such as BankBazaar.

disclaimer.text: *This article is provided only for consumer information on an as is where is basis and BankBazaar does not claim or represent to be connected with Punjab National Bank. For further information about any of the products mentioned above please contact Punjab National Bank.

sections.title: Why Should You Choose SBI Personal Loan?

elements.body:
Customers of SBI personal loans can benefit from the following:

  • Quick disbursal of the loan amount, i.e., within 2-7 days.
  • Minimal preclosure charges for most personal loan products.
  • No administrative charges or any other kind of hidden costs.
  • Minimal documentation for application.
  • Most affordable interest rates in the market.
  • Convenient modes of repayment such as check-off facility, post-dated cheques, or cash.

State Bank of India is a leading public sector lender that offers three types of personal loans -

  • Xpress Credit Personal Loan
  • Xpress Power Loan
  • SBI Pension Loan

sections.title: SBI Personal Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria that prospective borrowers will have to meet to avail a personal loan from State Bank of India are as follows:

Eligibility for Xpress Credit Personal Loan

  • The loan applicant's minimum net monthly income (NMI) should be Rs.5,000.
  • The EMI/NMI Ratio should not be above 50%.
  • The applicant should be an employee at any of the following organizations:
  • Central and state governments
  • Central and state PSUs
  • Educational institutions with a national reputation
  • Quasi-government
  • Certain corporates that have an exclusive business relationship with SBI
  • Companies that do not have any business relationship with SBI OR any Emigration Check Required (ECR), subject to specific terms and conditions.

Eligibility for SBI Pension Loan

  • You will need to be a central or state government pensioner, defence pensioner or a family pensioner to apply for this loan scheme offered by SBI. A family pensioner is the spouse of a pensioner who is allowed to obtain pension when the pensioner dies.
  • The pensioner, as well as, the family pensioner's age should not be above 76 years.
  • For pensioners whose pension is disbursed by government treasuries, the concerned pensioner will need to give a mandate to the treasury to make the pension payment to the particular bank branch. This certain undertaking cannot be rescinded at any point in time. The treasury will also write a note that it will not agree to take any request from any pensioner to make changes to the pension payment to any other branch or bank.
  • A defence pensioner can be any pensioner of the armed forces. The armed forces include Paramilitary Forces, Army, Rashtriya Rifles, Air Force, Navy, Coast Guards, and Assam Rifles. The pension payment order will need to be with SBI.
  • The EMI (Equated Monthly Instalments) or NMP (Net Monthly Pension) should not be above 50% for every pensioner. For family pensioners, the EMI or NMP should not be above 33%.

Eligibility for SBI Xpress Power

  • The prospective borrower will need to earn a minimum monthly income of Rs.50,000

Applicants who are employed with the following entities are eligible to apply for this loan:

  • Central or state governments
  • Defence establishments
  • PSUs
  • Quasi-government bodies
  • Educational institutions that have a national reputation
  • Select corporates

Given that State Bank of India offers three personal loans as part of its suite of offerings, prospective borrowers can evaluate their needs and opt for a suitable type of loan.

Other loan schemes for NRI from SBI

  • NRI's can go for this loan scheme from SBI to meet any of their needs such as buying a house or meeting immediate financial needs. The bank will not be repatriating your loan amount abroad.
  • This SBI loan will be handed over solely to the depositor.
  • You can procure this loan in foreign currency or Indian Rupee by pledging a security of your NRE or FCNR or NRO deposit.
  • You can choose a demand loan, an overdraft, or a foreign currency loan.
  • The loan period for this loan is up to the outstanding maturity period.
  • The margin for this loan scheme is 10% which includes accrued interest as well principal.

SBI online overdraft (OD) against your NRI deposit

For SBI online OD, you will not have to come down to India to complete the application process in India. You can utilise the bank's internet banking platform to apply for the loan facility.

Eligibility criteriaAny customer with an NRE or NRO fixed deposit
Minimum residual period6 months
Permissible limit
  • TDR or eTDR: 75% of the face value of the deposit
  • STDR or eSTDR: 90% of the face value of the deposit

  • In the above-mentioned table, the NRE or NRO fixed deposit in the eligibility criteria includes Special term deposit (STDR) or eSTDR or Term Deposit Receipt (TDR) or eTDR in a single name holder only.
  • In the above-mentioned table, the permissible limit section refers to the overdraft limit against deposits. You will not be able to make any modifications to the overdraft limit.
  • This loan scheme is not given to joint holders of deposits.
  • The loan will be provided to you with the help of internet banking. If you want to withdraw or shift the fund, you can do it via cheque or online banking.
  • If you want to close the SBI NRI overdraft account, you will have to visit any of the branches in India. This overdraft account closure cannot be done online as of now.

items.question: How to check SBI personal loan status?
items.answer: You can track your SBI personal loan status by contacting customer care or visiting the nearest branch.

items.question: How to contact SBI personal loan customer care?
items.answer:
You can contact SBI personal loan customer care number through the following ways: 

  • Call the 24x7 toll-free helpline numbers which are 1800 425 3800 and 1800 11 2211. 
  • You can also call the number 080-26599990 which is chargeable.

items.question: What are the different types of SBI personal loans offered to employees of corporates?
items.answer: Employees of corporates can apply for the Xpress Power Loan or the Xpress Credit Personal Loan, provided they meet the eligibility criteria. Keep in mind that you will need to have a salary account with the lender to apply for the Xpress Credit Personal Loan.

items.question: If I take a personal loan from SBI, when will my liability to the bank come to an end?
items.answer: Once the entire outstanding loan amount becomes zero, your liability for your SBI personal loan will be removed.

items.question: What are the options to repay my SBI Personal loan?
items.answer: You can repay your SBI Personal Loan via EMIs through the ECS facility or through Standing Instruction.

items.question: Can I prepay my SBI Personal Loan and will I need to pay any additional charge on the prepayment of this loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can prepay your SBI Personal Loan. The bank charges prepayment penalty for certain personal loan schemes. You can find out more about this charge when you apply for the loan.

items.question: What are the personal loan products offered by SBI?
items.answer: The 3 main types of SBI personal loan products include: SBI Xpress Power, SBI Xpress Credit Personal Loan, and SBI Pension Loan

items.question: What is the minimum loan amount for SBI loan for central and state government pensioners?
items.answer: The minimum loan amount for SBI loan for central and state government pensioners is Rs.25,000.

items.question: How can a personal loan borrower get in touch with SBI if he or she has any queries?
items.answer: A personal loan borrower can reach out to SBI for support by making use of any of the customer care number or email addresses. The customer can also write an email to the grievance cell of SBI or visit any SBI branch for assistance.

items.question: Could you tell me the general loan tenure for SBI personal loans?
items.answer: All SBI personal loans are typically provided for a period of up to 60 months.

items.question: What should be my income to secure a personal loan from State Bank of India?
items.answer: SBI offers personal loans to individuals with incomes as low as Rs.5,000. However, this amount might vary depending on the scheme applied for.

items.question: Do I need to have a guarantor to apply for the Xpress Credit Personal Loan from State Bank of India?
items.answer: No, the lender does not require you to have a guarantor. However, before applying for the loan, you should ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria specified by the lender.

Besides this, South Indian Bank also has other criteria you need to fulfil: 

  • Employment for a minimum of 2 years, with at least 1 year in your current organisation.

items.question: Can I apply for the South Indian Bank Personal Loan online?
items.answer:
Yes. You can apply for this personal loan via BankBazaar. You will first have to check your eligibility and if you meet the requirements, you can apply for the loan. 

Alternatively, you can download the application form from South Indian Bank's official website and submit it at the branch, with the necessary documents.

items.question: How many types of personal loans are offered by South Indian Bank?
items.answer: There are loans available under two categories–Group and Individual. Based on your requirements and the eligibility, you can apply for a loan under either of these categories.

items.question: What is the minimum loan amount offered for this personal loan?
items.answer: The minimum loan amount you can borrow with this personal loan is Rs.1 lakh. The maximum offered is Rs.25 lakh.

items.question: Do I need to pay a penalty for pre-paying the loan?
items.answer: Yes. If you wish to foreclose your loan within a year of your tenure, you will have to pay 4% of the principal outstanding as the penalty. If you foreclose the loan after a year, you will have to pay 2% of the principal outstanding. These charges are also charged on part payments of your loan.

items.question: Can I apply for the loan if my credit score is less than 650?
items.answer: No. One of the eligibility requirements for the loan is for the applicant to have a minimum credit score of 650. You may not get the loan approved with a score lower than the requirement set by South Indian Bank.

sections.title: How does the EMI calculation for Syndicate Bank personal loan work?

elements.body:
Let's say that Mr. Vishwas, a marketing professional, who draws a monthly salary of Rs.45,000, avails a personal loan from Syndicate Bank. The amount borrowed by Mr. Vishwas is Rs.1.5 lakh and the tenure of the loan is one year. The interest rate applicable to the loan is 13.55% p.a., and Syndicate Bank levies a processing fee at 0.50% of the loan amount. In this case, here's what Mr. Vishwas' repayment schedule will look like:

YearPrincipal Paid(A)Interest Paid(B)Total Payment (A+B)Outstanding Loan Balance
Apr 2019Rs.11,743Rs.1,694Rs.13,437Rs.1,38,257
May 2019Rs.11,875Rs.1,561Rs.13,436Rs.1,26,382
Jun 2019Rs.12,009Rs.1,427Rs.13,436Rs.1,14,373
July 2019Rs.12,145Rs.1,291Rs.13,436Rs.1,02,228
Aug 2019Rs.12,282Rs.1,154Rs.13,436Rs.89,946
Sep 2019Rs.12,421Rs.1,016Rs.13,437Rs.77,525
Oct 2019Rs.12,561Rs.875Rs.13,436Rs.64,964
Nov 2019Rs.12,703Rs.734Rs.13,437Rs.52,262
Dec 2019Rs.12,846Rs.590Rs.13,436Rs.39,416
Jan 2020Rs.12,991Rs.445Rs.13,436Rs.26,424
Feb 2020Rs.13,138Rs.298Rs.13,436Rs.13,286
Mar 2020Rs.13,286Rs.150Rs.13,436Rs.0

As you can see from the above amortisation table, Mr. Vishwas will be paying Rs.13,346?as his EMIs until March 2020. The total amount he will be paying is Rs.1,61,986 (loan amount of Rs.1.5 lakh, processing fees of Rs.750, and total interest payments of Rs.11,236).

items.question: Are there any special discounts for women borrowers who apply for a Syndicate Bank personal loan?

The main benefits of choosing the TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loan can be summed up as follows:

elements.body:
• Age of the applicant: The applicant should be aged below 54 years. 
  • Nature of employment: The applicant should be a permanent employee with a confirmed service in a government department, a business house, a reputed corporate house, a recognised educational institution, and so on. 
  • A good credit score: Most lenders check the credit score of the applicant before processing a loan. Having a good credit score increases the chances of the loan application being approved. 
  • Credit history: The credit history and the repayment history (in case of previous loans) of the applicant are very important as it plays a major role in deciding whether your loan application will be approved or not. Having a good credit history, portrays the applicant as a creditworthy customer. 
  • Reputation of the employer: In case of salaried individuals, being employed under a reputed employer increases the chances of the loan application being approved.

sections.title: About the Bank

elements.body: TamilNad Mercantile Bank is one of the oldest banks in India. Personal loans are one of the most utilised credit instruments offered by the bank. The bank offers loans up to 6 times the gross income of the applicant subject to an upper cap. The bank offers personal loans with minimal conditions applied. The documentation process is also quite simple and fast for TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loans.

faq.title: FAQs on TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loan

items.question: What is the process to repay Tamilnad Mercantile Bank Personal loans?
items.answer: A: A borrower can repay his or her personal loan from TamilNad Mercantile Bank within the stipulated repayment tenure through post-dated cheques or through Equated Monthly Instalments or EMIs using the ECS facility.

items.question: Does the bank require any security / guarantee to sanction a personal loan?
items.answer: A: Yes, the bank treats lien over bonus, salary and other emoluments as security against your personal loan. In case your employer does not allow the bank to deduct money from your salaried account to make instalment payments towards the loan and you do not possess a salary account with TamilNad Mercantile Bank, you will have to nominate two individuals as guarantors.

items.question: Where can I get the TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loan application form?
items.answer: A: An applicant can visit one of the nearest branches of TamilNad Mercantile Bank and collect the application form from there. Alternatively, he or she can also visit the official website of TamilNad Mercantile Bank and download and print the application from the website.

items.question: How to check the status of a TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: A: If you have applied for the personal loan through the bank website, you can just log in to the website and check the status of the loan. If you have applied for the loan through a third-party platform such as BankBazaar, you can log in to your BankBazaar profile and check the status of your loan. In addition to that, BankBazaar will also send regular updates about the status of your TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loan through emails and SMS which will be delivered to the registered email ID and phone number, respectively. You can also get push notifications for the same if you are using the BankBazaar smartphone application.

items.question: What are the pre-requisites when applying for a TamilNad Mercantile Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer:
A: The pre-requisites are as follows: 

  • Certificate for the Take Home Salary from the employer 
  • Income proof 
  • Undertaking which is to be issued by the employer of the borrower for the deduction and remittance of the instalments from the salary of the borrower every month

Being one of the major and oldest banks of the country, UCO Bank or United Commercial Bank as it was formerly known. Apart from being a commercial bank providing loans and advances among their primary activities, meeting term loans and working capital required by all sectors from agricultural, large/medium and small sectors, to infrastructure, trade and service sectors. One of them is the UCO Bank Personal Loans or UCO Bank Cash as they refer to it, this loan can be taken up by an individual who requires a Personal Loan for fulfilling the needs and requirements of him and his family, like education, marriage, medical treatments etc.

sections.title: Why choose UCO Bank Personal Loan?

elements.body:
With our current financial situation in the Indian markets, the amount we save in fixed deposits, saving accounts etc., may not have the same value in the future. Having your liquid money locked up in investments restricts your ability to have enough to pay off or spend on things you need like paying off credit card bills, taking that much needed family vacation, remodelling of your home etc.

With the UCO Bank Personal Loan or UCO Bank Cash as it's known all this is possible. UCO Bank, offers you a personal loan without collateral security for an amount of up to Rs. 2 Lacs, and for loans above that will need to put up collateral for only 40% of the loan amount.

items.title: UCO Bank Personal Loan Interest Rate
items.body:
UCO Bank offers a host of personal loan schemes to eligible borrowers, with the interest varying according to the scheme. Benchmarks adopted by the bank help in computing this interest, with two benchmarks currently in use. While interest rates computed according to base rates have been used for a while, MCLR benchmarks were introduced recently, following RBI directives.

UCO Bank Marginal Cost of Funds Based Lending Rate (MCLR) (For new borrowers)

UCO Bank introduced MCLR based benchmarks following RBI directives, with these benchmarks offering a better picture of current financial conditions. Factors like CRR, repo rate, loan tenure, operating costs, etc. have a direct correlation with MCLR, with any change in these parameters having an impact on rates payable by a borrower. The table below highlights the rates applicable as of June 2016.

MCLR Benchmark Tenure (Period)Benchmark Rates (MCLR)
Overnight8.10%
1 month8.20%
3 months8.30%
6 months8.55%
1 year8.65%
2 years9.65%

Personal loan interest rates (MCLR)

As per RBI guidelines, all consumers who avail a loan after April 1, 2016 will automatically fall under the ambit of MCLR. UCO Bank can choose to add a certain spread over and above this benchmark, with the final interest generally varying from case to case. The loan amount, repayment tenure, repayment mode (salary account with/without check-off), borrower income, etc. can all play a role in computing the final interest rate.

UCO Bank Base and Prime Lending Rates (For existing borrowers)

The base and prime lending rates at UCO Bank are highlighted below.

Base Rate9.70% per annum, effective October 5, 2015
Prime Lending Rate14.25% per annum, effective October 5, 2015

UCO Bank personal loan interest rate (Base Rate)

The date of loan approval plays a key role in determining the benchmark one falls under, with all borrowers who availed a loan before MCLR benchmarks were introduced having an option to choose their interest mode. They can either continue paying interest determined by factoring the base rate or move to MCLR. Those who refrain from migrating will pay an interest according to the loan scheme, with rates typically ranging between 12% per annum and 16% per annum. This is computed by adding a spread over the base rate, with it possible for one to avail preferential rates based on their relationship with the bank.

Note: UCO Bank reserves the right to change the aforementioned interest rates at its own discretion. All rates mentioned above are effective as of June 2016. Individuals looking to avail a loan from the bank are advised to check rates prevailing at the time of application.

Find more details about UCO Personal Loan Interest rates

items.question: Can I check my UCO Bank Personal Loan status?
items.answer: If you have applied through for your UCO Bank Personal Loan then all you need to do is login and check your status in real-time. If not you can contact the UCO Bank at their business hours and provide them with the application number and the credential they require and wait for their update.

items.question: What will be my maximum EMI for a month?
items.answer: EMI for a salaried individual can't exceed 40% of his/her take home salary, for someone who is self-employed the value of the loan is determined by the profits earned.

items.question: Where can I apply for a UCO Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: You can find the application for the loan at the branch.

items.question: Is there any processing charges for applying for the UCO Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: There is a 1% charge the minimum of Rs. 750/-

items.question: What are the different kinds of personal loans offered by UCO Bank?
items.answer: UCO Bank offers many different personal loans depending upon the reason for which the borrower requires the funds. For instance, the UCO Shopper Loan Scheme can be availed by individuals who require money to make purchases of household articles and consumer durables such as electronic gadgets, air conditioner, refrigerator, computer, television, etc. A top-up home loan can be availed by existing home loan customers to meet expenses related to children's education, furnishing, repairs and renovation of their home, agricultural purposes, business needs, etc. The UCO Car Loan Scheme can be availed by individuals who wish to purchase a motor vehicle. The UCO CA Loan Scheme is available to chartered accounts who require funds to construct / acquire office premises or finance cost of construction and land, finance cost of fixture, furniture and fittings of computers and other office equipment. The UCO Cash Scheme can be availed by individuals who require funds to meet unforeseen domestic expenses such as social obligations, education, marriage, etc.

items.question: What documents must I submit when applying for a personal loan from UCO Bank?
items.answer: The documentation process for a personal loan from UCO Bank is fairly simple, and the documents accepted by the bank include passports, driver's license, and Aadhar card for proof of identity. For proof of address, the documents accepted by the bank include telephone or electricity bills. Even a driver's license with a mention of the customer's current address is accepted. Payslips can be submitted as income proof.

items.question: What factors are taken into consideration by the bank when checking my eligibility for a personal loan?
items.answer: After you have submitted your loan application along with the necessary documents, the bank will run a verification check to ascertain your eligibility for the loan. Your job status, job security, monthly income, outstanding debt, credit score, ability to repay and a few other factors will be considered to ensure that you're a risk-free customer.

items.question: Can I avail a personal loan despite having a poor credit score?
items.answer: The bank will require you to have a good credit score before it sanctions any loan to you. However, you can take certain steps to increase your credit rating. Make sure that your ratio of secured loans to unsecured loans is good as the bank will consider you more responsible in this case. You must also make sure that you don't make loan applications with too many banks as it can reduce your credit score. Your job status also plays a crucial role. Make sure that you don't change jobs frequently as steady jobs and regular income are instrumental in the approval of a personal loan. The bank will only consider customers who have a steady job and are certain to draw an income that will help them clear their personal loan.

items.question: Do I have to pay any extra fee when taking a personal loan?
items.answer: If you are a salaried or self-employed individual looking to take a personal loan, you will have to pay a processing fee of 0.50% of the loan amount. The amount will be deducted from your loan amount at the time of disbursal.

items.question: What is the difference between pre-payment, and foreclosure?
items.answer: Pre-payment means that you are paying off a certain amount of the outstanding loan amount before the expiry of the tenure, and foreclosure means that you are paying off the entire outstanding loan amount before the completion of the tenure.

items.question: How will my personal loan be disbursed?
items.answer: Lenders usually disburse the loan amount by electronically depositing into your savings account.

items.question: Are Union Bank personal loan interest rates different for salaried and self-employed applicants?
items.answer: Yes, salaried applicants can take personal loans from the Union Bank of India at interest rates starting from 12.60%, while the interest rates applicable to self-employed applicants start from 14.60%.

items.question: What are the main factors that determine the interest rate applicable to my personal loan?
items.answer: The main factors taken into consideration by banks and financial institutions when determining your interest rate include your credit score, your current liabilities, and your income.

sections.title: How the EMI calculation of United Bank of India Personal Loan work?

elements.body:
A personal loan is unique in the fact that the bank does not ask the loan applicant to mortgage property in return for the loan amount. The loan is provided solely based on credit history and credibility. Personal loan borrowers can repay the amount borrowed in equated monthly installments (EMIs). An example will make it easier to understand how the EMI is calculated.

Ms. Swathi needed Rs.2 lakh immediately for her father's medical treatment expenses. faq.title: United Bank of India Personal Loan FAQs

items.question: Can I get a personal loan from United Bank of India for Rs.3 lakh?
items.answer: Though the bank has mentioned the maximum loan amount offered to be Rs.2 lakh, the bank may allow the borrower to avail a larger amount. This decision is at the discretion of the bank.

items.question: Will I be charged if I make prepayments?
items.answer: No, United Bank of India does not levy prepayment charges.

items.question: Will the interest rate remain the same?
items.answer: The bank has authority over the interest rate and may choose to change it from time to time. The MCLR, based on which the personal loan interest rate is calculated, in turn, depends on the repo rate fixed by the RBI. On the revision of the repo rate, the bank will revise its MCLR accordingly.

items.question: Can my loan application be rejected?
items.answer: Since the bank doesn't require an individual to pledge any document or property, it is of utmost importance that the person is reliable. In order to verify the same, the bank will look into the credit history and other patterns to estimate if he/she will diligently repay the loan or not.

items.question: How do I repay the loan I borrowed from United Bank of India?
items.answer: You can repay the loan in the form of EMIs that have to be paid out on a monthly basis. You may be asked for a post-dated cheque to make the payments.

sections.title: Loan Overview

elements.body:

sections.title: Why choose YES BANK Personal Loan?

elements.body:
• No collateral required. 
  • In-principle approval within 60 seconds. 
  • Fast approval and disbursal of loan. 
  • Very competitive rate of interests starting at as low as just 10.75% p.a. 
  • Easy online eligibility check process. 
  • Easy online application process. 
  • Flexible repayment options ranging between 12 months and 60 months. 
  • Facilities for transferring existing loans, doorstep banking, mobile banking, and part prepayment.

sections.title: Fees and charges

elements.body:
The fees and charges which are applicable to YES BANK Personal Loan are as follows: 

  • Processing charges: Up to 2.5% of the loan amount or Rs.999, whichever is higher + applicable GST 
  • Foreclosure charges: Foreclosure of a personal loan is allowed only after the repayment of first 12 EMIs. Foreclosure fee is charged at 2% to 4% of the outstanding principal amount after that. 
  • Part prepayment charges: 2% of the amount paid towards part payment + applicable taxes (part payment allowed only after the repayment of first 12 EMIs) 
  • Loan cancellation charges: Rs.1,000 + applicable taxes 
  • Late payment charges: 24% p.a. on the outstanding amount from the default date. 
  • Stamp duty: As per the laws applicable in the state 
  • Cheque bounce charges: Rs.750 for each bounced cheque + applicable taxes

sections.title: YES BANK Personal Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
• The age of the applicant – for most lenders, the minimum and maximum age requirement for a personal loan are 21 years and 60 years, respectively. 
  • A good credit score – the applicant should have a good credit score. The chances of getting the loan application approved are higher if the credit score of the applicant is 700 or more. 
  • The monthly income of the applicant is also taken under consideration for a personal loan application. 
  • The reputation of the employer and the employment history of the applicant is also checked. 
  • The credit history, as well as, other active loans and recurring monthly expenses of the applicant are considered before approving a personal loan.

sections.title: Documents required

elements.body:
• Application form 
  • A proof of identity such as passport, Aadhaar card, Driving License (DL), or Election Commission card 
  • A proof of address – any valid ID proof with permanent address which should be at least a year old 
  • Income proof – last 3 months' bank statement

sections.title: How do I calculate EMI for YES BANK personal loan?

elements.body:
Visit our banking related personal loan EMI calculator and get an instant quote on your monthly payments. To know more, go to YES BANK Personal Loan EMI calculator.

Personal Loan EMI Calculator given on YES BANK's website can also help determine the installment amount payable. Follow the steps given below:

  • Enter the desired loan amount.
  • Enter the interest rate.
  • Enter the loan tenure (years and months).
  • The graph appearing on the right side will display your EMI.

elements.title: About the bank
elements.body: YES BANK is one of the largest private sector banks in India with a huge customer base. With more than 1,000 branches all across the nation, YES BANK is also one of the banks in India with rapid growth. YES BANK also happens to be the only bank to be awarded a Greenfield Bank License in the last 20 years.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on YES BANK Personal Loans

items.question: How to check YES BANK Personal Loan status?
items.answer: Applicants can get in touch with the bank at any point in time to know the status of their personal loan. If the applicant has applied for YES BANK Personal Loan through BankBazaar, he or she can also log in to his or her BankBazaar profile and check the status of the loan. The applicant will also get regular SMS and email updates on the phone number and email ID registered with BankBazaar.

items.question: Where do I get the YES BANK personal loan application form?
items.answer: You can consider visiting one of the branches of YES BANK and collect the application form. You can also visit the official website of YES BANK and download and print the application from the website.

items.question: What is the loan amount that I can avail?
items.answer: The loan amount for which you will be eligible will depend on a number of factors including your credit score, credit history, employment history, income, and repayment capability. The bank will decide the amount that you will be eligible for after considering all these factors.

items.question: Can I check my YES BANK personal loan statement online?
items.answer: Customers can get in touch with the bank to get the latest statement of accounts, however, issuing these statements will attract charges of Rs. 750 per statement.

items.question: How long does it take to process a YES BANK Personal Loan?
items.answer: Once all the documents are submitted to the bank as per their policy, the loan is usually processed within 5 working days from the date of submission of the documents.

items.question: How can I receive my Repayment Schedule?
items.answer: Customers can request the bank for repayment schedules at any instant, however, every copy of the repayment schedule that is sent to the customer will be charged at Rs. 750.

items.question: How is the applicable interest rate decided?
items.answer: The interest rate which is applicable for an applicant will be decided by the bank. There are a number for deciding factors such as the credit score of the applicant, his or her employment history, and so on. Usually, if the applicant is salaried with a reputed employer with an income which suits YES BANK's eligibility criteria, he or she can expect the lowest interest rates.

sections.title: Personal Loan in Agartala

elements.body: Agartala is the capital of Tripura and also the largest city in the state. It is also the second biggest city in the whole of North East India. Agartala is among the quickest developing cities in the country and as such, personal loans in the city are growing in popularity as individuals residing there tend to approach banks and financial institutions to fulfil their personal requirements. Residents of Agartala usually resort to personal loans to purchase products or services that they otherwise would not be able to afford on their salaries and savings alone. Some of the most common reasons for the people of Agartala to avail personal loans include home renovation or refurbishment, investment in home appliances or vehicles, to pay for their weddings or the weddings of their loved ones, etc. The reasons for people to avail personal loans are aplenty, but the number of individuals who avail personal loans in Agartala has increased considerably in recent years.

sections.title: How to get a Personal Loan with the Lowest Interest Rate in Agartala

elements.body: There are few factors to consider when applying for a personal loan and availing competitive interest rates. The lender from whom you choose to borrow will determine the interest rate applicable to your credit. But before drafting an application for a personal loan, it is essential to ensure that you have a good credit rating. Credit scores in excess of 750 will make it fairly easy for you to get a relatively high amount with a considerably low interest rate. The higher you're score, the lower your interest rate and vice-versa. It is also essential to carefully assess your financial requirements before applying for a loan as taking an amount higher than you need will mean that you will have to pay interest for an unnecessary sum. Similarly, taking an amount lower than your actual requirements will mean that you will probably have to avail another loan and thereby pay interest towards that as well.

items.question: Is there a processing fee applicable to a personal loan?
items.answer: Yes. Personal loans are usually granted for a fee ranging from 0.5% to 2.5% of the amount you wish to borrow.

items.question: Do salaried individuals have to be of a certain age to avail a personal loan?
items.answer: Yes. Lending institutions require borrowers to be between 21 years of age and 60 years of age to ensure that they have the ability to repay the amount borrowed. They also check for proof of income.

items.question: What is the maximum amount of money that can be borrowed through a personal loan?
items.answer: The maximum amount offered by a bank will depend on a number of factors, but most banks limit their lending to a maximum of Rs.5 lakhs to Rs.30 lakhs.

items.question: How long can I take to repay a personal loan?
items.answer: Customers are free to choose their tenure for a personal loan based on their repayment capacity. In most cases, banks offer a tenure ranging from one year to five years.

items.question: What documents will I need to apply for a personal loans?
items.answer: Banks and financial institutions require your KYC documents, ID proof and address proof along with your bank statement, income proof and a passport sized photograph.

items.question: Will I get a personal loan in Ahmedabad if my credit score is lower than 750?
items.answer: Even with a credit score of 750 and above, there is no proper assurance that your loan application will be accepted. However, if your credit score is lower than 750, you could try some alternative ways of getting your loan approved. You could furnish a collateral to assure your lender that you will repay your loan promptly. If you are earning a high income, you could show your income proof to ensure that you will be able to pay this loan without any struggle albeit your low credit score. You could also include the income of your spouse to improve your eligibility.

items.question: Will I have to get in touch with any middleman to apply for a personal loan?
items.answer: No, you do not need any middleman to get a personal loan. It is very simple to apply for a personal loan. You can visit the official website of your lender or a third-party financial website. You could also visit a branch of your lender.

items.question: Do I have to pay any additional fee or charge for availing a personal loan?
items.answer: You will most probably have to pay a processing fee while applying for your loan. This is a one-time fee.

items.question: What are the types of interest rates charged for personal loans?
items.answer: You can choose from fixed or floating/variable interest rates for your personal loans. Fixed interest rates will remain fixed throughout your loan tenure and floating or variable interest rates will change as per fluctuations in the benchmark rates.

items.question: If I am an existing customer of a bank and if I apply for a personal loan from the same bank, will I get a preferential rate of interest?
items.answer: This will depend on your lender. If you have a salary account or any other account with a particular bank, you may get a low rate of interest as you already have an existing relationship with your lender. Make sure you check with your lender about this special interest rate before you apply for their loan.

elements.body:

In order to get a low-interest rate, you will have to choose your loan amount and loan tenure very carefully. You should fix your loan amount according to your repayment ability, your monthly income, and your monthly expenditures.

If you need to boost your credit score, you should make sure that you do not have any outstanding loan EMIs or unsettled credit card bills. Before you apply for the loan, clear all your dues and get an authorised letter that you have cleared everything.

You should also ensure that you have a steady job record before you apply for a loan. If you keep moving jobs while applying for the loan, your lender may assume that you will not be able to repay the loan promptly due to unstable income. Therefore, before you apply for a personal loan, make sure you have been in the same job for a reasonably long period.

If you apply after checking if you are eligible on the BankBazaar website, your application will get processed more quickly. You will be able to save a lot of time when you evaluate your eligibility. Let us take a look at the salary requirements for personal loans:

  • The minimum age criterion is 21 years old and the maximum age criterion is 65 years old.
  • You should typically be earning more than the minimum income criterion.

items.question: What is the minimum period for a personal loan?
items.answer: The minimum period for a personal loan is 1 year.

items.question: What are the repayment options for a personal loan?
items.answer: The repayment options for a personal loan include paying through EMIs, giving a standing order, giving a post-dated cheque, or electronic transfer.

items.question: Will I be able to include the income of my spouse in order to build my personal loan eligibility?
items.answer: Yes, you can combine the income of your spouse to get a better personal loan deal by increasing your loan eligibility.

items.question: Will I need to create a bank account in order to apply for a personal loan?
items.answer: In case you do not have a bank account with the bank from where you need a personal loan, you do not have to compulsorily get an account with that bank.

items.question: Do I have to choose a flat rate or a floating rate for my personal loan?
items.answer: You can choose any of these 2 interest rates for your personal loan.

sections.title: How to Get a Personal Loan with the Lowest Interest Rate in Bhopal

elements.body:
When you want to apply for a personal loan in Bhopal, there are a few factors which you need to keep in mind as they can play an important role in securing your loan. The format and information provided in your application letter plays a vital role in having a personal loan sanctioned as well as the interest rate offered on the loan amount. Personal loans can be quite easy to apply for with a hassle-free procedure. But there are a few factors that you will have to address and be cautious about when applying for a loan. A good credit score is a key factor and plays a vital role when applying for a loan. A credit score of 750 and above is considered as a good credit score to have and this plays a big role in getting your application for a personal loan approved. The interest rate is also dependent on this criteria. A credit score that is higher than the benchmark that has been set by banks and lenders will fetch a lower interest rate for your loan and vice-versa. If you have a bad credit score, you should do what you can to improve it. This can be done through a number of different ways. Paying off any unpaid premiums or loans is a good way to increase your score.

Another important point to take into consideration is that you should make sure that you do an ample amount of research the loan amount that you require and the bank with which you wish to apply for a loan. You have to have a clear idea about the banking institution that you want to apply for a loan to as well as the amount that you need to borrow from the bank. You can avoid paying an extra amount of money towards the interest levied on a loan amount by ensuring that you do not apply for a loan that exceeds your financial needs. On the other hand, if you borrow an amount that does not meet your financial needs, you might end up applying for another loan amount. This can pose a big problem as managing two loans can be quite risky. You could end up missing out on a payment which would lead to a drastic drop in your credit score.

elements.body:

  • The applicant should be a resident of Bhopal for a minimum period of 1 year.
  • A salaried individual should earn a minimum monthly income of Rs.15,000. The minimum monthly income requirement will vary from one lender to another.
  • The applicant should have a minimum work experience of 2 years.
  • The applicant should not be younger than 21 years.
  • The applicant should not be older than 60 years.
  • Applicants will be required to submit a couple of documents like bank statements, address proof, identity proof, etc.

items.question: How long does a bank take to approve an application for a personal loan?
items.answer: There are some banks that approve loan applications within 48 hours and there are other banks that take at least a week. Usually a loan application is approved within two and seven working days.

items.question: How is a personal loan repaid?
items.answer: The personal loan can be repaid my paying the loan amount back to the bank in the form of Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) via post-dated cheques. You could even link your debit account to your loan if you have taken a loan from a bank where you have a savings bank account. The amount that you need to pay as EMI will automatically get deducted from your savings account.

items.question: Can I get the balance transfer facility with my personal loan?
items.answer: Availing a balance transfer facility depends on the bank. There are some banks that offer the balance transfer facility if the customer has made at least 12 EMI payments. It is advisable that you check with your bank before you apply for the loan.

items.question: Are there any additional charges that an applicant has to pay when he/she gets a personal loan from a bank?
items.answer: Yes, there are a couple of different additional charges. Most banks charge an applicant an interest fee that ranges from 2% to 2.5% of the total amount that they wish to borrow. The fee is deducted from the amount that has to be disbursed to you.

items.question: Can I receive Tax Benefits on my personal loan?
items.answer: Unless the personal loan is used for a home renovation project, tax benefits are not associated with personal loans. You can, however, avail tax benefits under Section 24 of the Income Tax Act on the interest that is paid on the loan but not on the principal amount that is paid.

items.question: What are personal loans?
items.answer: Personal loans are unsecured loans which can be taken to fulfill any personal requirement for which one may not want to use their savings.

items.question: What is meant by an unsecured loan?
items.answer: An unsecured loan, like a personal loan, is one where the borrower is not required to provide any collateral or security in order to avail the loan. However, some lenders may ask the borrower to provide some form of security.

items.question: What is fixed and floating interest rate?
items.answer: A fixed rate of interest is one where the interest chargeable on the loan remains fixed for the entire term of the loan. A floating interest rate arrangement is where the interest rate keeps changing as per the market conditions.

items.question: What is the average tenure of a personal loan?
items.answer: The average tenure of a personal loan range from 1 year to 5 years. It an vary from lender to lender.

items.question: Do lenders allow prepayment on personal loans?
items.answer: Prepayment on a personal loan may or may not be allowed, depending on the lender's terms. Please check with your lender before availing the loan.
