items.question: Am I supposed to submit any security for the acquired car loan?
items.answer: For loans above Rs.25 lakh, security is a must. This is to be in the form of a property.

items.question: My monthly income isn't in line with the eligibility criteria. What do I do?
items.answer: Include your spouse's income to improve your gross monthly income to match upto the eligibility factor. You can also include earnings from other sources such as agriculture, rentals, etc. to increase this number.

items.question: How can I apply for the Federal Bank Personal Car Loan?
items.answer: After ascertaining your eligibility, you can apply at any Federal Bank branch.

items.question: I'am a NRI. Can I apply for a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: Yes, you can. However, ensure that you have all the documents required to confirm upon your NRI status, employment and repayment capabilities. The application process itself is similar to that of the other applicants.

items.question: Who can apply for a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: Corporates and Resident Individuals can apply for a car loan from Federal Bank.

items.question: Can NRIs apply for a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: Yes, NRIs can apply for a car loan from Federal Bank.

items.question: What type of cars can I purchase using the car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: You can purchase either a new car or a used one using the car loan from Federal Bank.

items.question: What is the rate of interest on Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: The rate of interest on Federal Bank car loan ranges between 9.88 percent per annum and 11.33 percent per annum.

items.question: What should be my minimum income to be eligible for a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: To be eligible for a car loan from Federal Bank, your minimum income (take home) should be at least Rs.7500 after deducting EMI of the proposed car loan.

items.question: Will Federal Bank allow me to include the income of my spouse to apply for the car loan?
items.answer: Yes, Federal Bank will allow you to include the income of your spouse to apply for the car loan.

items.question: Can I club my income from agriculture or rent with my regular income when I apply for a Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can club your income from agriculture or rent with your regular income when you apply for a Federal Bank car loan. This is allowed only if your minimum income is at least Rs.40, 000 per month (including the income from agriculture or rent).

items.question: Do I have to submit any documents when I apply for a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer:
Yes residing in India, you have to submit the following documents when you apply for a car loan from Federal Bank –

  • Identity Proof
  • Address Proof
  • Passport Size photograph (recent)
  • Employment or Business Proof
  • Income Proof

Apart from these, you have to provide other documents that the bank requests you to submit.

items.question: I am a Salaried Employee. What documents am I supposed to submit as income proof when I apply for a Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer:
If you are a Salaried Employee, then you have to submit the following documents as income proof when you apply for a Federal Bank car loan –

  • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns of last two years
  • Salary Slip of the last 3 months
  • Bank Statement of last 6 months

items.question: I am a Self – Employed Individual. What documents am I supposed to submit as income proof when I apply for a Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer:
If you are a Self – Employed Individual, residing in India then you have to submit the following documents as income proof when you apply for a Federal Bank car loan –

  • Business profile
  • Profit and Loss Statement
  • Balance Sheet
  • Income Tax Returns or Tax Paid Challans

items.question: I am a Non – Resident Indian (NRI). What documents am I supposed to submit as income proof when I apply for a Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer:
If you are a Non – Resident Indian (NRI), then you have to submit the following documents as income proof when you apply for a Federal Bank car loan –

  • Employment or Business Proof (if possible attested by the Embassy)
  • Salary Certificate
  • In case of Business, you have to provide the Balance Sheet
  • External Account Statement of the recent 6 months
  • NRI Account Statement of 2 years

items.question: Can people apply for a Federal Bank car loan online?
items.answer: Yes, people can apply for a Federal Bank car loan online.

items.question: How to apply for a Federal Bank car loan online?
items.answer: To apply for a Federal Bank car loan online, you have to first open the website of the bank and click on 'Apply Online for Car Loan' under the 'Solutions for You' tab on the homepage. On the next page, click on 'Apply Online' and select 'Vehicle Loans'. Fill the application form and submit it.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure for Federal Bank car loan for new cars?
items.answer: The maximum tenure for Federal Bank car loan for new cars is 84 months (in case of salaried borrowers).

items.question: What is the maximum tenure for Federal Bank car loan for used cars?
items.answer: The maximum tenure for Federal Bank car loan for used cars is 60 months.

items.question: How old should a used car be for me to get a car loan for purchasing it from Federal Bank?
items.answer: A used car should be maximum 3 years old for you get a car loan from Federal Bank.

items.question: How is the depreciation on used car calculated by Federal Bank?
items.answer: The depreciation on used car is calculated by Federal Bank using the Straight Line Method. It is calculated at the rate of 15 percent for the 1st year and at the rate of 10 percent for the succeeding years.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure of Federal Bank car loan for new cars purchased by Salaried Employees?
items.answer: The maximum tenure of Federal Bank car loan is 84 months for new cars purchased by Salaried Employees.

items.question: How can I repay my Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: You can repay your Federal Bank car loan in Equated Monthly Installments (EMI).

items.question: Does Federal Bank charge a processing fee on car loan?
items.answer:
Yes, Federal Bank charges the following amount as processing fee on car loan –

  • If the loan is up to Rs.5, 00, 000, the processing fee is Rs.1500
  • If the loan is more than Rs.5, 00, 000, the processing fee is Rs.2500

items.question: Can I prepay my Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can prepay your Federal Bank car loan. When you prepay, you have to pay a small prepayment fee to the bank.

items.question: What is the prepayment penalty on Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: There are no pre closure charges for individuals.

items.question: What is the late payment penalty for Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: The late payment penalty for Federal Bank car loan is 2 percent of the amount that is overdue. This fee has to be paid if the borrower delays the payment by more than 30 days.

items.question: I have a very good CIBIL score. Will it help me in getting a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: If you have a very good CIBIL score, then it will make it very easy for you to get a car loan from Federal Bank. Banks consider people with a high CIBIL score to be financially responsible and are willing to trust them with their money.

items.question: Does Federal Bank charge any fee for CIBIL report and check in case of car loan?
items.answer: No, Federal Bank does not charge any fee for CIBIL report and check in case of car loan.

items.question: What is the verification process of Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: The verification process of Federal Bank car loan is very simple. The bank first checks if the applicant is eligible for the car loan or not. If he or she is eligible, then they check and verify all the documents they asked for from the applicant. If everything is in order, then they approve the car loan quickly.

items.question: Can I calculate the EMI that I have to pay every month as part of the proposed Federal Bank car loan before applying for it?
items.answer: Yes, you can calculate the EMI that you have to pay every month as part of the proposed Federal Bank car loan before applying for it. You can use the Loan Calculator on the website of the bank for this purpose.

items.question: Can I get the loan amortization details before applying for a car loan from Federal Bank?
items.answer: Yes, you can get the loan amortization details before applying for a car loan from Federal Bank. You can calculate the loan amortization using the 'Loan Amortization' calculator on the website of the bank.

items.question: How much time does it take for Federal Bank to process car loan applications?
items.answer: Federal Bank processes the car loan applications very quickly if the applicants pass the verification process.

items.question: Who can I contact to get more information on Federal Bank car loan?
items.answer: To get more information on the Federal Bank car loan, you can contact the customer care department of the bank. You can reach them by calling up on the toll – free number of the bank. You can also visit any branch of the bank to get further details about their car loan.

sections.title: Factors Affecting HDFC Bank Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
The eligibility for availing a HDFC Bank car will depend on the below-given factors:

  • Income - If your income is on the higher side, there are good chances of your eligibility for HDFC Bank car loan being higher. This is because a higher income indicates higher repayment capacity. To be eligible for HDFC Bank car loan, your yearly income should be at least Rs.3 lakh.
  • Loan amount - Your eligibility for a car loan from HDFC will be higher if you apply for a lower loan amount simply because if the loan amount is lower, the bank knows that the loan will be paid off quicker. Hence, they will be more confident to lend to you.
  • Repayment tenure - Choosing a longer repayment tenure can lower your eligibility for a car loan as it might give an impression to the bank that your ability to pay the loan is lower. This is because longer repayment tenure results in lower EMIs and the lender may tend to think that you cannot afford to pay higher EMIs. Therefore, the bank may be reluctant to lend to you.
  • Credit score - This is an important factor that most banks, including HDFC Bank, consider when determining your eligibility for a car loan. A credit score of 750 and above is considered a healthy credit score by most lenders. If you have a healthy credit score, banks will be happy to offer you a car loan and hence, your eligibility will be higher.
  • Relationship with the bank - As stated earlier, HDFC Bank offers instant car loans to their existing customers through the ZipDrive feature. This feature allows HDFC Bank customers to can avail loans instantly, at their convenience, with negligible documentation. This indicates that your relationship with the bank is an important factor while determining your eligibility.

sections.title: How to Increase Your Eligibility for HDFC Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
• Opt for a shorter tenure - When you choose a shorter repayment tenure, the EMI that you will be paying each month will be higher. This is an indication of your higher repayment capacity which will lead to banks feeling confident to lend to you. So, if you wish to boost your eligibility for a car loan, opt for a shorter repayment tenure.
  • Keep your credit score in check - If you wish to increase your eligibility for HDFC Bank car loan, make sure that you maintain a credit score of over 750. You can use the Free Credit Score tool to check and maintain a healthy credit score. Checking your credit score regularly can let you take corrective measures to improve it if your score is low or give you confidence to approach the bank is it is high.
  • Maintain a low debt-to-income ratio - A low debt-to-income ratio means that you have a good balance between your earnings and spends. Before banks lend to you, they will check how much percentage of your earnings goes in paying your debts and a low debt-to-income ratio will be an indication of your high repayment capacity. To enhance your eligibility for a car loan, you should ensure that you maintain a low debt-to-income ratio.
  • Apply for a loan for a lower amount - By applying for a loan for a lower amount, you can increase your eligibility for HDFC Bank car loan. A lower loan amount means that the loan will be repaid sooner and hence, the chances of you being eligible for a loan is higher.

sections.title: How to Calculate EMI on HDFC Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Before you avail a car loan from HDFC Bank, you may want to know how much amount you will be paying towards the loan each month. This is simply known as EMIs or equated monthly instalments and it offers an easy way to repay your car loan. By calculating the EMI, you will be able to budget your monthly expenses better.

You can calculate the EMI for your car loan by using the below-given formula:

E = P*r*[(1+r) ^n/((1+r) ^n-1)]

In the above formula, E denotes the EMI, P the principal amount, r the interest rate and n the number of years or tenure of the loan.

You can also calculate the EMI by using the EMI Calculator tool wherein you just need to enter the loan amount, interest rate, repayment tenure, processing fee, etc. The tool will calculate the EMI and display it to you.

faq.title: FAQs on HDFC Bank Car Loan

items.question: What are the EMI options available on HDFC Bank car loan?
items.answer: Answer: HDFC Bank offers two EMI options - Step-up EMI and Balloon EMI. The step-up EMI option allows you to gradually increase the EMI amount over the loan tenure. On the other hand, the balloon EMI option lets you pay lower EMI amounts during the initial tenure and a higher lump sum amount at the end of the loan tenure.

items.question: Can I foreclose my HDFC Bank car loan and if yes, is there a penalty fee?
items.answer: Answer: Yes, you can foreclose your HDFC Bank car loan and you will not be charged any penalty fee for the same.

items.question: Can I get a top-up loan on my existing HDFC Bank car loan?
items.answer: Answer: You can get a top-up loan on your existing HDFC Bank car loan only if you are an existing customer of the bank. Existing customers need not provide any documentation for availing top-up loan on their car loans.

items.question: Do I need to provide a guarantor to avail a car loan from HDFC Bank?
items.answer: Answer: You need not provide any guarantor for availing HDFC Bank car loan if you meet the minimum income criteria. However, if you do not meet the income criteria, you may be asked to provide a guarantor or co-applicant.

items.question: Does HDFC Bank offer financing for all types of car models?
items.answer: Answer: There is no restriction on the type of car that can be financed by HDFC Bank car loan. Financing is offered for most of the passenger cars and multi-utility vehicles manufactured by top automobile makers in India.

items.question: Will ICICI let me prepay or foreclose my car loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can prepay or foreclose your car loan at a charge of 5% + GST on the remaining principal loan amount.

items.question: What are the repayment options available with this car loan?
items.answer: You can pay the car loan EMIs in a variety of ways. If you are an existing ICICI Bank customer, you can opt for the direct debit facility or ECS. Otherwise, you may also make the EMI payment via issuing post-dated cheques drawn in favour of ICICI Bank Ltd.

items.question: Is there a provision to update my contact details on my ICICI Bank loan account?
items.answer: Yes, you can easily update your contact details such as your email ID, mobile number, mailing address, etc., by walking into any ICICI Bank branch. When submitting your application, do remember to carry a valid photo ID proof.

items.question: What are some factors which influence the interest rate for a new car loan?
items.answer: The interest rate for new car loans is dependent on some factors like the tenure of the loan, the car you're planning to get, and your relationship with the bank, among other factors.

items.question: Are used car loan interest rates influenced by any factors?
items.answer: Yes, interest rates for a used car loan can vary depending on some factors like the age and segment of the car you're purchasing, the loan product type you are availing – refinance, top-up loan, and the loan term, to name a few.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria of IndusInd Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
The car loan facility offered by IndusInd Bank can be availed by salaried employees and self-employed individuals (income and non-income based). The eligibility criteria that must be met for both the categories are mentioned below:

Salaried employees

  • You must be at least 21 years old at the time of applying
  • The maximum age of the applicant can be 60 years.
  • You must make an income of at least Rs.2,50,000 in a year.
  • You must have at least 3 years of work experience. At the time of applying for the car loan, you must have worked for at least 1 year in the current company.
  • You must have lived for at least 3 years in the current city and at least for 1 year in the current residence. You are eligible to avail a car loan if you are living in your own house.

Self-employed individuals (Income-based)

  • You must be between the ages of 21 years and 65 years.
  • You must have lived for at least 3 years in the current city and at least for 1 year in the current residence. You are eligible to avail a car loan if you are living in your own house.
  • Your CIBIL score should be more than 600 and you should not have a Caution or Negative profile.
  • You must make a minimum net profit of Rs.2,00,000 in a year.

Self-employed individuals (Non-Income based)

  • You must be between the ages of 21 years and 65 years.
  • Your CIBIL score should be more than 600 and you should not have a Caution or Negative profile.
  • You must have lived for at least 3 years in the current city and at least for 1 year in the current residence. You are eligible to avail a car loan if you are living in your own house.
  • Business ownership proof along with a minimum of 3 years of business stability must be provided.

Depending on the category the applicant falls under, the documents that must be submitted will vary. The documents that must be submitted for the different categories are mentioned below:

Salaried employees

Self-employed individuals (Income and Non-income based)

items.question: Should you provide collateral or security to avail the loan?
items.answer: No, you need not provide security or collateral in order to avail the loan.

items.question: Should you have an account with IndusInd Bank in order to avail a car loan?
items.answer: It is not mandatory for you to have an account with IndusInd Bank in order to avail a car loan.

items.question: Are there any special schemes provided in case you cannot submit the income documents?
items.answer: Yes, IndusInd Bank provides special schemes in case you are not able to furnish the income documents.

items.question: Is it possible for you to take a loan on an existing car?
items.answer: Yes, you will be able to take a loan on an existing car. However, the car must be hypothecated to IndusInd Bank once the loan sanction process is complete and before the loan amount is disbursed.

items.question: What is the method to repay the loan?
items.answer: You can repay the loan by providing post-dated cheques or via ECS.

Magma possesses a diversified product portfolio: loans for cars and utility vehicles, commercial vehicles, construction equipment, tractors, used vehicles, SME businesses, mortgage finance as well as gold loan financing, housing finance and general insurance. They believe that no dream should go unfulfilled because of the lack of funds. Magma Fincorp provides loans for personal and commercial-use cars or utility vehicles, both new and used. Through BankBazaar, you can check your eligibility for a Magma car loan in seconds by filling in a short form. You can also apply for the loan online. All you have to do is to follow some simple steps to get attractive deals.

sections.title: Magma Fincorp Limited Overview

elements.body: Magma Fincorp Limited (MFL) is one of the leading non-banking financial companies based in Kolkata and registered with the Reserve Bank of India as an Asset Finance Company. It was incorporated in 1989 and is a RBI recognized Asset Finance Company. MFL has approximately 275 branches in India and also has a well-established presence in rural and semi-rural India. The company offers car loans, home loans, refinance, used vehicle loans, SME loans, commercial vehicle loans & more.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

sections.title: About Magma Car Loan

elements.body: Magma Fincorp provides car loans to its customers to help them purchase a wide variety of passenger cars and multi-utility vehicles which are available through Indian car and utility-vehicle dealerships. The tenure for these loans range between 12 to 60 months. Salaried employees are offered the option of an 84-month repayment period. Magma Car Finance is offered with special privileges like personalized service and streamlined documentation that enables the customer to acquire the product faster.

sections.title: Why Choose Magma Car Loan?

elements.body: Magma Fincorp provides some unique benefits to its customers, like flexible repayment options, quick processing with least possible documentation and up to full value of the car is financed (under certain conditions as laid down by the company).

sections.title: Features & Benefits of Magma Car Loan

elements.body:
• Tractable documentation and fast processing.
  • Flexible loan repayment options monthly cash instalments, auto debit, ECS and post dated cheques.
  • The company offers excellent customer service as well as end-to-end doorstep service.
  • Easy loans are provided to existing Magma customers with good repayment records for 12 months or more, without them having to submit their income documents.
  • Attractive and incomparable interest rates.
  • Loans are offered for purchase of personal and commercial-use cars or utility vehicles.
  • Customers can receive funds up to 100% of the total price of the car.
  • Salaried professionals have the option to avail a loan which is up to three-times their annual salary and self-employed professionals can avail car loans up to six-times their annual income.

sections.title: Car Loan Schemes offered by Magma:

elements.body:
Tatkal Loan Scheme:

Under this scheme, for loans worth 60-65% of ex-showroom prices on any car for commercial or personal use, the customer just has to submit their KYC documents along with latest bank statement.

Magma Privilege Scheme:

This scheme can be availed by existing Magma customers with a consistently good record of repayment for last 12 months or more. They are eligible for new loans with 1.5-times higher EMIs than that of the current loan, without having to re-submit their income documents.

Agri Land-based Funding:

This scheme offers a loan of up to 80% of the ex-showroom price on a new vehicle, if the applicant has agricultural landholding which are between three to five acres.

No Income Proof Scheme:

An applicant can get a loan with their business and property proof documents for the last two years alone, under this scheme. The applicant can avail a loan of 75% of the ex-showroom price for a B-segment car, or 65% for a C-segment car.

sections.title: Magma Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
Magma offers car loans to salaried and self-employed applicants who meet the following eligibility criteria:

Salaried Customers:
  • Salaried customers should be employed under the same company/employer for a minimum period of two years.
  • The minimum age of the applicant should be at least 21 years when the car loan tenure commences and under 60 years or at retirement age, whichever is lower, when the car loan tenure concludes.
  • The annual salary of the applicant should be Rs.1,50,000 and above.
  • The applicant must be residing in the same address for at least one year.
Self Employed Individuals
  • The applicant should have been in the same business for a minimum period of two years.
  • He/she should meet the age criteria and be 21-years-old or above at the beginning of the loan tenure and under 67 years of age at the end of the loan tenure.
  • The applicant should have a minimum income of at least Rs. 1,00,000 annually.
  • The applicant must be residing in the same address for one year at least.

items.title: Documentation required for a Magma Car Loan
items.body:
Salaried

If the applicant is salaried she/he needs to submit the following documents:

  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • Any one of the following documents:
    • Previous 2 years' Form 16 and payslip of the last month.
    • Proof of employment of being in the same organization for the past two years as well as last three months' payslips.
    • Salary certificate from the organization where the applicant is employed with corresponding proof of funds credited in their bank account.
Self-employed

Self-employed applicants need to submit:

  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • Previous 2 years' IT returns along with income computation.
  • 3 - 6 months' bank statement.
Applicants without income proof need to submit:
  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Proof of business applicable for the last 2 years.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • If applicant is an agriculturist, he/she has to submit proof of agricultural land holding.

items.title: Magma Car Loan Interest Rates and Charges:
items.body:
1. Interest rate

    Depending on various factors, Magma car loan interest rates vary from 12% to 16%.

  2. Foreclosure charges
    • Loan prepayment can be done with a 5% of the principal outstanding charged as prepayment fee after 6 months of availing the loan.
    • Foreclosures are not allowed within 6 months from date of availing the car loan. Lock in period charges have to be paid if foreclosures are made within 6 months, if it is allowed by the company under exceptional circumstances.
  3. Late payment penalty is 3% per month.
  4. Magma Car loan processing fees are as follows:
    • For loans up to Rs. 2.50 lacs, Rs. 3500 is chargeable as processing fee.
    • For loans ranging from Rs. 2.51 lacs to 5 lacs, Rs. 4050 is chargeable as processing fee.
    • Loans over and above Rs. 5 lacs is charged a processing fee of Rs. 4625.
    • On select schemes there is no processing fee.

items.title: How to calculate EMI for Magma Car Loans?
items.body:
BankBazaar.com offers smart and easy tools to calculate EMI. Customers can calculate EMI for Magma car loans by going to the BankBazaar home page and under the Finance Tools main menu choose EMI calculators. This EMI calculator can help customers to calculate monthly EMIs to be paid towards the Car Loan . BankBazaar's car loan EMI calculator is a reliable tool designed to quickly calculate the car loan EMI payment details. The step-by-step process to calculate their Magma car loan EMIs through BankBazaar.com is annotated below:

  1. Select the 'Finance Tools' drop down menu from the main page and select the EMI calculator option. Clicking on this link will lead you directly to the EMI calculator page.
  2. Scales are available on the EMI calculator page representing different ranges such as 'Loan Amount' and 'Tenure'. Mark the requisite details on the scales as per your requirements to help the tool calculate the EMI options available.
  3. After that, the customer has to enter details such as interest rate charged by Magma for car loans, along with the processing fee. The default value is already marked in the field and can be changed if required.
  4. Clicking on 'calculate' option will provide the customer with all the details related to the Magma car loan EMI payment along with the breakup of the total interest to be paid.

Check Magma Bank Car Loan EMI

items.question: What type of four wheelers can be purchased using Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase most multi-utility vehicles and passenger cars available at Indian utility - vehicles and car dealership. Magma Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase both new and used utility vehicles and cars.

items.question: What are the tenure options for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan customers can choose a suitable tenure option between 12 months to 60 months. Salaried customers can take up to 84 months to repay the car loan.

items.question: What are the types of Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Magma Bank offers 4 types of car loan schemes, each carefully crafted to suit varied requirements of customers. The types of Magma Bank Car Loan are as follows.

  • Tatkal car loan scheme
  • Magma Privilege Scheme
  • No Income Proof Scheme
  • Agri land based car loan

items.question: What is the maximum quantum offered under Magma Bank Car Loan schemes?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers financing up to 100% the value of car.

items.question: How long does Magma Bank take to process car loan applications?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan applications will be processed in less than 4 hours, provided the customer has submitted all required documents and completed all formalities.

items.question: Does Magma Bank offer loan for four wheelers intended for commercial use?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank Car Loan is also offered for new and used commercial vehicles.

items.question: What is the maximum car loan eligibility?
items.answer: Under Magma Bank Car Loan, salaried professionals can borrow up to three times their annual salary and self employed professionals can borrow up to six times their annual income.

items.question: What are the eligibility criteria that a salaried applicant must satisfy to be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A salaried applicant must satisfy the following conditions to be able to apply for a Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • The annual income of the applicant must be at least Rs. 1, 50,000.
  • The applicant must be at least 21 years old at the start of car loan tenure and must be under 60 years or retirement age, whichever is lower, at the end of tenure.
  • The applicant must have been employed by the same employer for at least 2 years.
  • The applicant must have residential stability for at least a year.

items.question: I am a self-employed professional. What eligibility conditions do I have to fulfill to be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Self employed applicants must satisfy the eligibility criteria given below to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • The applicant must be earning a minimum of Rs. 1, 00,00 per year.
  • He must have been in the same business for a period of minimum 2 years.
  • The applicant must be at least 21 years old at the start of loan tenure and not more than 67 years at the end of tenure.
  • The applicant must have residential stability for at least 1 year.

items.question: What repayment options are available for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers an array of flexible repayment options like auto debit, ECS, Post dated cheques (PDCs) and monthly cash instalments for the customers to pay EMI.

items.question: How do I apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Customers can apply online through Magma Bank web portal or visit the nearest physical branch to apply for a car loan.

items.question: Can customers apply online for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, customers can apply online for Magma Bank Car Loan.

items.question: Do I need a guarantor to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No, a guarantor is not required for Magma Bank Car Loan.

items.question: What is the tatkal loan scheme under Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: In tatkal loan scheme, car loans worth upto 70% of ex-showroom price on any four wheeler, MUV or SUV for personal or commercial use are offered to customers after they submit the KYC documents along with latest bank statement. This ensures that the car loan is processed swiftly.

items.question: I have no income proof documents. Can I apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, applicants with no income proof can apply for Magma Bank Car Loan under "No income proof car loan scheme". All the applicant has to submit is the property proof documents and income proof documents for the last two years to avail a loan of up to 65% of ex-showroom price for any C segment car and up to 75% the ex-showroom price for any B segment car.

items.question: What is agri based funding scheme under Magma Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Under agri based funding scheme, applicants will be able to get up to 80% of the ex-showroom price of a new car if they have an agricultural land between 3 to 5 acres.

items.question: What is Magma Privilege scheme under Magma Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Magma Privilege scheme is a special car loan scheme for existing customers who have maintained a clear repayment records for the last 12 months or more. Such customers are eligible for fresh car loans with EMS at 1.5 times of current loan and they will be able to secure the loan without having to submit all documents again.

items.question: I am a salaried applicant. What documents do I have to submit for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A salaried applicant must submit the following documents to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • One year residence stability proof
  • KYC documents including address proof, identity proof, signature and date of birth proof.
  • Any one of the income documents - salary certificates with statements showing salary credit in bank account, payslip for last 3 months with proof of employment in concerned organization for two years and form 16 for last two years plus payslip for last month.

items.question: What documents do self-employed professionals have to submit for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Self employed applicants have to submit the following documents while applying for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • One year residence stability proof
  • Bank statements for last three to six months
  • IT Returns for the last two years with income computation
  • KYC documents - identity proof, address proof, signature proof and Date of birth proof.

items.question: I have no income proof documents. What other documents do I have to submit while applying for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
If the applicant has no income proof, he must submit the documents given below to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • Proof of Agri land holding, if the applicant is an agriculturist
  • Business proof for last 2 years
  • KYC documents - Proof of address, ID proof, signature proof and Date of Birth proof

items.question: I have been in my current residence for only six months. Is it possible for me to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No. In order to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan, you have to submit proof for resident stability for at least one year. If you are residing at own or parental house, funding will be made available with residence stability of only six months.

items.question: I do not hold a Magma Bank account. Is it still possible for me to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: To apply for Magma Bank Car Loan, you will have to open a new Magma Bank account. But, you will not require recent transactions to apply for a car loan under Tatkal scheme.

items.question: Will I be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan if there are no Magma branch offices in my area?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers car loans for customers living within a radius of 125 kilometres from any of the 280 plus offices across India.

items.question: For my loan payment structure, will I be required to select from post dated cheques or equated monthly instalments?
items.answer: No. Customers can take a car loan by submitting at least five security Post Dated Cheques (PDCs) and by making the payment of monthly instalments by direct deposit or cash at Magma Bank branches.

items.question: How do I find out my Magma Bank Car Loan EMI?
items.answer: You can find out your monthly EMI by using an online car loan EMI calculator available on BankBazaar. You will have to enter details like principal loan amount, interest rate and tenure in months to find out the EMI amount.

items.question: Does Magma Bank offer customer support services for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank car loan borrowers can get in touch with the bank by filling out a form online. After the form is submitted, a Magma Bank representative will contact you. Also, you can visit any of the nearest Magma Bank branches to get your queries answered.

items.question: I am an agriculturist. Will I be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, agriculturists can apply for Magma Bank Car Loan under the Agri Land based funding scheme.

items.question: Can I prepay Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank allows prepayments for car loans after 6 months of taking the loan.

items.question: Will I incur any penalty if I prepay my Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, for prepayments, Magma Bank will charge a nominal penalty of 5% fee on the outstanding amount.

items.question: Can I use Magma Bank Car Loan to purchase a vehicle from foreign auto dealerships?
items.answer: No, Magma Bank Car Loan can be used only to purchase vehicle sold at Indian car dealerships.

elements.body: Allahabad Bank, a renowned public sector bank in India, has a diverse range of loan products in its line-up. If you are looking forward to owning your dream car anytime soon, you may consider the car loan offered by Allahabad Bank. The bank offers car loans with flexible terms based on the requirements of its customers.

sections.title: Compare Allahabad Bank car loans

elements.body:
Loan TypeInterest RateLoan AmountProcessing Fees
New car loan8.80% - 11.05%Up to 3 times monthly income/salary0.50% (Max. Rs. 8696)
Pre-owned car loan (not more than 3 years old)9.55% - 11.55%Up to 3 times monthly salary0.50% (Max. Rs. 8696)

sections.title: Why Choose Allahabad Bank Car Loan?

elements.body:
With Allahabad Bank, you can enjoy flexible loan tenures and hassle-free EMI deals.

The loan scheme is available for all kinds of customers irrespective of their professions. Some of the notable benefits of choosing Allahabad Bank are listed as follows:

  • The loan quantum offered by the bank is determined by the annual salary of the borrower. This way, borrowers can get a loan amount within their repayment capability.
  • The bank offers financing for up to 85% of the on-road price of the vehicle. For used vehicles, the agreed purchase price or the vehicle's market valuation is used as the factor for determining the loan quantum.
  • The flexible tenure offered by the bank stretches up to 84 months. Customers can choose the tenure based on their repayment ability.

sections.title: Fees and charges

elements.body:
The bank charges a prepayment penalty of 3% of the outstanding loan amount. Processing fee on a car loan is waived for employees of Allahabad Bank. The bank does not charge any documentation charges or inspection charges for car loans.

Eligibility for Allahabad Bank car loans

The car loan eligibility criteria may differ according to the type of employment of the applicant:

  • A Salaried Person should have a minimum gross monthly income of Rs.25,000.
  • An agriculturist must have a minimum of 5 acres of irrigated land holding.
  • A businessman/professional and self-employed person must be an IT assessee. IT requirement can be waived if full collateral security is produced.
  • Retired individuals drawing a monthly pension of Rs.15,000 and above can apply for car loans from Allahabad Bank.
  • A firm or company must be in profit for the past 2 years and the net profit and cash generation should be sufficient to repay the car loan.
  • The applicant must be a permanent employee and the car loan should be repaid minimum 3 months before his or her date of retirement.
  • Non-salaried persons/retired individuals can repay the loan before reaching 70 years of age.
  • Firms and companies must be in existence for minimum 2 years.

sections.title: Documents Needed to Apply for an Allahabad Car Loan

elements.body:
• Photo ID and age proof
  • Signed application form with photograph
  • Residence proof
  • Last 6 months bank statement
  • Documentation for salaried applicants:
  • Last 3 months' salary - slips
  • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  • Documentation for self-employed applicants:
  • Last 3 years Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
  • Last 3 years CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account
  • Overview of Allahabad bank car loan

items.question: How can I remove the hypothecation on my vehicle after the repayment of loans?
items.answer:
After the full payment of all car loan EMI dues, the car loan is considered to be closed. Once the payment is complete, you need to get the following things:

  • No-objection certificate from the lender
  • No-objection certificate from the insurer
  • Form 35 duly filled

All these documents must be submitted to the Regional Transport Office (RTO) to remove the hypothecation on your vehicle.

items.question: What is the processing time for car loans in Allahabad Bank?
items.answer: The bank promises quick processing time for people subscribing to car loans. You can get your approval within a day or two. The loan amount will be disbursed within a week in most cases.

items.question: Do I need a guarantor to get a car loan from Allahabad Bank?
items.answer: For loans under Rs.20 lakh, there is no need for a guarantor to obtain a car loan from Allahabad Bank. The value of the vehicle acts as security against the loan amount. If a non-earning spouse is taking the loan, his/her earning spouse must act as the co-borrower with the bank. However, if the loan amount is more than Rs.20 lakh, one person must act as a guarantor for the loan. Moreover, collateral security must be provided as per the bank norms.

items.question: How can I apply for a car loan with Allahabad Bank?
items.answer: Allahabad Bank offers multiple ways for customers to apply for a car loan. You may visit the official website of the bank at https://www.allahabadbank.in and apply for a car loan. You may also visit the branch office and apply for a loan.

items.question: Is it possible to sell my car before completing the loan payment?
items.answer: No. Ownership transfer is done only after you complete the EMI payments and receive the no-objection certificate from the lender. Till you finish your loan payment, the vehicle will be hypothecated to the lender. Hence, it is not possible to sell your vehicle during the loan tenure.

items.question: What happens if I don't pay my EMIs on time?
items.answer: If you miss one or two EMI payments during the loan tenure, you need to pay the outstanding amount with additional penalty charges as soon as possible. It is possible to get back on track in this case. However, if you have defaulted multiple times, the bank will repossess your vehicle and claim the outstanding loan amount.

items.title: Allahabad Bank Personal Loan Interest Rates

elements.body: Andhra Bank is a medium-sized public sector bank, with a network of 2000+ branches, 15 extension counters, 38 satellite offices and 1563 automated teller machines. The products and services provided by the bank mainly categorised into businesses of Retail, Corporate, NRI, MSME, and Agricultural industries. Under the Retail Business, the bank offers deposits, loans, cards, DMAT services, insurance, and mutual funds to individual customers. Under the Corporate Business, the bank offers loans & advances, project appraisals, and loan syndication. Under the NRI business segment, the bank offers Deposit schemes, loans, remittance services, and investment services to the non-resident Indians. To know more, follow some simple steps given below to get best car loan interest rate.

sections.title: Documentation needed to apply for an Andhra Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
1. Signed application form with photograph
  2. Photo ID and age proof
  3. Residence proof
  4. Last 6 months bank statement
  5. Documentation for salaried applicants:
    • Last 3 months salary – slips
    • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  6. Documentation for self-employed applicants:
    • Last 3 years Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
    • Last 3 years CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account

sections.title: Andhra Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Andhra Bank Car Loan Details - (Updated on $date)
Interest Rate9.45% p.a. for new car loans and 12.15% p.a. for used car loans.
Processing feeRs. 1,000 - Rs. 25,000
Loan TenureUp to 7 years
Pre Closure charges1% on the outstanding balance at the time of prepayment.
Guarantor RequirementNo, however, a third-party co-applicant is accepted by the bank while the hypothecation of vehicle purchased serves as security.

sections.title: Overview About Andhra Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Andhra Bank is one of the prominent Public Sector Banks in the country. With heavy presence in south India, specially in the state of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, the bank provides a wide range of banking services and financial products across sectors such as Retail, Corporate, NRI, MSME and Agriculture. In the loan portfolio for the Retail sector, Andhra Bank extends loans for Housing, Education, Personal needs along with Vehicle loans for both two wheelers and cars.

Car loans are provided at pleasing interest rates and attractive terms. Financing options are available for both new and used cars.

sections.title: Why choose Andhra Bank Car Loan

elements.body: Car loan is provided to all income groups with a wide tenure to choose from. With a maximum financing of up to 85% of the loan amount, your dream of owning a car is burden proof. The bank provides car loans up to Rs.50 lacs, helping you to procure a car of your choice without worrying about the quantum of finance.

sections.title: Features of Car Loan From Andhra Bank

elements.body:
Quantum of Finance

The loan amount is determined on the basis where the maximum permissible car loan EMI should not exceed 60% of net salary of the applicant and 70% for the non salaried class. Up to 85% of the "”On Road” value of the car is financed by the bank.

Flexible Repayment Tenure

The loan amount and interest charges can be repaid in up to 84 EMIs. An unique feature from Andhra bank is the option to also make the repayment in quarterly/half yearly/yearly basis. This kind of flexibility ensures that you get to choose a term of your choice, as per your budgeting requirement.

Easy Documentation

With just basic documents to meet the KYC guidelines along with paperwork relating to the proposed car, the application process is largely hassle free.

Competitive Interest Rates

The bank follows the system of base rate linked system of calculating rate of interest for car loans. The present rate of interest for loan tenure up to 36 months is base rate + 0.50% and for loans above this threshold, the rate is Base Rate + 0.75%. Highly competitive, the rates offered by Andhra Bank goes soft on your wallet.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

items.title: Andhra Bank Car Loan Interest Rate
items.body:
1. year MCLR + 0.70 % for new four-wheeler loans
  2. year MCLR + 3.45% for used four-wheeler loans

Based on the concept of Reducing Balance, the interest is applied only on the outstanding balance component which reduces the interest burden substantially. Existing Home Loan customers of Andhra Bank qualify for a concession of 0.25% on the actual rate. Ex employees of the bank and applicants belonging to certain sectors/categories can be eligible for a concession as well.

Do inquire with the nearest branch or contact the customer service wing for latest interest rates before forwarding your application.

items.title: Eligibility Criteria for a Car Loan from Andhra Bank
items.body:
• Individuals with a minimum annual gross income of Rs.1 lakh.
  • Companies, Firms, Trusts and Societies holding an account with the bank also qualify.

Further information on eligibility will be provided by the bank at the time of application.

items.title: How to calculate EMI on Andhra Bank Car Loan
items.body:
Ascertaining the EMI amount before availing a car loan not only helps in gauging your obligations, but also guides in choosing the best terms that syncs with your budgeting requirement. The Car Loan EMI Calculatorunder the Finance Tools section of this website helps you with the task.

Before you begin, keep handy, details such as the loan amount, proposed tenure, Rate of interest and processing fee(if any). Use the Slider 1 to choose the Loan Amount and Slider 2 to select the Tenure. Enter the Interest Rate and Processing Fee in the fields that follow and click "Calculate”. Elaborate details such as the EMI amount followed by the Amortisation table is displayed on the screen.

Use the financials to analyse the various facets involved in the car loan to make key decisions.

What are the advantages of calculating EMI before applying for a car loan?

Car loans are repaid through Equated Monthly Installments (EMIs) over a specified period of time called the loan tenure. EMI includes the principal and interest amount. Calculating loan EMI can help you find out how much your car loan will cost you monthly. This, in turn, can help you create a monthly budget so that you can maintain a low debt-to-income ratio wherein the EMI doesn't exceed more than 50% of your income. Why is it important to maintain a low debt-to-income ratio? It will ensure that you don't default on your car loan.

Andhra Bank Car Loan EMI Calculator is a free, online tool that is simple and easy to use. You can get instant and accurate results compared to calculating EMI manually or using an Excel Sheet. The tool allows you to input varying combinations of the loan amount and loan tenure in order to get revised results. Depending on the results, you can make an informed decision and choose a suitable loan tenure and an affordable loan amount. Just enter your proposed car loan details into the Andhra Bank Car Loan EMI Calculator like the loan amount, loan tenure, and interest rate. Click on the 'calculate' button and get a breakdown of your loan repayment schedule, the principal amount, interest, EMI, and the outstanding due after each EMI payment.

The EMI calculator can also be used to decide whether making a prepayment or pre-closing the car loan is a beneficial move.

How to apply for an Andhra Bank four-wheeler loan?

The Andhra Bank four-wheeler loan application form can be downloaded from the bank website or obtained at the nearest bank branch. You must submit the duly-filled and signed application form along with the necessary document proofs such as age, income, identity, and address proofs to the bank. To locate an Andhra Bank branch near you, use the 'Branch Locator' feature on the bank website. Just enter your state and city into the tool to get a list of bank branches in your locality.

The bank will verify the details furnished by you and process your application. Upon approval, the loan amount will be sanctioned immediately. You can also request a 'Call Back' on the bank website and a representative of the bank will call you back to resolve your query. The bank also has a 24/7 toll-free number for customer service.

Andhra Bank Four-Wheeler Loans for Women

Andhra Bank offers a special four-wheeler vehicle loan scheme for women borrowers. This scheme includes new and used car loans.

Eligibility

Any salaried or self-employed woman with an income proof and a valid Driving License can apply for a four-wheeler loan at Andhra Bank.

Salary of the woman applicant must be routed through the bank. A letter of undertaking from the employee must be furnished for recovery.

In some special cases, a post-dated cheque at the discretion of the manager must be provided.

Rate of interest

New four-wheeler loan - 1-year MCLR + 0.70% p.a.

Used four-wheeler loan - 1-year MCLR + 3.45% p.a.

Features of Andhra Bank vehicle loan for women borrowers

  • Income criteria: Women applicants must have more than Rs.1 lakh net annual income. If the applicant is married, 50% of the spouse's income will be taken into consideration to determine the applicant's eligibility if the husband signs as a co-applicant.
  • Loan amount: For a new vehicle, the bank lends a maximum auto loan of up to 90% of the on-road price of the vehicle or 3 times the applicant's gross income, whichever is lower. For a used/pre-owned/second-hand vehicle that is not more than 3 years old, the applicant can get a maximum loan of up to 60% of the garage value of the vehicle or 3 times the applicant's gross income, whichever is lower.
  • Loan repayment period: The loan tenure for four-wheeler loans from Andhra Bank ranges from 12 to 72 months.
  • Co-applicant: The applicant can have her spouse, father or any third-party to serve as a co-applicant for the loan.
  • Loan security: Hypothecation of vehicle purchased.
  • Prepayment charges: The bank charges 1% on the outstanding balance at the time of prepayment for four-wheeler loans as a penalty fee.

Note: On-road price of a vehicle includes life tax, registration charges, invoice price, insurance, and accessories worth Rs.5,000, if any.

Documents required to apply for an Andhra Bank four-wheeler loan for women

  • Valid Driving License in the applicant's name.
  • Income proof in the form of last months' salary slips, IT Returns, Proforma Invoice or Assessment Order.
  • Valuation certificate of the second-hand vehicle from a reputable garage.

items.question: I am an existing customer with Andhra Bank and hold a home loan with the bank. Am I eligible for a concession on the car loan interest rate?
items.answer: Housing loan customers of the bank are eligible for a concession of 0.25% on the existing rate.

items.question: What is the quantum of loan available for used cars?
items.answer: The bank provides up to 60% of the car value as loan(Max Rs.25 lacs). The remainder has to be arranged by the customer. Used cars should not be older than 3 years from the date of registration.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount provided by Andhra bank for Corporate clients?
items.answer: The upper ceiling on the loan amount ranges from Rs.25 lacs to Rs.50 lacs, depending on the existing relationship with the bank. Do inquire at the nearest branch for further information.

items.question: How do I contact the centralised customer service department of Andhra Bank?
items.answer: Please call on 1800 425 1515 for general queries or questions on your existing relationship with them.

items.question: Does Andhra Bank provide any other installment option other than monthly EMIs?
items.answer: Yes. Repayment terms can also be set to Quarterly, Half Yearly or Yearly options based on occupation and income of the borrower.

items.question: How do I apply for an Andhra Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Visit any Andhra Bank Branch near you or walk into a specialized retail credit branch to apply for a car loan.

items.question: Who can apply for a four wheeler loan from Andhra Bank?
items.answer:
To apply for a four wheeler loan, you need to meet the following requirements.

  • Any individual earning at least Rs. 1 lakh gross income per annum can apply.

  • The loan is also available to corporate customers of Andhra Bank. Firms, Limited Companies, Trusts and Societies holding an account with Andhra bank are eligible.

items.question: For what kind of vehicles does Andhra Bank provide car loans?
items.answer: Andhra Bank provides loans to finance any four-wheeler you want to purchase.

items.question: Does Andhra Bank sanction car loans for pre-owned vehicles?
items.answer: Yes, you can apply for a car loan for used vehicles. Pre-owned vehicles should not be over 3 years old.

items.question: What is the minimum amount offered on Andhra Bank car loans?
items.answer: Andhra Bank has not set any minimum loan amount for four-wheeler loans.

items.question: What is the maximum loan quantum offered by Andhra Bank for car loans?
items.answer: The loan amount you can avail of is determined by your income and repayment capacity. The maximum loan amount also depends on the maximum EMI amount allowed. EMIs should not exceed 60% of your net salary. It should not exceed 70% of income of non-salaried borrowers.

items.question: What is the maximum loan quantum offered by Andhra Bank for pre-owned car loans?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount sanctioned for used cars is 60% of garage value or Rs. 25,00,000 /- whichever is lower.

items.question: What is the minimum loan tenure on an Andhra Bank car loan?
items.answer: Andhra Bank has not set any minimum repayment tenure for four-wheeler loans.

items.question: What is the maximum loan tenure on an Andhra Bank car loan?
items.answer: The maximum loan tenure is 84 months.

items.question: What is the income requirements for Andhra Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
• Anybody earning at least Rs. 1 lakh minimum as gross income per year can apply for a vehicle loan from Andhra Bank.

  • For corporates and firms, Rs.25 lakhs to Rs.50 lakhs income is required depending upon the dealings with the Bank.

items.question: Can I apply jointly with my spouse to increase the income capacity?
items.answer: Yes, you can apply for the loan jointly with your spouse or any immediate family member. They will become co-applicants in the loan. Their income can be added to the eligibility criteria. This will also increase the loan quantum you can get.

items.question: What is the interest rate on Andhra Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: The interest rate is the base rate +0.50%. Interest rates are fixed rates throughout the loan tenure. The base rate is currently 9.75% p.a.

items.question: How is interest calculated?
items.answer: Interest is compounded on a daily reducing balance.

items.question: Can I preclose my Andhra Bank vehicle loan account?
items.answer: Yes, you are allowed to foreclose your loan. Prepayment charges will be applicable.

items.question: What are the options of repayment available?
items.answer: Andhra Bank car loan repayments are flexible. You can choose to repay the loan in monthly instalments, quarterly, half-yearly and yearly instalments. This depends on the income and employment status of the individual.

items.question: How do I make payments towards the loan instalments?
items.answer:
Loan instalments can be paid via two methods.

Standing Instructions - set instructions with Andhra Bank to automatically debit your savings account with the loan amount.

Bank Branch - Visit any Andhra Bank branch and make the payment.

items.question: Can I pay instalments ahead of the due date?
items.answer: Yes, you can pay your loan instalments in advance. You stand to benefit with the interest component being reduced.

items.question: What security can I offer for Andhra Bank to get a car loan?
items.answer:
• For individual borrowers, hypothecation of the vehicle will suffice.

  • For corporates and firms, hypothecation charge should be registered in the Registration Certificate of the car, and should be in favour of the bank. The vehicle will be exempted from registration of charge with ROC.

items.question: After I repay the loan, how do I clear the hypothecation on the car?
items.answer:
After repaying your car loan, you should collect the following documents from Andhra Bank. You need to submit them at your Regional Transport Office (RTO).

  • No Objection Certificate issued by Andhra Bank.

  • No Objection Certificate (NOC) will be issued for the the Auto Insurance Company and the Regional Transport Office (RTO).

  • Original Form 35.

items.question: How do I contact the Andhra Bank Customer Care for car loan queries?
items.answer:
Andhra Bank provides toll free lines for customers to contact the customer care service. The service is available between 10.00 a.m to 5.00 p.m on all working days.

The second and fourth Saturdays are regular bank holidays.

  • Toll free - 1800 425 2905

  • Telephone - 040 23234313, 23252000 Extn: 2422, 2577

  • Fax: 23232419

  • Email ID: customerser@andhrabank.co.in

items.question: What are the documents required for a Andhra Bank car loan application?
items.answer:
You will need to submit the following documents when applying for an Andhra Vehicle loan.

  • Recent passport photograph

  • Duly-filled Application form

  • Documents for KYC Compliance that include ID, age and address proof.

  • Salary Slip

  • IT Returns/Assessment Order.

  • Valid driving license if the vehicle is self driven.

  • Proforma Invoice.

items.question: Do I need my CIBIL score to apply for an Andhra Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: CIBIL scores are credit ratings that play an pivotal role in loan applications and approvals. You can buy your score on the official CIBIL website for Rs. 500. Scores that are 750 or above get faster loan approvals, better terms and interest rates from any bank.

items.question: How do I calculate my EMI amount?
items.answer: Your EMI is a equated monthly instalment which is the whole loan broken down into monthly payments. Each payment has two components: Principal + interest. To find out your EMI amount, you can use an EMI calculator available on the Andhra Bank website as well as BankBazaar. Enter your loan details that include principal amount, interest, and tenure. The website will generate your EMI amount.

items.question: Does Andhra Bank have any tie-ups with Auto dealers?
items.answer:
Yes, Andhra Bank has a tie-up with a number of auto dealers. For four wheelers, you can choose any of the following dealers:

  • Tata Motors

  • Maruti Suzuki

items.question: What are the benefits of purchasing from partnered dealerships?
items.answer: You can avail of free accessories when you buy a car from the partnered dealerships with a loan from Andhra Bank.

items.question: Are there any special car loan schemes offered by Andhra Bank?
items.answer: Yes, Andhra Bank offers special car loan schemes for women borrowers. If the applicant’s salary is above Rs. 1 lakh and is routed through Andhra Bank, a car loan with enhanced terms will be offered.

items.question: Can anyone other than a family member be a co-applicant in the loan?
items.answer: Co-applicants can be any third party that is acceptable to the bank. Other than your spouse, or immediate family member, it is at the sole discretion of the bank that your application will be approved.

items.title: Andhra Bank Personal Loan Interest Rates

sections.title: Table of Contents
Bank of Baroda Car Loan Fees and Charges

elements.body:
The main fees and charges that are levied by Bank of Baroda on their car loan are mentioned in the table below:

CategoryCharges
Rate of interestStarts at 8.95% p.a. Car Loan: One-year MCLR + Strategic Premium + interest rates ranging from 0.25% to 2% depending on the applicant's risk rating. Car Loan to Corporates: One-year MCLR + Strategic Premium + interest rate of 0.25%
Processing Fee0.50% of the loan amount that is availed. However, the minimum and maximum amount that will be charged as a processing fee will be Rs.5,000 and Rs.10,000, respectively.
Foreclosure chargesNil

Currently, the one-year MCLR is 8.40%.

sections.title: Features of Bank of Baroda Car Loan

elements.body:
The main features of the Bank of Baroda Car Loan are mentioned in the table below:

  • Up to 90% of the on-road price of the car may be financed.
  • The maximum amount of loan that can be availed is Rs.1 crore.
  • Calculation of interest rates is dependent on the credit score of the applicant and is done on the daily reducing balance.
  • Your credit score must be at least 725.
  • Repayment tenure of the car loan can be up to 84 months.
  • The processing fee is 0.50% of the loan amount up to a maximum of Rs.10,000.
  • Salaried employees, corporates, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs), professionals, and businessman can apply for a car loan.
  • Bank of Baroda will hypothecate the car that is being financed.

sections.title: Benefits of the Bank of Baroda Car Loan

elements.body:
The main benefits of the car loan provided by Bank of Baroda are mentioned below:

  • The processing time is quick
  • Minimal documentation
  • No foreclosure charges
  • No pre-payment penalty
  • No advance Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) needs to be paid
  • Low down payment
  • Attractive interest rates
  • In case you have a good credit history, a 0.25% reduction of the interest rate is provided

sections.title: How to Calculate EMI on Bank of Baroda Car Loan

elements.body:
Various factors such as the processing fee, loan tenure, rate of interest, and loan amount are considered when calculating the EMI. You can use the BankBazaar Bank of Baroda Car Loan EMI Calculator to calculate the EMI.

The process to calculate the EMI is easy and can be completed quickly.

sections.title: How to Apply for a Bank of Baroda Car Loan

elements.body:
On Bank of Baroda website

  • Visit the official website of Bank of Baroda.
  • Click on 'Vehicle Loan', which can be found under the 'Loan' tab.
  • On the next page, click on 'Apply Now' under the 'Car Loan' section.
  • On the next page, you must enter your name, email ID, mobile number, state, city, make and model of the car, and the verification code.
  • Check on the consent box and click on 'Submit'.
  • A Bank of Baroda representative will contact you once the above step is complete.

Visiting the bank branch

You will also be able to download the application form on the Bank of Baroda website and submit it at the bank branch. The form can be downloaded on https://www.bankofbaroda.in/writereaddata/Images/pdf/Car-Personal-loan-new.pdf. All relevant details must be filled before the form is submitted.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria

elements.body:
The below-mentioned individuals will be able to avail a car loan from Bank of Baroda:

  • Salaried employees
  • Partnership Firm partners, Proprietorship Firm proprietors, and Private and Public Limited Company directors
  • Person of Indian Origin (POI)
  • NRIs
  • Farmers, professionals, and businessmen
  • Corporates

The car loan can be used for the purchase of new Sports Utility Vehicles (SUVs), Multi Utility Vehicles (MUVs), and passenger cars for private use.

The eligibility criteria that must be met in order to avail a car loan from Bank of Baroda are mentioned below:

  • The minimum ages of the borrower and the co-applicant at the time of applying the loan must be 21 years and 18 years, respectively.
  • The borrower and the co-applicant cannot be more than 70 years at the time the loan ends.
  • The credit score of the applicant must be at least 725.
  • The eligibility is based on your repayment capacity and is based on the details mentioned in the table below:
CategoryGross Monthly Income (GMI) and Average Annual IncomePercentage of Total Deductions (%)
SalariedGMI is less than Rs.50,00060
GMI is above Rs.50,000 but less than Rs.1.5 lakh70
GMI is more than Rs.1.5 lakh80
OthersAverage Annual Income over the last 2 years is below Rs.6 lakh60
Average Annual Income over the last 2 years is above Rs.6 lakh80

sections.title: Documents

elements.body:
The documents that must be submitted by salaried employees and self-employed individuals are different. The documents that must be submitted are mentioned below:

Self-employed

  • Identity proof
  • Address proof
  • Income Tax Returns
  • Balance sheet with the profit and loss account statement

Salaried

  • Address proof
  • Identity proof
  • Form 16
  • Bank statement
  • Salary slips

You can contact the bank to check if any other documents need to be submitted.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on Bank of Baroda Car Loan

items.question: Where can I get the Bank of Baroda Car Loan application form?
items.answer: The application form for Bank of Baroda Car Loan can be downloaded from the official website of the bank from their 'Downloads' section. You can also consider visiting one of the nearest branch offices of the bank and collect the application form from there.

items.question: Is it possible to track the status of my Bank of Baroda Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, it is possible to check the status of your Bank of Baroda Car Loan. If you have applied for the car loan using the bank's official portal, you can just log in to find out the status of your loan. On the other hand, if you have applied for the loan through a third-party website such as BankBazaar, you can log in to your BankBazaar profile to check the status. You will also be notified by BankBazaar about the status of your car loan through regular email and SMS updates on the email ID and phone number that you have registered.

items.question: Can a Bank of Baroda Car Loan be sanctioned for the installation of a CNG-LPG gas kit only?
items.answer: Yes, Bank of Baroda specifically sanctions loan amounts for installation of CNG-LPG gas kits up to 0.25 lakhs.

items.question: How can customers contact the customer care for more details on Bank of Baroda car loans?
items.answer:
Customers can contact our friendly customer care help desk using the following 24-hour toll-free numbers and they will be glad to help out with any queries regarding Bank of Baroda car loans.

  1. 22 33 44
  2. 258 44 55
  3. 102 44 55

You can also make product inquiries and complaints online on the Bank of Baroda website.

items.question: Can I avail of a loan for a used vehicle?
items.answer: Yes, Bank of Baroda provides loans for used vehicles. The car should not be more than 3 years old.

elements.prefix: Mr. Sharma was tired of taking a cab every day. We helped him get his own car.

elements.body: Bank of India is an Indian state-owned commercial bank with headquarters in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. Government-owned since nationalisation in 1969, Bank of India has more than 5,000 branches, including 60 branches outside India, and a number of ATMs far and wide across the country. It facilitates provision of cost-effective financial processing and communication services. To know more, follow some simple steps given below to get attractive deals.

sections.title: Documentation needed to apply for an Bank of India Car Loan

elements.body:
1. Signed application form with photograph
  2. Photo ID and age proof
  3. Residence proof
  4. Last 6 months' bank statement
  5. Documentation for salaried applicants:
    • Last 3 months' salary slips
    • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  6. Documentation for self-employed applicants:
    • Last 3 years' Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
    • Last 3 years' CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account
