sections.title: Bank of India Car Loan Overview

elements.body:
Founded in 1906, BOI has grown immensely and is present around the world today, with over 5000 branches. The government-owned bank is headquartered in Mumbai and offers a wide variety of financial products like PPF, insurance, mutual funds and loans among others.

The car loan that BOI offers is called 'BOI Star Vehicle Loan Scheme' and is one of the best car loans in the market as it offers ease of access, competitive interest rates and flexible repayment tenure.Bank of India Car Loans is targeted towards providing financial aid to individuals at the time of their car purchase. While this loan can be availed to purchase both new and second-hand cars, the BOI Star Vehicle Loan Scheme is applicable only when the car doesn't require a heavy-duty license. Additionally, customers have to ensure that the used car purchased using this loan should not be more than 3 years old. Under this scheme, a person can also get loan to reimburse for the car that he or she has already purchased using personal resources.

sections.title: Why choose Bank of India Car Loan?

elements.body: Customers have chosen BOI for all their financial needs for decades because of the consistent excellent service that they receive. The newest technology and features keep up with the customers' expectations. BOI car loan is sought after because of the low interest rate, flexible repayment tenure and special schemes during festival seasons. Further, the loan is easy to acquire, has a trouble-free procedure and available for a wide range of prospective customers- salaried and non-salaried groups.

sections.title: Features of Bank of India Car Loan

elements.body:
• Minimal Documentation: No need to worry about complicated documentation when you apply for a Bank of India Car loan. All you will need are documents to meet the KYC guidelines and paperwork related to the car you want. The designated representatives will guide you through the entire process.
  • Transparency: Bank of India believes in transparency. All rates, charges and fees are upfront. You can be sure that you will not be surprised with any hidden charges.
  • Quantum of Loan:Individuals who are residents of India are eligible for a loan amount up to Rs.50 lakh for vehicles manufactured in India, and Rs.100 lakh for imported vehicles. On the other hand, businesses and corporate entities including fleet service providers are entitled to a maximum loan amount of Rs.200 lakh. Non-resident Indians (NRIs) can withdraw a loan for a maximum of Rs.50 lakh.
  • Loan Eligibility: In terms of income, a person can withdraw a maximum loan amount under BOI Star Vehicle Loan Scheme subject to 24 times the gross monthly income of salaried employees and pensions. Individuals who are neither salaried nor pensioners are eligible for a loan amount up to twice the average of their gross annual income for the past 3 years as per the IT Returns. Corporate firms and businesses can get a loan for a maximum of twice their average cash accrual for the previous 3 years according to the company balance sheet, profit and loss statement etc.
  • Maximum Loan Offered to Salaried Employees: While Bank of India has a comprehensive vehicle loan scheme, the maximum loan and interest rates offered to a salaried applicant also is dependant on the net take-home pay (NTHP) of the person. When the gross take-home salary per month of a person is less than Rs.1 lakh, he or she is eligible for a loan up to 40% of the NTHP. When the gross monthly income is between Rs.1 lakh and Rs.5 lakh, the maximum loan offered by BOI is 30% of the NTHP. Furthermore, if a person's gross earnings is more than Rs.5 lakh every month, he or she can apply for a loan for a maximum of 25% of the NTHP. The applicants who are not salaried employees can avail a loan subject to a Debt-Service Coverage Ratio (DSCR) of 1.5 or above.
  • Flexible Loan Tenure: When you avail a car loan from Bank of India, you can choose to opt for loan repayment tenure that suits your situation and repayment capability. With a flexible loan tenure up to 7 years, customers can now get the funds you need in order to purchase the car that you have always dreamed of. On the other hand, the term of loan repayment for businesses and firms is subject to a maximum of 5 years
  • Loan Security: While purchasing a car using the funds from BOI Star Vehicle Loan Scheme, the customer has to provide hypothecation of the vehicle purchased as security. On the other hand, in case of an NRI applicant, a third-party guarantee of an Indian resident has to provided as collateral. The vehicle purchased using this loan should also be registered with the Regional Transport Office (RTO).
  • Loan Margin for New and Used Cars: When you purchase a car below Rs.10 lakh, you can avail the benefit of zero margin, i.e. you can get a loan up to 100% of the cost of the car including the registration charges, taxes, insurance etc. On the other hand, you will have to pay a margin amount if the price of the car is more than Rs.10 lakh. In case a vehicle worth Rs.10 lakh to Rs.25 lakh is purchased, the customer will have to pay 15% of the total cost of the car as loan margin. If the price of the car is above Rs.25 lakh, the applicable loan margin becomes 25% of the on-road price of the vehicle. The minimum loan margin for corporate firms and businesses is 25% of the total price tag of the car. In case of a used car, the margin becomes 30% or above on the depreciated value of the car as assessed by a recognised entity.
  • One-Time Processing Fee: While all individuals purchasing a new car have to pay a processing fee of Rs.500, corporates firms and businesses will have to pay twice the fee applicable to individuals. If a person avails this loan through a branch in the rural area, he or she will have to pay 75% of the handling charges applicable to the individual borrower with a minimum payable amount of Rs.500. In case of a second-hand car, the applicable handling fee is 1% of the loan amount subject to a minimum of Rs.500 and a maximum of Rs.10,000. Senior citizens, BOI staff members & retired employees, and individuals withdrawing pension through Bank of India are exempt of any processing charges. The bank is also currently proving an offer of zero processing till 31 March 2018.
  • Competitive Interest Rates: One of the key reasons for Bank of India's continued growth in the market is the competitive interest rates that the loans are offered at.

One of the key reasons for Bank of India's continued growth in the market is the competitive interest rates that the loans are offered at.

items.title: Bank of India Car Loan Interest Rate
items.body:
Bank of India's interest rate system is based on the base Marginal Cost of Funds-Based Lending Rate (MCLR) system. The current interest rate for old and new vehicle is calculated as: 1 Year MCLR + 0.60% presently 8.90%, effective from 10 January 2018. Therefore, the ongoing interest rate for BOI Star Vehicle Loan Scheme is 8.90%. The Bank of India offers car loan at a floating rate of interest.

These rates are subject to change attributed to the fact that the bank is presently providing a festive offer to its customers till 31 March 2018. Before you forward your application, make sure you contact your Bank of India concerned branch or customer care team to learn about the customer service for the latest interest rates.

items.title: Eligibility criteria for a Car Loan from Bank of India
items.body:
1. Bank of India's car loan is available for a wide range of applicants. This includes
    • Salaried employees, professionals and self-employed.
    • Non-Resident Indians are also eligible but must have an advance granted jointly with a Resident Indian who is a close relative.
    • Companies, Proprietary concern, Partnership Firms and other types of corporate entities are eligible.
    • HUFs are not eligible
  2. The individual borrower must not be more than 65 years of age while availing the advance.
  3. Further details of eligibility will be provided by the bank at the time of application.

items.title: How to calculate EMI on Bank of India Car Loan
items.body:
It is a good idea to figure out the EMI before you sign your name on the cheque so you will have an idea of what exactly you are getting into. It also helps in choosing the best terms. It is easy to calculate the EMI using the car loan EMI calculator under the Finance Tools section in Bankbazaar.com.

First you should have at hand the following details: the loan amount, Rate of interest, proposed tenure and processing fee (if any).

  1. Go to Slider 1 to choose the Loan amount. Go to slider 2 to choose the tenure.
  2. In the following fields enter the interest rate and processing fee.
  3. Click on the "Calculate” button to get a detailed result which includes the EMI amount and Amortisation table. You can use these key details to make your decisions.

Check BOI Car Loan EMI

faq.title: Bank of India Car Loan FAQs

items.question: What is the Processing / Handling Charges that BOI charges?
items.answer:
• For Loan to Individuals: (for new four wheeler loan): Irrespective of limit, Rs.500/- per application
  • For New Two Wheeler Loan and Second hand vehicle (both two/four wheelers): 1% of the loan amount, Minimum Rs.500/- and Maximum Rs.10,000/-
  • For Partnership firms/Corporates the processing charges will be double that of individuals.
  • For Rural Branches the processing charges will be 75% of the charge that loan to individuals will be applicable to. There will be a minimum charge of Rs.500/- for loans taken in rural branches.
  • For senior citizens, BOI staff members and retired employees of the BOI as well as pensioners drawing pension from BOI, the processing fee is waived off.
  • No processing charges at the time of review (same terms)

items.question: How do I contact BOI for any enquiries?
items.answer: Simply call (022) – 40919191 / 1800 220 229 for any enquiries, any day, any time.

items.question: Where can I get a Car Loan Application form?
items.answer:
• You can get a car loan application online on the Bank of India website. The form is also available when you choose to apply online.

  • You can also get the form from a Bank of India branch.

items.question: How do I apply for a Bank of India Car Loan?
items.answer:
To apply for a car loan from Bank of India, you can use either of these options:

  • Visit the nearest Bank of India branch.

  • Apply on the Bank of India website.

items.question: For what kind of vehicles does Bank of India provide car loans?
items.answer: Bank of India offers finance for four wheelers that do not need heavy duty licensing.

items.question: Can I avail of a loan to finance a pre-ownedvehicle?
items.answer: Yes, Bank of India provides loans for used vehicles. The car should not be more than 3 years old.

items.question: Can I finance a car that I have already purchased?
items.answer: Yes, Bank of India will provide a reimbursement for the car you purchased using your own source of finance. You can then pay back the reimbursement in instalments at the terms and interest rate of the Bank of India Car Loan Scheme.

items.question: Can I check the status of my BOI loan application online?
items.answer: Yes, you can track the status of your loan on the Bank of India website. Under "Apply & Track Online”, select "Apply/Track Loans”. Choose "Star Autofin”. You can then click on "Check application status.” Enter your application number, mobile number and the captcha code. Click on submit to view your loan status.

items.question: What is the eligibility criteria for a BOI car loan?
items.answer:
The Bank of India Car Loan is available to the following people:

  • Salaried employees

  • Professionals

  • Self-employed

  • Proprietors

  • NRIs can apply jointly with resident Indians, preferably a close relative.

  • Companies and Firms

  • Partnerships

  • Corporate entities

items.question: What are the income requirements for Bank of India Car Loan?
items.answer: Bank of India has not mentioned minimum income requirements. However, your loan amount will be determined based on your annual gross income.

items.question: What is the age requirement for a four wheeler loan?
items.answer: For individuals, the maximum age at the time of availing the loan should not exceed 65 years.

items.question: What are the Credit score requirements?
items.answer: Credit scores are important when applying for a loan. Bank of India has the authority to enquire about your CIBIL score. Banks usually prefer scores of 750 and above. Some banks keep 550 as their cut off.

items.question: Can Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) apply for a Bank of India Car Loan?
items.answer: No, HUFs are not eligible for a car loan from BOI.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount I can get with a Bank of India Car Loan?
items.answer:
The maximum loan quantums set by Bank of India are given below:

  • Indian-make cars - Rs. 50 lakhs

  • Imported cars - Rs. 100 lakhs

  • NRIs - Rs. 50 lakhs

  • Corporates - Rs. 200 lakhs can be sanctioned to buy cars or a fleet of cars.

items.question: What is the minimum loan amount I can get from Bank of India?
items.answer: There is no minimum loan quantum set by Bank of India.

items.question: How is the loan quantum determined?
items.answer:
The loan amount you are eligible for depends on your income.

  • For salaried individuals and pensioners, you can get upto 25 times the gross monthly income or twice the gross annual income as shown in the last 3 years IT returns.

  • For companies and firms, twice the average cash accrual per year as per the last 3 years audited P&L account and Balance Sheet.

items.question: What is the minimum car loan tenure on a BOI four wheeler vehicle loan?
items.answer: Bank of India does not specify any minimum time period for repayment.

items.question: What is the maximum loan tenure for a BOI four wheeler vehicle loan?
items.answer:
• For individuals, the maximum repayment tenure is 7 years or 84 months for new vehicles. For pre-owned cars, the maximum repayment tenure is 3 years.

  • For corporates, the maximum repayment tenure is 5 years.

items.question: Are there any concessions on Interest rates?
items.answer: No, women applicants are presently not offered any additional concession on the regular interest rate.

items.question: Are there any processing fees on Bank of India Car Loans?
items.answer:
The processing charges levied by Bank of India are as follows.

  • For Individuals purchasing new cars - Rs. 500 + GST

  • For Corporates and Firms - The processing fees are double to Rs. 1,000 + GST.

  • For Rural Branches - 75% of the individual processing charges will be applicable + GST. The loan should be availed of by people from rural areas or branches.

items.question: Are there any concessions in processing fees offered by Bank of India?
items.answer:
Yes, Bank of India offers concessions on processing charges. The fees are waived for the following borrowers.

  • Senior Citizens

  • BOI Staff Members

  • Retired Staff of BOI

  • Pensioners drawing pension from BOI

items.question: Are there processing charges for reviews on the car loan?
items.answer: No, Bank of India doesn't levy any processing charges for reviews.

items.question: Are there any offers or discounts on Bank of India Car Loans?
items.answer: Till 31 March 2018, the processing charges are waived for loans during the festive period.

items.question: What security or collateral is required by Bank of India?
items.answer:
In regular cases for Indian residents, firms and companies, the following security is required:

  • The vehicle should be hypothecated.

  • Charge of the bank should be registered with RTO.

items.question: Does Bank of India require third party guarantees?
items.answer:
Bank of India requires a third party guarantor only in the following cases

  • For Non-residential Indians, a guarantee from a resident Indian is required.

  • For vehicles that are not registered with the RTO.

  • For loans above Rs. 25 lakhs given to individuals.

items.question: What are the margin requirements for new vehicles?
items.answer:
The margin requirements for new cars are given below.

items.question: What are the margin requirements for used cars?
items.answer: For second-hand cars, the margin requirements are set at a minimum of 30%. The margin will be determined by the depreciated value or the value assessed by a valuer or the sale consideration.

items.question: Are the margin requirements different for corporates?
items.answer: Yes, for corporates and firms, the minimum margin required is 25%.

items.question: What are the penalties for late payments?
items.answer: Bank of India has not specified the fees that will be charged. This should be communicated to you at the time of loan application. Usually banks charge a nominal fee or increase the interest rate.

items.question: How do I contact the Bank of India Customer Care for car loan queries?

Who Can Avail

  • Permanent salaried employees of state/central government/PSUs, corporate salary account holders, employees of corporate companies with at least 1 year of service with the current employer
  • Self-employed individuals/businessmen/independent entrepreneurs with regular income source
  • Pensioners of state/central government/PSUs with a pension of at least Rs.25,000 per month
  • Farmers owning at least 5 acres of land and sufficient disposable income
  • Companies/partnership/proprietary firms

Minimum Age

18 years

Maximum Age

70 years at the time of loan maturity

Minimum Annual Income

  • Pensioners/salaried applicants – Rs.3 lakh
  • Professionals/businessmen - Rs.4 lakh
  • People engaged in agriculture and its allied activities – Rs.4 lakh
  • Companies/firms - Rs.4 lakh

sections.title: Documents Required for Availing Bank of Maharashtra Car Loan

elements.body:
Proof of Identity

Passport, Driving License, PAN Card, Voter's ID, Aadhaar, etc.

Address Proof

Aadhar, Passport, Driving License, Voter's ID, etc.

Proof of Income

  • Salaried applicants – Form 16, last 2 years Income Tax Returns, last 3 months salary slip, last 6 months bank statement
  • Non-salaried applicants – Audited Balance Sheet, last 2 years IT returns, last 12 months bank statement
  • Agriculturists who do not file IT returns – Income certificate issued by Mandal Revenue Officer/Tahsildar/Revenue Department Officer with state-level gazetted rank

sections.title: Quantum of Finance You Can Avail as Car Loan from Bank of Maharashtra

elements.body:
The amount you can avail as a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra will depend on your annual income and are as follows:

  • Salaried applicants/pensioners - Up to 36 times of your net monthly salary or pension based on the last salary/pension drawn.
  • Other applicants – Up to 2 times of Gross Taxable Income or 2 times average yearly income based on ITRs of 2 years, whichever is lower.
  • Corporate clients (companies/firms) - Up to 3 times of average yearly income based on 2 years ITRs or maximum Rs.100 lakh or Gross Taxable Income, whichever is lower. For loans above Rs.100 lakh, corporate clients will have to get approval from the Credit Approval Committee of Zonal Managers.

sections.title: Bank of Maharashtra Car Loan – Margin

elements.body:
• New/existing home loan borrowers – Minimum 10% of the vehicle cost (ex-showroom price plus insurance charges plus RTO charges)
  • Others – Minimum 15% of the vehicle cost (ex-showroom price plus insurance charges plus RTO char
  • Corporate clients – Minimum 20% of the vehicle cost (ex-showroom price plus insurance charges plus RTO charges)

sections.title: Bank of Maharashtra Car Loan EMI Calculator

faq.title: FAQs on Bank of Maharashtra Car Loan

items.question: Can I include a co-applicant while applying for a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra?
items.answer: Answer: Yes, you can include a co-applicant while making a car loan application to Bank of Maharashtra. The income of the co-applicant will be used to compute the quantum of the loan and the repayment tenure. Your spouse, parents, children, or extended family members can become the co-applicant provided that the deductions of your income and your co-applicant is maintained in the ratio of 70:30.

items.question: Do I have to pay any upfront fee while applying for Bank of Maharashtra car loan?
items.answer: Answer: You will be required to pay a processing fee upfront when you apply for a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra. You can get in touch with the bank to know about the exact amount you need to pay as processing fees.

items.question: I am a pensioner drawing a monthly pension of Rs.20,000 per month. Am I eligible for a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra?
items.answer: Answer: Unfortunately, to avail a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra you should draw a pension of at least Rs.25,000 per month.

items.question: Do I need to provide any security for obtaining a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra?
items.answer: Answer: No, you do not need to provide any security to avail a car loan from Bank of Maharashtra as the vehicle itself will act as a security. The hypothecation charge, however, should be registered with the authorities of the Regional Transport Office.

items.question: What kind of vehicles can I buy with the loan I avail from Bank of Maharashtra?
items.answer: Answer: You can use the car loan availed from Bank of Maharashtra to purchase all kinds of four-wheelers such as car, sports utility vehicles (SUVs), Jeep, multi-utility vehicles (MUVs), etc., for personal use. The loan cannot be used to purchase vehicles for commercial use.

items.question: How do I get in touch with the bank in case of any queries or complaints?
items.answer: Answer: You can call the customer care at Bank of Maharashtra at the toll-free numbers – 1800 233 4526 and 1800 102 2636.

sections.title: Table of Contents
Canara Bank Car Loan Fees and Charges

elements.body:
FeatureCharges
Processing Fee0.25% of the loan amount that is being availed will be charged as a processing fee. However, the processing fee can be a minimum of Rs.1,000 and a maximum of Rs.5,000.
FinancingDepending on the price of the car, 80%, 85%, and 90% of the on-road price of the car can be availed as a loan.
Foreclosure chargesNo foreclosure charges are levied in case the loan is closed before maturity.

sections.title: Eligibility criteria

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria to avail the Canara Vehicle Loan are mentioned below:

  • Individuals who are self-employed or professionals, or work for a reputed organisation will be eligible to avail a car loan.
  • Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) are not eligible to avail a car loan with Canara Bank.
  • Reputed firms and companies are also eligible to avail a car loan with Canara Bank.
  • In the case of salaried employees, the minimum gross salary that they make in a year should not be less than Rs.3 lakh. However, the minimum take-home salary after the reduction of the car loan instalment should not be less than Rs.12,000 or 25% of the individual's take-home salary.
  • Other individuals must also make a minimum gross yearly income of at least Rs.3 lakh as per the latest Income Tax Returns. However, the average annual income of the individual must not be less than Rs.2.5 lakh over the last 3 years.

sections.title: Canara Bank EMI Calculator
Factors Affecting Canara Bank Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
Some of the ways that individuals can increase their eligibility for a Canara Vehicle Loan are mentioned below:

  • Maintain a good credit score: Individuals who have a good credit score have more chances of getting their car loan approved. Having a credit score of 750 and above will provide the lender with an impression that the individual will be able to pay the loan amount on time.
  • Availing a lower loan amount: Banks and other lenders usually approve the loan in case the loan amount is low. Apart from banks being comfortable in providing the loan, the car loan interest rate, that will be levied is also low.
  • Shorter duration: Individuals who choose a shorter repayment tenure can avail the loan at lower interest rates. Therefore, it is recommended that individuals opt for shorter tenure when opting for a car loan. The chances of getting the loan approved also increases since individuals will have to pay to close the loan quicker.
  • Low debt-to-income ratio: Before approving the car loan, banks check the individual's debt-to-income ratio. In case the individual has a significant balance between their income and expenses, the chances of getting the loan approved at lower interest rates increases.

sections.title: Documents Required

elements.body:
The documents that must be submitted to avail a car loan with Canara Bank are mentioned below:

  • The completely filled application form must be submitted.
  • 2 passport-size photographs of the applicant.
  • Last 3-months' salary slips or payslips must be submitted.
  • Address proof such as telephone bill, water bill, electricity bill, LPG bill, Driving License, or Aadhaar card must be submitted.
  • Last 6 months bank statement.
  • Income Tax Returns for the last 3 years or Form 16 must be submitted.
  • ID proof such as Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card, Aadhaar Card, Voter ID, or Passport must be submitted.

sections.title: Contributions

elements.body:
Depending on the cost of the car, the contributions made by the bank and the individual will vary. Given in the table below are the contributions that will be made by the bank and the individual depending on the price of the car:

Price of the carIndividual's contribution (%)Loan provided by Canara Bank (%)
Up to Rs.10 lakh1090
Above Rs.10 lakh and below Rs.25 lakh1585
Above Rs.25 lakh2080

Canara Bank provided 80%, 85%, or 90% of the on-road price of the car depending on the value of the car. In the case of new vehicles, the loan that is provided on the on-road of the car is inclusive of insurance premium, registration charges, life tax, invoice value, and any other accessories.

sections.title: Used Car Loan

elements.body:
Canara Bank provides car loans for used cars under the below-mentioned conditions:

  • The car must not be older than 5 years.
  • The tenure of the loan can be a maximum of 60 months.
  • Up to 75% of the car's value or the agreed price can be financed. The car value must be accessed by an automobile engineer and can be a maximum of Rs.15 lakh, whichever is lower.

sections.title: Rate of interest

elements.body:

Other borrowersOne Year MCLR + 0.35% to 0.95% depending on the score that is linked to CIC8.85% to 9.45%

sections.title: Repayment schedule

elements.body: Canara Bank provides a convenient repayment schedule for individuals who have availed a car loan. In the case of new cars, the loan tenure can be up to 84 months, but for used cars, the tenure of the loan can be up to 60 months.

items.question: What are the different vehicles that can be financed under the Canara Bank car loan?
items.answer: Various types of four-wheelers such as vans and jeeps can be financed under Canara Vehicle Loan. The vehicle can be pre-owned or brand new.

items.question: Is there any other income that is considered when determining the income eligibility?
items.answer: The income of the spouse, income from any investments, or rental income may also be considered when determining the income eligibility. However, documentary evidence must be submitted for it to be considered.

items.question: How is the calculation of interest done?
items.answer: The calculation of interest is done on a daily reducing balance basis.

items.question: Is it possible for an individual to prepay his/her loan?
items.answer: Yes, it is possible for an individual to prepay the loan. No prepayment fees will also be levied.

items.question: What is the procedure to approach the bank in case the individual wants to avail a car loan?
items.answer:
Individuals can get details on the car loan by one of the below-mentioned ways:

  • Visiting the Canara Bank website.
  • Calling the Canara Bank call centre (1800 425 0018).
  • Giving a missed call to 09268592685. Individuals will receive an SMS about the details of the car loan.
  • Individuals can also visit any Canara Bank branch to get details on the car loan.

elements.body: Central Bank of India is one of the renowned banks in the Indian public sector. The bank offers loans for all kinds of automobiles including two-wheelers and four-wheelers. The car loan offered by the bank comes with attractive interest rates and minimal charges. Customers can use the loan offered by the bank to buy new or used cars. The application process for car loans is really simple and customers can walk into the bank anytime to apply for a car loan. Let's check out the different aspects of car loans offered by the Central Bank of India.

sections.title: Compare Central Bank of India Car Loans

elements.body:
Central Bank of India charges different interest rates for new and used cars. The features of these loans are listed as follows:

Loan TypeInterest RateLoan AmountProcessing Fee
4 wheelers new8.95% p.a. (MCLR + 0.40%)Rs.75 lakhContact the bank for details
4 wheelers old10.05% p..a. (MCLR + 1.50%)Rs.10 lakhContact the bank for details

sections.title: Why Choose Central Bank of India Car Loans

elements.body:
Based in Mumbai, Central Bank of India is one of the largest commercial banks in the country. When it comes to car loans, the bank provides financing for new as well as old cars. The flexible terms offered by the bank makes it a great choice for customers who look for car loans at competitive interest rates. Some of the reasons why you need to choose the Central Bank of India car loans are listed as follows:

  • The bank offers loan quantum up to Rs.75 lakh for new cars and Rs.10 lakh for used cars. This amount is adequate for buying most of the top models available in the market.
  • Central Bank of India offers financing for up to 90% of the on-road price, which includes insurance, road tax, and registration charges.
  • For new cars, the bank offers flexible loan tenure options for up to 84 months. You can choose the loan tenure based on your repayment ability and monthly budget.
  • Central Bank of India is also one of the very few banks in the market that offers car loans for individuals who have completed just 18 years of age.

sections.title: Eligibility for Central Bank of India Car Loans

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria set forth by the bank for approving car loans are listed as follows:

  • Anyone between the age of 18 years and 65 years can avail a car loan from Central Bank of India.
  • The minimum income of the borrower must be at least Rs.2.40 lakh per year.
  • The bank offers car loans for salaried individuals, self-employed individuals, and independent entrepreneurs as long as they have a steady income.
  • Non-Resident Indians can also apply for car loans from Central Bank of India subject to the terms and conditions outlined by the bank.
  • Individuals engaged in farming, agricultural, and allied activities can also apply for car loans if they meet the minimum income criteria set by the bank.
  • Companies and societies can also apply for car loans under this scheme.

sections.title: Documents Required for Central Bank of India Car Loans

elements.body:
The following documents must be submitted to the bank when you apply for car loans:

  • Duly-filled loan application form
  • Identity proof
  • Residential proof
  • Photographs
  • Bank statement for at least 6 months
  • Salary slips for 3 to 6 months
  • IT returns (for self-employed people)

items.question: What costs of the vehicle are covered by this loan?
items.answer: The loan amount is determined based on the on-road price of the car. Here, the on-road price of the vehicle = ex-showroom price + registration charges + road tax + insurance. The bank will not provide any financial assistance for other expenses like the price of additional gadgets, charges for fancy number, etc.

items.question: What types of vehicles are financed under the Cent Vehicle loan scheme?
items.answer: The bank provides financing for any two and four wheelers intended for personal use. Commercial vehicles that are used for the transportation of goods and ferrying passengers are not financed under this scheme.

items.question: How can I repay the EMI amount to the bank?
items.answer: The bank offers different repayment modes for its customers to repay the loan amount. You can use post-dated cheques for repayment. The best mode is to provide a standing instruction for auto-debit of the car laon EMI amount from your bank account.

items.question: Is hypothecation mandatory with Central Bank of India?
items.answer: Yes. Hypothecation of the vehicle is mandatory when you get a loan from Central Bank of India. The hypothecation charge associated with the loan must be registered with the Road Transport Office Authorities.

items.question: Is it possible to prepay the loan amount before the completion of the loan tenure?
items.answer: Yes. Prepayment is possible with Central Bank of India. You must pay the necessary prepayment charges to proceed with this. You can contact the bank to know about the prepayment policies and the associated charges.

elements.body: City Union Bank is an Indian bank. The Kumbakonam Bank Limited, as it was at first called, was incorporated as a limited company on 31 October 1904. The bank initially preferred the role of a regional bank in the Thanjavur District Tamil Nadu. The main purpose of the loan is helping the deposit holders to get financial help against their deposit at the time of need, and the advance is for immediate family or business expenses. To know more, follow some simple steps given below to get attractive deals.

sections.title: Documentation needed to apply for an City Union Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
1. Signed application form with photograph
  2. Photo ID and age proof
  3. Residence proof
  4. Last 6 months bank statement
  5. Documentation for salaried applicants:
    • Last 3 months salary – slips
    • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  6. Documentation for self-employed applicants:
    • Last 3 years Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
    • Last 3 years CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account

sections.title: Overview About City Union Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Owning a car of your choice is a dream that every individual carries life-long. But getting the right car with the right kind of financing, takes effort and considerable research from the individual's end. Car owners generally look for affordable interest rates when they choose a car loan. Along with other aspects of a car loan the extra charges levied should also be taken into account by prospective borrowers.

As one of the best car loans in the market, City Union Bank offers a car loan product with competitive pricing and complete transparency. Car owners can also get a comprehensive car insurance policy along with their CUB car loans. City Union Bank offers complete flexibility of repayments with variable tenures.

sections.title: Why choose a City Union Bank Car Loan?

elements.body: The Yoha Vahana car loan scheme from City Union Bank is a comprehensive financing solution for your new car, giving you maximum returns when you plan to invest on a four-wheeler. Low processing charges and flexible repayments make a City Union Bank car loan, one of the most sought-out debt product in India.

sections.title: Features of a City Union Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Quantum of Loan

City Union Bank sanctions car loans up to a maximum of Rs.5, 00,000/- for professionals and self-employed businessmen with an annual income of above 1.5 lakhs.

Loan Margin

The loan margin required for a City Union Bank car loan is 10%.

Security

The hypothecation of the vehicle is required while availing a City Union Bank car loan.

Third Party Guarantee

A co-obligant can be given when an application is made to City Union Bank. The third party can be the spouse considered for the eligibility or any other individual.

Repayment

Customers have to make repayments in the form of monthly installments within a maximum tenure of 60 months. CUB does not allow any moratorium period to be included.

Insurance

An all-inclusive car insurance policy can be got for a CUB car loan, with the borrower bearing the cost of the insurance policy.

Processing fees

City Union Bank charges 1% of the total loan amount as processing fees for car loans, with no extra charges.

Disbursal of the loan

City Union Bank disburses the car loan directly to the car dealer or supplier.

City Union Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

City Union Bank offers car loans at a competitive interest of 15%, fixed for the entire loan tenure.

sections.title: Eligibility criteria City Union Bank for a Car Loan

elements.body:
• Salaried employees and self-employed businessmen are eligible to apply for a City Union Bank car loan.
  • Individuals need to show a net monthly income of 15000/- to qualify for the car loan.
  • Self-employed professionals need to show an annual income of 1, 50,000/- to qualify.
  • Customers who have already taken credit from CUB can also apply for a car loan.
  • To calculate the total eligibility for an applicant, the income of the spouse can be considered and added as a co-applicant.

sections.title: City Union Bank Car Loan EMI calculator

elements.body: When you decide to buy a new car, you are generally very decisive about the car model and make. What actually puts you in a dilemma is how you are going to finance the car and if you do choose a car loan how much will that actually cost you. It is very important that you plan your finances and understand how much you would actually be paying towards a car loan. Helping you in this decision making process are intelligent tools called car loan EMI calculators. This tool will show you the actual cost of a City Union Bank car loan with a break-up of interest rates and monthly installments. As inputs, certain details like processing fees, loan amount, loan tenure and interest rates need to be entered. The car loan EMI calculator projects a repayment forecast, helping you manage your money better.

elements.linkText: Check City Union Car Loan EMI

faq.title: City Union Bank Car Loan FAQs

items.question: Can I take a CUB Yoha Vahana car loan for my used car?
items.answer: No, City Union Bank does not provide car loans for second hand cars.

items.question: Is Hypothecation of the new vehicle mandatory for customers?
items.answer: Yes, Hypothecation of the vehicle has to be mandatorily done while applying for a CUB car loan.

items.question: Can I apply for a City Union Bank car loan on the bank's web portal?
items.answer: Yes, customers can easily apply for a City Union Bank car loan using the online form. They need to fill-in certain personal details when they file an application.

items.question: Does the CUB Yoha Vahana scheme cover loans for two-wheelers?
items.answer: No, the CUB Yoha Vahana scheme does not provide loans for two-wheelers. City Union Bank offers the CUB Easy Ride loan scheme exclusively for two-wheelers.

items.question: Can I get a moratorium period for my City Union Bank car loan?
items.answer: No, City Union Bank does not provide any kind of moratorium period for car loans availed by customers.

items.question: Can City Union Bank customers verify the status of their car loan applications online?
items.answer: Yes, City Union Bank does provide the option of checking car loan application status on its web portal using net banking services.

items.question: Where can customers get the City Union Bank car loan application form?
items.answer: The City Union Bank car loan application form is available at any CUB branch or can be downloaded from the bank's website.

items.question: Can City Union Bank car loan borrowers make joint applications?
items.answer: Yes, joint applications can be made along with the spouse for car loans. The net income of the spouse will be included to determine the income eligibility criteria for both the applicants.

items.question: What is the processing fee charged by City Union Bank under the CUB YOHA VAHANA loan scheme?
items.answer: The processing fees charged by City Union Bank for car loans is 1% of the loan amount or a minimum of Rs. 600.

items.question: Does the applicant's CIBIL score have an impact on the eligibility criteria for City Union Bank car loans?
items.answer: Yes, City Union Bank will sanction car loans only after considering the CIBIL score and credit history of the applicant.

items.question: What are the key income documents that have to be submitted by applicants as income proofs to City Union Bank?
items.answer: The main documents that have to be submitted are salary slips and IT return statements.

items.question: Can customers make online applications for City Union Bank car loans?
items.answer: Yes, online applications can be done by customers on the CUB website. While submitting the car loan application online, the following details have to be entered by customers - name, age, address, mobile number, email address, name of the scheme and the branch where the application is being made. A branch official will contact the applicant as per the preferable time entered to process the loan further.

items.question: What is the maximum amount approved by City Union Bank for auto loans?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount permitted to be availed by City Union Bank car loan borrowers is Rs. 5 lakhs, provided the applicant shows an annual income of more that Rs. 1.50 lakhs.

items.question: Do City Union Bank car loan borrowers have to bring in any loan margin?
items.answer: Yes, a loan margin of 10% is required to be brought in by auto loan borrowers.

items.question: Can the CUB Yoha Vahana loan scheme be used to finance two-wheelers as well?
items.answer: No, the CUB Yoha Vahana loan scheme can be used only to finance four-wheelers purchased by borrowers.

items.question: What are the different categories of applicants eligible to avail a CUB Yoha Vahana loan?
items.answer: Salaried individuals, business firms and other professionals are eligible to procure a City Union Bank car loan.

items.question: Can existing City Union Bank customers avail a new car loan?
items.answer: Yes, existing City Union Bank customers who have already availed credit products from the bank are also eligible to avail a car loan.

items.question: What is the income criteria that has to be met by applicants while applying for a CUB car loan?
items.answer: Salaried employees and business firms have to furnish an income of Rs. 15,000 per month and other professionals should show an annual income of more than Rs. 1.5 lakhs.

items.question: What is the maximum car loan tenure that can be chosen by City Union Bank customers?
items.answer: The maximum car loan tenure that can be chosen is up to 60 months, with repayments being done as monthly installments.

items.question: Does City Union Bank extend a moratorium period for car loans that are sanctioned?
items.answer: No, City Union Bank car loans do not come with a moratorium or holiday period.

items.question: What is the interest rate charged for a City Union Bank car loan?
items.answer: The interest rate charged for a City Union Bank car loan is generally calculated as the total of the base rate plus 4%.

items.question: Do City Union Bank customers have to submit any form of security while availing a car loan?
items.answer: The security for a City Union Bank car loan is the hypothecation of the new vehicle that is being bought by the customer.

items.question: Do City Union Bank customers have to furnish guarantee from a third party while availing a car loan?
items.answer: Third party guarantee can be got in the form of a co-obligant who can be the spouse or any other co-applicant fulfilling the required eligibility criteria.

items.question: How is the car loan disbursement done by City Union Bank?
items.answer: The car loan disbursement is done directly to the car dealership or the seller.

items.question: Does City Union Bank provide any insurance cover to individuals availing the CUB car loan?
items.answer: Car loan borrowers can procure an all-inclusive insurance cover from City Union Bank after paying the necessary premium.

items.question: Does City Union Bank provide the pre-closure facility for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: Yes, City Union Bank car loan borrowers do have the option of foreclosing their loans before the end of the tenure.

items.question: Can car loan customers transfer the balance from an existing loan account to a new CUB car loan account?
items.answer: Yes, other bank auto loan customers can make balance transfers to a new City Union Bank car loan account.

items.question: I would like to get a top-up loan on my City Union Bank car loan, what should be my next course of action?
items.answer: City Union Bank customers can contact any branch officer for more details on top-up loans.

items.question: What is the verification process followed by City Union Bank with regards to car loan applicants?
items.answer: After the documents have been received from the applicant, City Union Bank verifies the eligibility, credit history and income requirements of the applicant before approving and sanctioning the car loans.

items.question: I would like to get refinancing for my private vehicle, what should be my next course of action?
items.answer: City Union Bank customers can contact any branch officer for more details on the refinancing options available.

items.question: What are the various methods that can be used by borrowers to repay City Union Bank car loans?
items.answer: A City Union Bank car loan can be paid back using direct debits from CUB accounts, post-dated cheques or through ECS.

items.question: What is the time taken by City Union Bank to process a car loan?
items.answer: The time taken to process a car loan by City Union Bank depends on the submission of documents and the verification process done by the bank.

items.question: On what basis does City Union Bank approve car loans for customers?
items.answer: City Union Bank approves car loans based on the income, age, credit history, eligibility criteria and documentation submitted by the customer.

items.question: Can City Union Bank car loan borrowers contact the customer care for any queries or concerns?
items.answer: Yes, City Union Bank car loan customers can contact the customer care helpdesk number - 044 - 71225000 or the state-wise numbers for addressing any queries.

items.question: What are the types of vehicles that City Union Bank finance for customers?
items.answer: City Union Bank finances all types of private cars and vehicles.

sections.title: Corporation Bank Overview

elements.body:
Corporation Bank is one of the premier public sector banks operating in India. An early-bird banking institution originating from the coastal district of Udupi, Karnataka, Corporation Bank had a modest beginning in 1906 with an initial capital of Rs.5,000.00. Led by Khan Bahadur Haji Abdulla Haji Kasim Saheb Bahadur, a group of philanthropists started this bank with a motive to provide accessible banking services in Udupi, a strategically important trading center in coastal Karnataka. Since then, it has grown leaps and bounds spreading its banking wings to large parts of the country.

This banking and financial institution was nationalised in 1980 and was only the second public sector bank to enter the capital market in 1997. With a mammoth network of 2,440 fully automated CBS branches, 4,724 branchless banking units, and 3,040 ATMs reinforced by over 19,500 strong employees, Corporation Bank has been been serving customers with humility. Headquartered in Mangalore, Karnataka, the bank is listed on major bourses, BSE and NSE.

Savings accounts, deposits, loans,insurance, investments, forex, remittance and other financial services are provided by the bank, catering the needs of personal, corporate & NRI customers. Corporation bank has been a pioneer in many banking initiatives such as gold banking, M - Commerce, online approvals for educational loans and has, more recently, taken technology to rural masses through low-cost banking.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

sections.title: About Corporation Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Corporation Bank Car Loan offerings are much sought-after in the market. Low interest rates paired with minimal miscellaneous fees and charges make it a preferred lender for many customers. Individuals, Professionals, Businessmen, Salaried Employees, NRIs, Sole Proprietorships, Partnership Firms, HUFs, Companies, Trusts, and Other Institutions are eligible to procure a loan.

The car loan amount offered covers the ex-showroom(on road) price and includes registration charges, road tax, insurance and accessories. Loans also cover second-hand cars that are not older than 3 years from the date of registration. In some cases, the loan agreement will be on hypothecation and requirement of a guarantor is at the discretion of the bank.

Corporation Bank car loan interest rate is linked to the Marginal Cost of Funds-Based Lending Rate (MCLR). The MCLR of the interest rate is revised time to time with the change in rates by Reserve Bank of India (RBI). The present MCLR for one year is 8.65% and the fixed component is ranges from 0% to 2.35% - depending on the type of borrower and the amount of loan borrowed. Therefore the blanket car loan interest rate varies between 8.65% to 11.00% as of 22 March 2018. The bank also gives seasonal offers and discounts to its customers on its interest rate, processing fee, etc.

The car loan scheme offers loan amount up to Rs.1 crore per vehicle. To be monetarily eligible to apply for a car loan with Corporation Bank, an applicant needs to have a minimum annual income of Rs.1.2 lakh per annum.

sections.title: Why choose Corporation Bank Car Loan?

elements.body:
When it comes to scouting for a car loan, many of us prefer to apply with a nationalised bank due to the low interest rates and simple terms. Akin to the other public-sector banking counterparts, Corporation Bank car loans are popular amongst all economic classes of the society.

You must choose a Corporation Bank car loan due to the low interest rates, reasonable processing fees and zero prepayment charges.The repayment period is also considerably high at 84 months.

If youre someone who trusts public-sector banks and believes in their offerings you can rest assured that, Corporation Bank car loans will not disappoint. The processing time can be protracted owing to rigorous checks and verification, but the wait is worth as it helps you save money in the long run.

sections.title: Features of Corporation Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Income qualification is low

Corporation Bank welcomes car loan applications from salaried and self-employed individuals.Business concerns like partnership firms, companies, HUFs, institutions and trusts are also eligible to apply. The minimum annual income required is just Rs. 1,20,000 per annum, which makes loans from this bank, not only valuable, but also customer friendly.

Flexibility of co-application

With Corporation Bank, you can apply for a car loan along with co applicants to supplement the repayment of your loan. This adds weightage to the Corporation Bank car loan application since the incomes of all applicants are considered to determine eligibility.

If your annual income is low, you have the advantage of bringing a co-applicant who would equally be liable, thereby giving the bank more leverage to approve the loan.

Upper cap on loan amount is high

Corporation Bank finances up to 1 crore of the car price that includes registration charges, insurance and road taxes(ex-showroom price). In addition, accessories are also financed under the loan scheme.

Low interest rates

The car loan interest rate of the bank is one of the lowest in the market. The interest percentage is linked to MCLR, which is revised every time there is a change in the rates of RBI rate. The ongoing MCLR for one year is 8.65% while the constant rate of interest is 0.65% for cars under Rs.50 lakh and 1.15% for cars that cost above as on 22 March 2018.

Corporation Bank also waives the constant component of the interest rate for government employees and defence personnel who are looking to buy a personal vehicle below Rs.50 lakh. Therefore, the rate of interest currently being offered to such individuals is 8.65%. For vehicles that are purchased for commercial purposes using this scheme, an interest rate of 11.00% is levied. Additionally, the bank gives seasonal offers and discounts on the rate of interest every now and then. In order to learn about any ongoing offer, you can get in touch with the bank representatives.

So, if your car's ex-showroom price including accessories is less than Rs 50 lakhs, the interest charged is just 9.30%. With a moderate repayment tenure, youre likely to pay less amount as interest when compared to other banks in the car loan market.

Repayment Period

Corporation Bank car loans give you ample time to pay the loan back. The repayment tenure can be up to 84 months for both new and used car loans. That is a whopping 7 years. If youre staring at a vast repayment period to balance expenses and family budget, this loan scheme helps.

Loan Security

Corporation Bank may ask for a guarantor to secure the loan amount at the time of processing the application. A guarantor is a person who guarantees loan repayment on behalf of the applicant, if he/she is unable to repay the loan in future.

The car is hypothecated to the bank until all the EMIs are paid and the loan account is closed.

Zero pre-closure charges

No pre closure charges levied are levied on the car loans availed from this bank. You are free to pay off the outstanding balance anytime and close the car loan account. So when youve surplus money, you can go ahead and pay off the loan to save money on interest.

Service Charges

Corporation Bank bills additional charges towards processing the car loan application. Details of this fee can be obtained from the bank representatives. You can also look out for promotions where service charges can be waived. Contact the bank for more information on this aspect of the car loan.

elements.prefix: Spending a lot on cabs every day? It's smarter to buy your own car.

sections.title: Corporation Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
The bank uses the MCLR (Marginal Cost Based Lending Rates) to index applicable car loan rates.

Corporation Bank Marginal Cost Based Lending Rate (MCLR) for New Borrowers
Benchmark MCLR rate8.65%
Rate of interest (up to Rs.50 lakh)9.30% (MCLR + 0.65%)
Rate of interest for Central or State Government employees and defence personnel (up to Rs.50 lakh)8.65% (MCLR + 0%)Rate of interest for commercial vehicles11.00% (MCLR + 2.35%)

Note: The interest rate is subject to periodic revision as per bank's credit policy and RBI's quarterly reviews. Make sure to confirm with the bank on prevailing rates at the time of applying and choose the terms accordingly.

sections.title: Corporation Bank Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
Nationalised banks go in depth at the time of verifying and processing car loan applications. Corporation Bank has its own processing mechanism for car loans. Paperwork and documentation can be elongated. However, if you're on top of the criteria, the bank will not shy away from making a car loan offer at the earliest.

Your application will be expected to meet the required criteria before being approved for a car loan. The bank may, on the basis of customer's eligibility, make a loan offer on lower terms.

  • Entry age of 21 years(minimum) up to 70 years.
  • Legitimate income in the form of salary or self employment.
  • Minimum annual income of at least Rs 1,20,000.
  • Individuals, proprietors, partnership firms, agriculturists, trusts, societies, other legal entities like HUFs as well as directors and employees of corporates are eligible to apply.
  • Good credit scores and no defaults in the past.

Financial liabilities such as existing loans and credit card dues will have a say at the time of processing of the loan application. Ensure that you declare all forms of income and debts when you apply. A Good credit score will better your chances of qualifying for a car loan with Corporation Bank.

sections.title: How to calculate EMI for Corporation Bank Car Loans?

elements.body:
Corporation Bank Car Loan EMI Calculator helps you conveniently calculate Car Loan EMIs and project future costs incurred on the loan which includes interest charges payable.

Let us quickly tell you on how you can make use of this tool to get the best output.

  • Before we start, you should know the car loan amount, interest rate(%) and processing fee(%) to get the EMI value.
  • To begin with, use the sliders to freeze the Loan Amount and Tenure of the car loan. A summary is displayed at the end of it.
  • In the following set of fields after the sliders, type the interest rate and processing fee, both in percentage and click 'Calculate'.

The car loan EMI details along with other breakups are displayed.

items.question: How do I check the approval status for a car loan application with Corporation Bank?
items.answer: If you applied online, via the banks portal, you will be provided with an application tracking number. You can call the customer support to know the status. If the application was submitted to a particular branch, the representatives there will be able to assist you further to obtain status.

items.question: I would like to apply for a car loan with Corporation Bank. How do I get the application form?
items.answer:
You can apply on the banks web portal. This application is directly sent to the centralised loan processing center.

If you prefer applying offline, visit the nearest banking branch. You can obtain and submit the application to the front desk representatives.

items.question: I would like to get a copy of my car loan statement online. How do I do that?
items.answer: Create a net banking account to access your car loan information online. If you do not have access, contact the base branch or the customer support.

items.question: Are there charges if I decide to pre close my Corporation Bank car loan account ?
items.answer: Corporation bank does not charge for closing the car loan account before the end date. You are free to pay off the outstanding loan amount anytime.

items.question: How do I contact Customer care for more details on Corporation Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: If you have any queries about the terms of car loans or need updated information before applying, our friendly customer Care helpdesk will be happy to answer all your queries at 91 44 6651800

items.question: Can Corporation Bank customers check the status of their car loan applications online?
items.answer: Yes, Corporation Bank does offer the option of checking the car loan application status using net banking services.

items.question: Where can customers procure the Corporation Bank car loan application form?
items.answer: The Corporation Bank car loan application form is available at any branch or on the bank's website.

items.question: Can Corporation Bank car loan customers make joint applications?
items.answer: Yes, joint applications for car loans can be done with a close relative or spouse. Joint applications can be made to have flexible repayment options.

items.question: What is the processing fee levied by Corporation Bank under the Corp Vehicle loan scheme?
items.answer: The processing fees levied by Corporation Bank for car loans is 1% of the loan amount or a minimum of Rs. 1000.

items.question: Does the customer's credit score have an impact while determining the eligibility criteria for Corporation Bank car loans?
items.answer: Yes, Corporation Bank will approve car loans based on the CIBIL score and the repayment history of the customer.

items.question: What are the mandatory documents that have to be furnished by car loan applicants as income proof to Corporation Bank?
items.answer:
The income documents varies depending on the category of the applicant -

  • Salaried employees - Pay slips for the last three months/ IT Returns for the last three years.
  • Self-employed businessmen/professionals - Balance sheets for the last three years / Income Statements/ IT Returns
  • Agriculturists - Income Certificate from an authorised institution.

items.question: Can individuals make online applications for Corporation Bank car loans?
items.answer: Yes, online application can be made by individuals on the Corporation Bank website. While applying online, the following details have to be furnished by customers - name, age, employment category, address, mobile number, PAN number, email address, gross monthly income, existing liabilities, scheme type, the preferred branch and any other source of income. A Corporation Bank branch official will contact the customer for further processing of the car loan.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount approved by Corporation Bank for borrowers?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount sanctioned by Corporation Bank for four-wheeler loan borrowers is Rs. 1, 00, 00,000 per vehicle.

items.question: Do Corporation Bank car loan customers have to bring in a loan margin?
items.answer: A loan margin of 15% is required for four-wheeler loans up to an amount of Rs. 1 crore and 20% for loan amounts above Rs. 1 crore.

items.question: Can the Corp Vehicle loan scheme be used to finance two-wheelers?
items.answer: Yes, the Corp Vehicle loan scheme can be used to finance two-wheelers, three-wheelers, four-wheelers, heavy vehicles and water transport vehicles purchased by borrowers for commercial or personal purposes.

items.question: Who is eligible to avail a Corp Vehicle loan from Corporation Bank?
items.answer: Salaried individuals, professionals, business firms, NRIs, partnership firms, sole proprietorships companies, institutions, trusts and HUFs are eligible to procure a Corporation Bank car loan.

items.question: Is it mandatory for co-borrowers to show an income when they apply for a Corporation Bank car loan?
items.answer: Yes, co-borrowers have to be in steady employment to meet the income eligibility criteria.

items.question: What is the maximum loan tenure that can be chosen by Corporation Bank borrowers?
items.answer: As per the category of the applicant, the age of repayment varies for borrowers. Salaried employees and self-employed professionals have to repay the car loan within 84 months. The repayment period for a salaried applicant should not be beyond the retirement age. The repayment period for other types of borrowers cannot exceed 70 years, unless the co-borrower has an independent source of income to repay the loan.

items.question: Does Corporation Bank extend a holiday or moratorium period for car loans that are approved?
items.answer: No, Corporation Bank does not offer a holiday or moratorium period for car loan borrowers.

items.question: What is the rate of interest charged for a Corporation Bank car loan?
items.answer: The rate of interest charged is a floating interest rate depending on the current base rate of the bank. For loan amounts up to Rs. 50 lakhs, the interest rate is a total of the base rate plus 0.55% and for loan amounts above Rs. 50 lakhs, the interest rate is a total of the 1-year MCLR plus 0.65% and for loan amounts above Rs.50 lakh, the interest rate is a total of the 1-year MCLR plus 1.15%. Since the current MCLR for one year is 8.65%, the interest rate for loans up to Rs.50 lakh is 9.30%, and 9.80% for loans above Rs.50 lakh. Additionally, the interest rate offered on car loans for commercial vehicles is 11.00%.

items.question: Any there any benefits offered to government employees and defence personnel?
items.answer: Yes, employees of the Central or State Government and defence personnel are offered a discounted rate of interest when they purchase a vehicle below Rs.50 lakh. The applicable interest rate is equal to the MCLR currently offered by the bank, i.e. 8.65%.

items.question: Do Corporation Bank car loan borrowers have to give any security while procuring a car loan?
items.answer: The hypothecation of the new car that is being purchased by the borrower is the only security requirement from Corporation Bank.

items.question: Do Corporation Bank borrowers have to submit any third party guarantee while taking a car loan?
items.answer: Yes, Corporation Bank requires a guarantor on a case-by case basis for new car loans.

items.question: What types of costs are covered by the Corp Vehicle loan offered by Corporation Bank?
items.answer: The Corp Vehicle loan offered by Corporation Bank covers registration costs, accessories, insurance and other extra charges for new cars.

items.question: Is insurance cover provided by Corporation Bank for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: No, Corporation Bank does not provide any kind of insurance cover for car loan borrowers.

items.question: Does Corporation Bank offer pre-closure options for car loan customers?
items.answer: Corporation Bank car loan customers can easily pre-close their loan accounts without paying any prepayment penalty charges.

items.question: Can new car loan customers make balance transfers from existing loan accounts to a new Corp Vehicle loan account?
items.answer: Yes, other bank auto loan borrowers can make convenient balance transfers to a new Corporation Bank car loan account.

items.question: I would like to avail a top-up loan on my existing Corporation Bank car loan, whom should I approach?
items.answer: Corporation Bank car loan borrowers can contact any branch official for any details on the top-up loan facility.

items.question: Does Corporation Bank conduct any type of verification while sanctioning a car loan?
items.answer: After the required documents have been got from the customer, Corporation Bank checks the eligibility, credit score and the necessary income requirements of the customer before sanctioning and disbursing the car loan.

items.question: I would like to get refinancing for my private vehicle, whom should I approach?
items.answer: Corporation Bank customers can get in touch with any branch official for any details on the refinancing facility.

items.question: Do Corporation Bank car loan borrowers have multiple methods to pay their monthly installments?
items.answer: Monthly installments for a Corporation Bank car loan can be repaid back through post-dated cheques, ECS and as direct debits from bank accounts.

items.question: What are the documents that have to be submitted by applicants when they apply for a Corporation Bank car loan?
items.answer:
• Address Proof/Age Proof - Voter's ID/ SSC Certificate / Passport / Ration Card / PAN Card / Driving License
  • For loans above Rs. 25 lakhs - Net worth statements - Liabilities and Assets of the guarantor and the borrower, certified by a Chartered Accountant.
  • Two Passport Photographs of the Borrower, guarantor and co-borrower.
  • Pro-Forma Invoice from the car dealer
  • Body building cost of the vehicle - Quotation to be given
  • Bank account statements for the past six months
  • Non-Corporation Bank account holders have to compulsorily furnish the ECS mandate or post-dated cheques when the loan is sanctioned.

items.question: What is the time taken by Corporation Bank to sanction a new car loan?
items.answer: The time taken to process and sanction a car loan by Corporation Bank varies based on the documentation and the verification or evaluation done by the bank.

items.question: Based on what does Corporation Bank sanction car loans for new customers?
items.answer: Corporation Bank sanctions car loans based on the age, income, CIBIL score, car loan eligibility criteria and the documents furnished by the customer.

items.question: Does Corporation Bank provide customer care support for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: Yes, Corporation Bank car loan customers can contact the customer care helpdesk number at the head office at 0824 - 2427717 or use the city-wise numbers available on the website for any issues.

items.question: What are the types of four-wheeler financed by the Corp Vehicle loan scheme?
items.answer: The Corp Vehicle loan scheme can be availed for financing all types of private cars, sedans, SUVs or luxury cars.

items.title: Corporation Bank Personal Loan Interest Rates

elements.body: Dhanlaxmi Bank Ltd is an old private sector bank headquartered in Thrissur City, Kerala, India. The bank was focusing mostly on Southern states like Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala. Dhanlaxmi Bank with its rich heritage has earned the trust and goodwill of clients. It is due to their strong belief in the need to seek innovation, deliver best service and demonstrate responsibility, that they have grown from strength to strength. car loans is the ideal way to finance your new set of wheels. Now you can acquire your favourite small car, sedan or luxury vehicle with flexible repayment options. Read on to learn about the car loan eligibility and documentation requirements for the Dhanalakshmi car loan.

sections.title: Documentation needed to apply for an Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
1. Residence proof
  2. Photo ID and age proof
  3. Signed application form with photograph
  4. Last 6 months bank statement
  5. Documentation for salaried applicants:

    • Form 16 or Income Tax Returns
  6. Documentation for self-employed applicants:
    • Last 3 years Income Tax Returns with computation of Income
    • Last 3 years CA Certified / Audited Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account

sections.title: Overview About Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan:

elements.body: Dhanalakshmi Bank Ltd was conceived in 1927 and currently has 280 branches. It is headquartered at Thrissur city and offers products and services to meet all your financial needs; including credit cards, mortgage, investment banking etc. In the loans category, car loans is one of the options which is provided at competitive interest rates and flexible repayment options. Customers can opt for new or used car loans in a quick and hassle free process.

sections.title: Why choose Dhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan?

elements.body: It's really no wonder that customers keep coming back to Dhanalakshmi for all their financial needs. When you choose Dhanalakshmi Bank for a car loan, you get to enjoy the many benefits like hassle-free documentation, flexible repayment etc. You can also get upto 95% financing for the car of your dreams.

sections.title: Features of Car LoanDhanalakshmi Bank

elements.body:
Flexible Repayment Tenure

The loan amount and interest charges can be repaid in up to 84 EMIs. An unique feature from Andhra bank is the option to also make the repayment in quarterly/half yearly/yearly basis. This kind of flexibility ensures that you get to choose a term of your choice, as per your budgeting requirement.

Simple Documentation

With just basic documents to meet the KYC guidelines along with paperwork relating to the proposed car, the application process is largely hassle free.

Funding

  • For a new car: 95% of the Ex showroom cost (or) 85% of the On road cost (Ex showroom cost+ Registration + Insurance + Road tax)
  • For a used car: 60% of the value of the vehicle, as valued by the approved representative of the Bank

elements.prefix: Spending a lot on cabs every day? It's smarter to buy your own car.

sections.title: Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Dhanlaxmi Bank has set the MCLR at a benchmark rate which is effective from 7th May, 2016, for the Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan. New borrowers will be levied interest based on this system. Existing Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations. The tenure based MCLR rate is as follows:

TenureRates of Interest Rate of Interest (%) p.a.
Overnight MCLR10.05%
2 days - 1 month10.05%
More than 1 month - 3 months10.05%
More than 3 months - 6 months10.35%
More than 6 months - 1 year10.45%
More than 1 year - 2 years MCLR10.50%
More than 2 years - 3 years MCLR10.80%
More than 3 years - 5 years MCLR11.00%
More than 5 years11.20%

The existing Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Base Rate = 11.40% per annum.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria for a Car Loan from Dhanalakshmi Bank

elements.body:
Salaried employee:

  • Applicant must be atleast 21 years of age
  • Maximum age of Applicant at loan maturity is 60 years
  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-
  • Must be employed for at least one year in current employment and should have at least two years of work experience in total.

Self-Employed / Professionals:

  • Applicant must be atleast 21 years of age
  • Maximum age of Applicant at loan maturity is 65 years
  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-
  • Should be in the same business for a minimum of three years

Private Limited Company and Public Limited Company:

  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-
  • Should be in the same business for a minimum of three years

sections.title: How to calculate EMI onDhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
It is a good idea to figure out the EMI before you sign your name on the cheque so you will have an idea of what exactly you are getting into. It also helps in choosing the best terms. It is easy to calculate the EMI using the car loan EMI calculator under the Finance Tools section in Bankbazaar.com.

First you should have at hand the following details: the loan amount, Rate of interest, proposed tenure and processing fee (if any).

  1. Go to Slider 1 to choose the Loan amount. Go to slider 2 to choose the tenure.
  2. In the following fields enter the interest rate and processing fee.
  3. Click on the "Calculate" button to get a detailed result which includes the EMI amount and Amortisation table. You can use these key details to make your decisions.

items.question: What are the documents required to apply for a car loan?
items.answer:
• Application Form that is duly filled.
  • Passport size colored photographs
  • Identity proof (Passport copy/ Driving License/Pan Card/ Voters ID card/ Employee ID Card (If employed with PSUs/ MNCs/ Public limited companies/other government companies)
  • Address Proof (Ration Card/Telephone Bill/Electricity Bill/ Property Tax/Receipt/Life Insurance/premium receipt/Sale Agreement/Municipality TAX receipt/ /Valid Leave and License agreement.)
  • Bank Statement - Latest 06 months bank statements
  • Additionally:
    • If you are a salaried employee; Proof of income in the form of 6 months' salary slip or Salary certificate, ITR for last 2 years and Form 16.

    • If you are in a private or public limited company, you will need Proof of Income in the form of Audited Financials and Last three years' ITR. You will also need the Memorandum of Association/Articles of Association.

items.question: Can the status of a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan application be checked online?
items.answer: Yes, Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers can check the status of their car loan applications on the bank's website via internet banking.

items.question: Can customers apply for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan online?

items.question: Can Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers use the joint application facility while availing the loan?
