items.question: What is the maximum car loan amount that will be sanctioned by Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: The maximum car loan amount that will be sanctioned by Dhanlaxmi Bank is 95% of ex-showroom price of the vehicle or 85% of the on-road price.

items.question: What is the minimum loan term that can be chosen by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers?
items.answer: The minimum tenure that can be chosen by borrowers for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan is twelve months.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure that can be chosen by a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrower?
items.answer: The maximum tenure that can be chosen by borrowers for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan is up to sixty months.

items.question: Does Dhanlaxmi Bank charge any foreclosure penalty for customers closing their car loans before the completion of the loan tenure?
items.answer: Yes, Dhanlaxmi Bank charges a penalty of 2% of the outstanding amount along with the GST for customers pre-closing the car loan.

items.question: Can individuals make balance transfers from an existing car loan account to a new Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan account?
items.answer: Yes, other bank car loan customers can make balance transfers to a new Dhanlaxmi Bank loan account.

items.question: What is the evaluation process done by Dhanlaxmi Bank when a new car loan application is submitted?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank customers can download the application form and submit the form with the list of required documents. Dhanlaxmi Bank will conduct verification on the applicant and then sanction the required loan.

items.question: How long does it take for Dhanlaxmi Bank to process a car loan application?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank generally sanctions car loans with quick processing and fast disbursements and with minimum documentation requirements.

items.question: How is the interest rate determined for new car loans given by Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: The interest rate for a new car loan is decided as per the base rate and is offered as a fixed interest rate by Dhanlaxmi Bank.

items.question: Can Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers contact the helpdesk through Phone Banking for addressing any queries and concerns?
items.answer: Yes, Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan customers can conveniently contact the toll-free customer care helpdesk number - 1800 425 1747 or through an alternative number, 91 0487 6613000.

items.question: How can repayments be done for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer: Repayments can be done by borrowers using monthly installments through ECS debits or standing instructions.

items.question: What are the various other charges that have to be paid by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers while availing the loan?
items.answer: The other types of additional charges that have to be paid by new car loans borrowers are - documentation charges and processing charges.

items.question: Do customers have to submit a guarantor while availing a Dhanlaxmi Bank new car loans?
items.answer: No, a guarantor is not required while availing Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans.

items.question: Do borrowers have to provide any security collateral while availing new car loans with Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: No, car loan customers do not have to submit any security collateral for Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans. The hypothecation of the new vehicle is only required.

items.question: What are the modes that can be used by borrowers to repay Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans can be repaid as monthly installments via Dhanlaxmi Bank accounts, post-dated cheques, direct debits or ECS.

items.question: IS it mandatory for new car loan borrowers to open a savings account with Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: No, it is not compulsory to open a savings bank account with Dhanlaxmi Bank, while availing a car loan.

items.question: What are the different kinds of cars financed by Dhanlaxmi Bank?
items.answer: All kinds of private vehicles like sedan, small cars, luxury cars and pre-owned cars are financed by Dhanlaxmi Bank.

items.question: Who is eligible to avail a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer: Salaried individuals and self- employed professionals aged above 21 years, partnership firms, private and public listed companies are eligible to avail a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan.

items.question: What is the minimum income criteria that has to be met by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan applicants?
items.answer:
As per the employment category of the applicant the respective income criteria has to be met -

  • Salaried Individuals - A total work experience of two years/ One year at the current company
  • Self Employed Professionals/ Partnership Firms/ Private/Public Limited Company - Business continuity of three years.

items.question: What is the minimum annual income requirement to be shown by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan applicants?
items.answer: All categories of applicants have to show a minimum annual income of Rs. 1, 20,000 to be eligible for a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan.

items.question: What are the late payment charges levied by Dhanlaxmi Bank for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank charges a fee of 3% every month for late payments and delayed payments of car loan monthly installments.

items.question: What are the documents that have to be submitted by salaried individuals while availing a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer:
The following documents have to be submitted by salaried applicants -

  • Filled-in Application Form
  • ID Proof - Passport / PAN Card/ Driving License/ Voter's ID/ Employee's ID card (if employed with Government Concerns)
  • Passport Size/ Colour Photograph
  • Bank Account Statement for the last six months
  • Address Proof - Ration Card/ Electricity Bill/ Telephone Bill/ Sale Agreement/ Life Insurance Receipt/ Property Tax Receipt/ Municipality TAX receipt/ Leave and License Agreement

items.question: What are the documents that have to be submitted by self-employed professionals while availing a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer:
The following documents have to be submitted by self-employed professionals -

  • Filled-in Application Form
  • ID Proof - Passport / PAN Card/ Driving License/ Voter's ID
  • Passport Size/ Colour Photograph
  • Bank Account Statement for the last six months
  • Address Proof - Ration Card/ Electricity Bill/ Telephone Bill/ Sale Agreement/ Life Insurance Receipt/ Property Tax Receipt/ Municipality TAX receipt/ Leave and License Agreement

items.question: What are the documents that have to be submitted by partnership firms, private and public limited companies while availing a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan?
items.answer:
The following documents have to be submitted by partnership firms, private and public limited companies -

  • Filled-in Application Form
  • ID Proof - Passport / PAN Card/ Driving License/ Voter's ID
  • Bank Account Statement for the last six months
  • Address Proof - Ration Card/ Electricity Bill/ Telephone Bill/ Sale Agreement/ Life Insurance Receipt/ Property Tax Receipt/ Municipality TAX receipt/ Leave and License Agreement
  • Partnership Deed for Partnership Firms
  • Articles of Association / Memorandum of Association for private and public limited companies.

elements.body: IDBI Bank Limited is an Indian financial service company headquartered in Mumbai, India. IDBI Bank is on a par with nationalized banks and the SBI Group as far as government ownership is concerned. It is one among the 26 commercial banks owned by the Government of India. Their experience of financial markets will help them to effectively cope with challenges and capitalize on the emerging opportunities by participating effectively in our country's growth process. Getting to drive your dream vehicle can make life seem so much better. IDBI Bank offers Express Auto Loans for your dream vehicle. Their Auto loans are easy and quick to avail and we make sure you take on the roads faster with our quick processing of the loan. Just rush to book your dream car.

elements.prefix: Mr. Sharma was tired of taking a cab every day. We helped him get his own car.

sections.title: IDBI Bank Overview

elements.body: IDBI Bank is one of India's largest commercial banks offering innovative and core banking services for over 40 years now. Headquartered in Mumbai, the bank plays a key role in the development of the communities with an efficient workforce and state of the art banking technology. IDBI has a strong commitment towards being the natural choice for Indian customers, providing customised banking solutions in a structured and robust manner. IDBI offers a wide array of services including retail, corporate, SME and agricultural banking. Besides these key areas, IDBI has also made its presence felt in the Investment banking, capital market and mutual fund businesses. IDBI makes it very easy for a customer to finance and own a car of his choice with IDBI Express Auto Loans. As the moniker suggests, IDBI car loans can be availed easily and quickly with fast processing done by IDBI bank officials.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

sections.title: Why choose an IDBI car loan?

elements.body: IDBI has one of the fastest car loan processes, when compared to its competitors and that is the top reason for a car owner to get his new vehicle financed by IDBI. Added to that, IDBI aims at providing the maximum funding eligible for a customer while sanctioning a car loan. IDBI car loans cover all types of cars and come with flexible repayment options and attractive interest rates. To ensure that customers get the best package deals for their cars, IDBI has established tie-ups with top car dealers across India.

sections.title: Features of an IDBI car loan

elements.body:
IDBI car loans are offered to customers with various benefits and the loan documentation process is completely hassle free for the convenience of IDBI customers.

  • IDBI car loans are available with flexible loan tenures up to 7 years.
  • Customers can pay their monthly EMIs for their IDBI car loans easily using standing instructions or ECS debits. The monthly EMIs for a car loan is calculated on a daily reducing basis.
  • IDBI charges low processing fees on car loans with waivers applicable during festive seasons.
  • Pre-payment or part foreclosure of an IDBI car loan is allowed after a period of six months of the loan disbursement. The pre closure should be done from own sources and will be completed without any penalty. If the car loan is closed before the required tenure of six months or a balance transfer is availed, then a fee of 1% of the outstanding balance plus other applicable charges would be levied by IDBI bank.
  • IDBI bank also imposes a penalty of 2% per month for late payment or irregular EMI payments on customers.
  • Additionally, loan documentation charges are also levied while processing an IDBI car loan.

sections.title: IDBI Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
IDBI Bank is a prominent bank in India that extends a number of banking and financial services for various requirements. Are you interested in purchasing a car in your own name? You can make your dream come true by taking a reliable car loan from IDBI Bank.

The bank offers Express Auto Loans that will enable you to purchase any car that you want. The application process for these loans is very simple and quick. You can buy an automobile or a motorcycle (that costs from at least Rs.1.2 lakh) with a loan from IDBI.

Interest rates for Car Loans offered by IDBI

The car loan interest rates for IDBI auto loans are fixed after much research. They are economically priced in order to cater to the needs of every person.

Primary Car Loans

Four-wheeler (for new vehicles)

Existing customers with a banking relationship of at least 3 months9.00%
New customers9.10%

Two-wheeler loans (for high-end two-wheelers)

Existing customers with a banking relationship of at least 3 months9.50%
New customers9.60%

Combo auto loan for different loan amounts

A combo auto loan is offered by IDBI Bank only if the loan tenure sanctioned by the bank is higher than 3 years.

Four-wheeler loan (for new vehicles)

Existing customers with a banking relationship of at least 3 months8.95%
New customers9.05%

Two-wheeler loans (for high-end two-wheelers)

Existing customers with a banking relationship of at least 3 months9.45%
New customers9.55%

The rate of interest will remain constant for the entire loan tenure.

You can repay your car loans with low equated monthly installments (EMIs). Whether you want to buy a small car, an SUV, or a high-end motorbike, you can apply for a loan from IDBI Bank to own a vehicle. The bank has partnered with vehicle manufacturers and auto and bike dealers to make certain that you have a smooth vehicle purchasing experience.

Special interest rates for central and state government employees and payroll customers

IDBI Bank offers 10 basis points (bps) discount on the applicable rate of interest on auto loan, subject to a minimum MCLR benchmark to the following customer segments (New Sanctions):

  • Permanent employees of central and state Government with a credit score of 700 and above.
  • Payroll customers with a credit score of 700 and above and whose salary is credited through a salary account maintained with IDBI Bank.

For more details about the concession, visit the nearest IDBI Bank branch in your locality.

items.title: IDBI car loan eligibility
items.body:
IDBI Bank offers car loans for both salaried and self-employed professionals at affordable interest rates.

Salaried professionals

The minimum age required for a salaried applicant is 18 years with the maximum age of the borrower being 70 years or the retirement age around the time of the maturity of the loan. Salaried individuals need to have a minimum annual income of Rs.1.8 lakh to qualify for an IDBI car loan.

Self-employed businessmen

Businessmen need to be aged between 18 to 70 years with the latter mandatorily required at the time of loan maturity. They should have been in business for at least two years and are required to show a minimum annual income of Rs.1.8 lakh

items.title: IDBI car loan EMI calculator
items.body:
Car loan EMI is calculated based on the below formula:

E = P*r* (1+r)^n/([(1+r)^n]-1), where E is the equated monthly installment, P is the principal loan amount, r is the interest rate, and n is the loan tenure.

'Finance Tools' on the main menu of the Bankbazaar home page contains EMI calculators, which can help a customer calculate the EMI that he will be paying while availing an IDBI car loan. Our Car Loan EMI calculator is designed to efficiently calculate Car Loan EMI payment details in a matter of seconds. Customers have to follow the below given process to instantly calculate their IDBI car loan EMIs.

  1. Selecting the 'Finance Tools' drop down menu takes a customer to the EMI calculator option. Clicking on this link will take him to the car loan EMI calculator option specifically leading to the calculator page.
  2. Individual ruler scales are available on the calculator page donating the ranges of the 'loan amount' and 'tenure' that can be selected by applicants.
  3. Applicants need to enter a few details to calculate the EMI to be paid for an IDBI car loan. The first value that needs to be entered is the required loan amount and the tenure of the IDBI car loan that the customer is intending to take. The pre-populated values can be changed to suit the customer's details.
  4. The interest rate charged by IDBI for auto loans has to be entered along with the processing fee charged for IDBI car loans by the applicant. The default value is already populated in the field and can be changed as required.
  5. Clicking on 'calculate' will give an applicant details of his IDBI car loan EMI payments along with the breakup of the total interest that has to be paid.

In case any issues or problems surface while navigating through this page, customers can get in touch with our customer care team at 91 44 6651800 and get the issue sorted.

items.question: Is the IDBI car loan application form available online?
items.answer: Customers can use the IDBI loan application form available on the IDBI website to apply for IDBI auto loans.

items.question: Is the IDBI car loan statement available online?
items.answer: Yes, customers can get their IDBI auto loan statements through the IDBI online banking portal.

items.question: What are the IDBI car loan prepayment charges that are levied on a customer?
items.answer: IDBI charges a pre penalty fee of 1% for car loans pre closed within six months from the date of disbursement of the loan. Prepayment should be made from own sources only. For loan closures above the six month time period, no prepayment penalties are levied.

items.question: How does a customer contact a customer care executive for more details on IDBI Car Loans?
items.answer: Customers can take the help of our friendly customer care executives available at 91 44 6651800 for any queries regarding IDBI car loans.

items.question: What type of cars does IDBI Bank provide Auto Loan for?
items.answer: IDBI Bank provides Auto Loan for a wide range of cars which includes SUVs.

items.question: What is the minimum age requirement for applicants to apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: The minimum age requirement is 18 years for applicants to apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank.

items.question: What should be the maximum age of a borrower at the time of maturity, if they have taken a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: The maximum age of a borrower at the time of maturity should be 70 years, if they have taken a car loan from IDBI Bank.

items.question: I am a self – employed individual. How old should my business be for me to avail a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: If you are a self – employed individual, your business should be at least 2 years old for you to avail a car loan from IDBI Bank.

items.question: What is the rate of interest on car loans offered by IDBI Bank?
items.answer: The rate of interest on car loans offered by IDBI Bank is Base Rate plus 0.35 percent.

items.question: How does IDBI Bank calculate the rate of interest on car loans?
items.answer: IDBI Bank calculates the rate of interest on car loans on the basis of the reducing balance.

items.question: Will my CIBIL score have an impact on the car loan that I apply for with IDBI Bank?
items.answer: Yes, your CIBIL score will have an impact on the car loan that I apply for with IDBI Bank. If you have a high CIBIL score, it will be easy for you to avail the car loan as banks generally trust people with a high score and prefer lending money to them.

items.question: What should be the minimum annual income of an IDBI Bank car loan applicant?
items.answer: The minimum annual income of an IDBI Bank car loan applicant should be Rs.1, 80, 000.

items.question: What documents do I have to submit as income proof when I apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer:
You have to submit the following documents as income proof when you apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank –

For Salaried Employees –

  • Salary slips for recent 2 months
  • Income Tax Returns or Form 16 for the last two years
  • Bank Statement (which reflects your salary credits for 4 months)

For Self – Employed Individuals –

  • Balance Sheet
  • Profile and Loss Account
  • Bank Statement
  • Computation of Income for last 2 years

As part of Bank Statement you have to submit the following –

  • Balance Sheet
  • Income statement
  • Income Tax Returns for last 2 years
  • Bank Statement for 6 months

items.question: What documents do I have to submit as address proof when I apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer:
You have to submit the following documents as address proof when you apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank –

  • Driving License
  • Passport
  • Voters ID card
  • Rental Agreement or Title Deed of Property
  • Electricity Bill or Telephone Bill
  • Letter from Employer
  • Sales Tax ITR or RC or Form 18

items.question: What documents do I have to submit as age proof when I apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank?

You have to submit the following documents as age proof when you apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank –

  • Passport
  • School Leaving Certificate
  • Driving License
  • Voters ID Card
  • LIC Policy
  • Birth Certificate
  • PAN Card

  • PAN Card

items.question: What is the maximum tenure for which I can take a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: The maximum tenure for which you can take a car loan from IDBI Bank is 7 years.

items.question: Can I apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank online?
items.answer: Yes, you can apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank online.

items.question: Does IDBI Bank allow their car loan applicants to track the status of their loan applications online?
items.answer: Yes, IDBI Bank allows their car loan applicants to track the status of their loan applications online. To track the status, they have to open the website of IDBI Bank and locate 'Loan Application Tracking' on the homepage.

items.question: Where can I find the application form for IDBI Bank car loan?
items.answer: You can find the application form for IDBI Bank car loan on the website of the bank or you can collect it from any branch of the bank. On the website, you can either choose to submit an online application or download the form for 'Auto Loan'. You can find the form in the 'Apply Now' section of the website.

items.question: How do I apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: You can apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank online by visiting the website of the bank and clicking on 'Auto Loan' in the 'Apply Now' section. You can also apply for it by contacting on the Phone Banking numbers of IDBI Bank or by visiting any branch of the bank.

items.question: Does IDBI Bank charge a fee for the documentation and processing of car loans?
items.answer: Yes, IDBI Bank charges a fee for the documentation and processing of car loans.

items.question: What is the processing fee for auto loans offered by IDBI Bank?
items.answer: The processing fee for auto loans offered by IDBI Bank is zero for normal loans, Rs.1000 plus tax for Speed Auto Loan and Auto Loan for Nano. The bank does not charge a processing fee for Auto Loan for Aria and Safari or Storme.

items.question: Does IDBI Bank allow people to foreclose their car loan?
items.answer: Yes, IDBI Bank allows people to foreclose their car loan after 6 months (from the date of loan disbursement).

items.question: Will IDBI Bank charge a penalty if I foreclose my car loan within 6 months?
items.answer: If you foreclose your car loan within 6 months from the date of loan disbursement, then IDBI Bank will charge a penalty of 1 percent of the pending balance plus other applicable charges.

items.question: Will IDBI Bank charge a penalty if I foreclose my car loan after 6 months?
items.answer: If you foreclose your car loan 6 months after the loan was disbursed, then IDBI Bank will not charge any penalty for it.

items.question: How can I calculate the EMI for car loans offered by IDBI Bank?
items.answer: To calculate the EMI for car loans offered by IDBI Bank, you can use the EMI calculator on the website of the bank. You can find the EMI calculator on the homepage and also in the Auto Loan section of the website.

items.question: How do I repay the car loan to IDBI Bank?
items.answer: You can repay the car loan to IDBI Bank in Equated Monthly Installments (EMI), which includes both the principal amount and the rate of interest. You can either give standing instructions to the bank to deduct the EMI from your bank account or you can repay via the ECS facility. Through the ECS facility you allow IDBI Bank to debit your car loan EMI automatically from a bank account that you hold with another bank.

items.question: Does IDBI Bank charge a late payment fee, if their car loan borrowers forget to pay their EMI on time?
items.answer: Yes, IDBI Bank charges a late payment fee, if their car loan borrowers forget to pay their EMI on time.

items.question: What is the penal interest charge for borrowers of IDBI Bank car loan?
items.answer: For the borrowers of IDBI Bank car loan, the penal interest charge is 2 percent per month of the amount that is overdue and the time period for which it has been overdue.

items.question: What is the verification process for IDBI Bank car loan?
items.answer: The verification process for IDBI Bank car loan is similar to the one followed by most Indian banks. First the bank will review your application and see if you are eligible for the car loan or not. Then they will check all the documents you have provided and if everything is correct, then your loan will be approved.

items.question: How long does it take for IDBI Bank to approve and process car loan applications?
items.answer: IDBI Bank takes very little time to approval and process car loan applications. If you pass the verification round, the bank will approve the loan and the amount will be disbursed quickly.

items.question: Can I check in advance if I am eligible to apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: Yes, you can check in advance if you are eligible to apply for a car loan from IDBI Bank by using the 'Eligibility Calculator'. You can find this calculator on the website of the bank.

items.question: Who do I contact to get details about car loans offered by IDBI Bank?
items.answer: You can contact the customer care department of IDBI Bank to get details about their car loan schemes. To get in touch with the customer care, you can call up on the toll free number of the bank. You can also visit any branch of the bank to get the details.

sections.title: Overview of Car Loans from Karnataka Bank

elements.body:
A car is a reliable asset which helps you save money in the long-run since it is more affordable than paying for a rented car, hiring a cab or even using public transport systems. A car offers you and your family convenience and luxury compared to travelling in a congested bus or auto. It is also reliable in terms of ease of access, especially in times of emergency. With the availability of various car loan schemes from multiple banks and financial institutions in India, owning a car has become much easier.

Karnataka Bank is a leading scheduled commercial bank in India, which was established in 1924. It currently has 684 branches spread across India and a customer base of 6.7 million people. One among it's wide portfolio of financial products and services, is the KBL car finance. This car loan scheme provides loans for both new and used cars and is available at an affordable interest rate and various other exclusive features.

sections.title: Why choose Karnataka Bank Car Loans?

elements.body: Karnataka Bank car finance is offered to an eligible individual, for the purchase of new cars/ used cars at affordable interest rates. It has no hidden charges, lower fees and charges, flexible loan repayment options, etc., which makes it a much sought-after loan option.

sections.title: Features of Car Loans from Karnataka Bank

elements.body:
• The loan amount for a new car loan is maximum 85% of the on-road price of the vehicle (includes cost of vehicle, Road Tax, motor insurance, and registration charges), subject to a maximum of Rs.75 lakh.
  • The loan amount for a used car loan is maximum of Rs.20 lakh.
  • The maximum loan tenure applicable on purchase of a new vehicle is a period of up to 84 months (7 years) and 34 months for a used vehicle.
  • Margin requirement of Karnataka Bank new car loan is 15% of the on-road price of the vehicle and for an old car loan is 25-30% of the value of the second-hand vehicle.
  • The security that has to be offered to the Bank in order to avail the car loan is the hypothecation of vehicle to be purchased or a third party guarantee/co-obligation.

elements.prefix: We can help you identify the best

sections.title: Karnataka Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body: All the loans which are sanctioned post April 2016 has to follow the new lending rate system – MCLR (Marginal Cost Based Lending Rate). This is a tenure based benchmark. Existing Karnataka Bank car loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria for Karnataka Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
• The age limit for borrowers is 18 years and above.
  • Applicants must be an income tax assessee.
  • Agriculturists with properties can apply for a car loan from the bank.
  • In addition to salaried and self-employed individuals, companies, firms, trusts, societies, and associations can avail a car loan from the bank in the name of the business or its managing directors, partners, trustees, executives, and presidents.
  • Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) are also eligible for a car loan from the bank.

sections.title: Karnataka Bank Car Loan Eligibility Calculator

elements.body: To find out whether you meet the eligibility criteria for a car loan from Karnataka Bank, use the free online car loan eligibility calculator. Visit the bank website and click on the 'Apply Online' tab. You will be directed to a page with the eligibility calculator. Fill an online form with details such as type of loan, resident type, name, occupation, income, gender, date of birth, purpose of the loan, etc. Click on the 'Get Loan Quote' button and find out how much car loan you are eligible for from Karnataka Bank. Checking car loan eligibility beforehand can help you avoid loan rejection which in turn, can affect your credit score.

sections.title: Document required to apply for Karnataka Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Applicants are required to submit the duly-filled and signed application form along with the following documents to the bank in order to complete the application process for a Karnataka Bank car loan:

  • Photo ID proof (PAN Card, Aadhaar Card, Passport, Voter ID, Driving License)
  • Address Proof (Utility bills, Ration Card)
  • Last 2 years' Income Tax Return, Form 16
  • Salary slips of 1 year in the case of salaried applicants
  • Quotation from the authorized showroom

sections.title: How to apply online for a Karnataka Bank car loan?

elements.body: Rather than wait in queue at a bank branch to interact with a bank representative with regard to your car loan requirement, you can visit the bank website and apply for it online from the comfort of your home or office. First, check your car loan eligibility before applying for it. After ensuring you meet the eligibility criteria set by the bank, click on the 'Apply Online' tab on the right-hand side of the page. Submit a duly-filled car loan application form online. The necessary age, identity, income, and address proof documents can be uploaded online as well. The bank will take 2 to 4 working days to process your application.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

sections.title: How to track Karnataka Bank car loan status?

elements.body:
Visit the bank website to check your car loan application status. Click on the 'Check Status' tab on the left-hand side of the page. Enter your tracking number and email ID or mobile number. Then click on the 'Show Details' button. Your Karnataka Bank car loan status will be displayed on the screen or sent to you via email or text message to your mobile. You can also visit the bank branch at which you applied for a car loan to check your application status.

Karnataka Bank Branch Locator

You can apply for a car loan at one of the branches of Karnataka Bank. In order to locate the nearest bank branch in your locality, use the online 'Branch Locator' that is available on the bank website. Just enter your city and state into the tool and click on the 'Search' button. You will get the address, phone number and map directions to the nearest bank branch.

sections.title: How to calculate EMI on Karnataka Bank Car Loans?

elements.body: By calculating your equated monthly installments (EMIs) in advance, you can make important decisions about your available car loan options as well as execute a good financial plan/ budget for yourself. Since it is very hard to manually calculate your repayment options and amortization schedule, a potential borrower can use the online car loan EMI calculator offered by BankBazaar.com. This tool can be found under the 'Finance Tools' section on BankBazaar's main page. The next few steps involve keying-in vital information such as the desired amount of car loan, interest rate, tenure and processing fee, either manually or by using the sliders and then clicking on "Calculate”. Within a few seconds you can access your EMI details as well as your amortisation schedule. This tool is available to all users free of charge and can be used multiple times to arrive at an EMI value that suits your budget. Ultimately, a car loan EMI calculator assists a customer to choose the right car loan option for himself/ herself.

elements.linkText: Check Karnataka Bank Car Loan EMI

sections.title: Karnataka Bank Car Loan EMI Calculator

elements.body: Calculating the EMI of your proposed car loan can help you choose an affordable loan amount and a suitable loan tenure. Finding out how much your car loan will cost you on a monthly basis can help you create a monthly budget in order to maintain a low debt-to-income ratio. A high debt-to-income ratio wherein your EMI is more than your income can result in you defaulting on your car loan. To avoid such a scenario, it is advisable to calculate your proposed car loan EMI before applying for it. The official website of Karnataka Bank offers a free online car loan EMI calculator that you can use any number of times for free of charge. Karnataka Bank Car Loan EMI Calculator is simple and easy to use. Just enter your proposed car loan amount, loan tenure, and interest rate into the tool and click on the 'calculate' button. You will get a breakdown of your EMI, interest payable, and the total cost of the loan.

items.question: What types of four wheelers can be purchased with Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: All kinds of new four wheelers can be purchased using Karnataka Bank Car Loan. Second-hand/used/pre-owned vehicles not more than 5 years from its date of registration, can also be purchased with Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

items.question: What is the eligibility criteria to apply for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
The following class of customers can apply for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

  • The customer must be an income tax assessee
  • A company, association, trust, firm, societies availing the loan in the name of its executive, managing partner, managing director, president, secretary, managing trustee or its name
  • Non Resident Indians

items.question: What is the maximum loan quantum that will be offered for new four wheelers to be purchased with Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: New car loan - maximum 85% of the on-road price of the vehicle (includes cost of vehicle, Road Tax, motor insurance, and registration charges), subject to a maximum of Rs.75 lakh.

items.question: I am planning to purchase an used vehicle with Karnataka Bank Car Loan. What is the maximum loan quantum that will be offered?
items.answer: The loan amount for a used car loan is maximum of Rs.20 lakh.

items.question: Will costs of insurance and road tax will be included when computing the loan quantum for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No, costs of insurance and road tax will not be included when calculating the loan quantum for Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure offered for the purchase of used cars under Karnataka Bank Car Loan scheme?
items.answer: Borrowers can choose a maximum tenure of up to 34 months for the purchase of second-hand vehicles with Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

items.question: I am planning to purchase a new car with Karnataka Bank Car Loan. What is the maximum tenure option that I can choose?
items.answer: For the purchase of new cars, Karnataka Bank offers a maximum tenure option of up to 84 months.

items.question: Can NRIs apply for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, Karnataka Bank Car Loan is offered to Non Resident Indians also.

items.question: What is the security for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
The following is prescribed as security for Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

  • Hypothecation of the four wheeler to be purchased
  • Third party guarantee or co-obligation in case of an individual applicant

items.question: Where can I get an application form for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Customers can download a copy of the application form for Karnataka Bank Car Loan from the bank's web portal. Alternatively, customers can also collect the application form for car loan from the nearest bank branch.

items.question: What is the interest rates for KBL Car Loan?
items.answer:
• New vehicle loan up to Rs.75 lakh - 9.10% p.a. (existing customers with a good track record can get 9% p.a.)
  • Old vehicle loan up to Rs.20 lakh - 13.50% p.a.

items.question: How do I calculate the EMI for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: To calculate the EMI amount for Karnataka Bank Car Loan, you can use the online car loan EMI calculator tool offered by BankBazaar. You will need to input details like principal amount, tenure and interest rates to find out the monthly instalment amount and amortization schedule.

items.question: What extra charges will I incur when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Other charges that you will incur when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan include processing fees, stamp duty, repossession charges and other incidental charges as applicable. Do enquire with Karnataka Bank about the current charges for car loans as rates and charges are subject to frequent change.

items.question: How long does Karnataka Bank take for processing car loan applications?
items.answer: Karnataka Bank Car Loan applications will be generally processed within 7 working days provided the customer has submitted all required documents and has completed all required formalities.

items.question: How is the loan quantum calculated for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: The loan quantum is calculated based on a variety of factors including the applicant's class (if self employed or salaried), applicant's age, repayment capacity and the guarantee offered by the borrower.

items.question: What documents related to an used car do I have to submit while applying for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
If an applicant is planning to purchase an used car with Karnataka Bank Car Loan, he has to submit the following documents.

  • Registration certificate of the vehicle. Original RC must be submitted at the time of disbursement.
  • Agreement of sale between buyer and seller
  • Prescribed transfer form, executed by the seller for onward submission to the RTO
  • Particulars of the vehicles to be purchased
  • Copy of receipts of up to date deposit of taxes including road tax
  • Recent quotation of the vehicle from an authorized dealer

items.question: Will Karnataka Bank Car Loan borrowers get customer support from the bank during the loan process?
items.answer: Yes, Karnataka Bank Car Loan borrowers can contact the customer service cell of the bank anytime by using the toll-free number 1800 425 1444, or the email id. Customers can also contact the nearest bank branch for assistance during the loan process.

items.question: Will my CIBIL scores be considered for Karnataka Bank Car Loan approval?
items.answer: Yes, though CIBIL scores are not generally insisted upon, having a good CIBIL score will increase the chances of car loan approval. Karnataka Bank considers the credit repayment history and CIBIL score of the customer before approving a car loan.

items.question: I am a salaried applicant. What documents do I have to submit when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Salaried applicants should submit the following income documents when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

  • Latest salary slips
  • Latest Form 16
  • IT Return statements
  • Bank account statements showing salary credit

items.question: What income documents should agriculturists submit when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Agriculturists must submit documents related to cropping pattern and land holding. They must also submit other income documents like bank account statements, if applicable, when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

items.question: What documents should a customer submit when applying for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
An applicant must submit the following documents while applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

  • Income Proof
  • Identity Proof
  • Address Proof
  • Duly-filled application form
  • Letter from a guarantor, if applicable
  • Quotation for the vehicle from a recognized seller

items.question: Do I have to present a guarantor for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, individual applicants must present security in form of third-party co-obligation or guarantee.

items.question: Can existing customers of Karnataka Bank apply for a Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, existing customers of Karnataka Bank and borrowers of other credit products can apply for KBL car loan.

items.question: Does Karnataka Bank offer financing for two-wheelers under the same scheme as well?
items.answer: Karnataka Bank offers loan for two-wheelers under KBL Easy Ride scheme.

items.question: What income documents does a self-employed applicant have to submit when applying for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Self-employed applicants must submit income tax return statements, balance sheet, profit and loss statements, bank account statements and proof of business establishments.

items.question: How can I apply for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Customers can visit any of the nearest Karnataka Bank branch to apply for a Karnataka Bank Car Loan. Customers will be asked to fill out an application form and present all necessary documents to proceed with the car loan process.

items.question: Can a borrower make a joint application for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, customers can apply either singly or jointly for Karnataka Bank Car Loan. Any of the immediate family members (like spouse, children and parents) can be made as co-borrowers in case of joint application.

items.question: How can I make the EMI payments for Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Customers can choose from any of the following methods to make EMI payments for Karnataka Bank Car Loan.

  • Internet Banking
  • Post Dated Cheques (PDCs)
  • Electronic Clearing System (ECS) Debit facility
  • Standing instruction to Karnataka Bank account to remit the amount directly to loan account.

items.question: What are the various stages involved in a Karnataka Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Karnataka Bank Car Loan process consists of the following stages.

  • Application - the customer makes an application and submits all required documents
  • Sanction - a loan quantum is approved by the bank based on applicant's profile
  • Disbursement - the amount is disbursed to the borrower or the dealer

sections.title: Overview About Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Why resort to public transportation when you can travel in the comfort of your own car? If you are worried about how to finance the purchase of a four-wheeler, rest easy, since Karur Vysya Bank offers car loans at attractive and affordable interest rates through its Flexi Mobile Loan scheme.

Karur Vysya Bank, established in 1916, offers a wide portfolio of financial products and services to its customers. It ensures easy accessibility through its large network of approximately 629 branches and 1645 ATMs across the country. Its Flexi Mobile Loan scheme is a popular product due to its incomparable features such as insurance coverage, low fees and charges, etc.

sections.title: Why choose Karur Vysya Bank Car Loans

elements.body: Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan scheme - Flexi Mobile Loan offers high loan amounts as required by the customer if they meet the eligibility criteria. The repayment option is highly flexible, with easy and affordable EMIs and other additional benefits.

sections.title: Features of Car Loans from Karur Vysya Bank

elements.body:
• The Hypothecation of car which is purchased using the car loan, has to be offered as primary security.
  • Collateral security is not mandatory. However, Bank Deposits, NSC/KVP/LIC Policies, Land & Building deeds etc., can be submitted with the Bank as a collateral.
  • The net take-home salary after deduction of the EMI should be at least 25% of the gross salary of the customer.
  • Having a guarantor is optional. In order to increase net worth, a Guarantor - preferably family, friends or spouse - is considered by the Bank
  • If the applicant is a salaried individual, it is mandatory that the employer agrees to deduct loan installments and interest on the car loan from the borrower's salary.

elements.prefix: Spending a lot on cabs every day? It's smarter to buy your own car.

sections.title: Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
MCLR Rate helps the RBI as well as the loan issuing banks to assign interest rate on car loan products in an efficient manner. The final rate of interest applicable is calculated as the sum of the MCLR Rate plus the "Spread”. Existing Karur Vysya Bank car loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations.

Karur Vysya Bank Marginal Cost Based Lending Rate (MCLR) for New Borrowers:

MCLR Benchmark Tenure1 year
Benchmark MCLR rate9.60%

The above mentioned interest rates are subject to change as per the revised GST rates.

sections.title: Eligibility criteria for a Car Loan from Karur Vysya Bank

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria for availing a car loan from Karur Vysya Bank is as follows:

  • All residents of India, except individuals engaged in the business of car hiring/rental, can avail Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan scheme.

  • Flexi Mobile loan is made available to customers who wish to purchase a new or used car, for personal or business use and not for car hiring.

Car Loan EMI calculators help to understand the exact amount of loan that you need, the loan tenure that you can opt for, the rate of interest on the car loan, etc., and hence makes your car loan decision making process much easier. BankBazaar.com provides an ideal EMI calculator tool that assists customers in getting a clear and accurate idea of their car loan repayments and how it pans out across a chosen tenure. BankBazaar's car loan EMI calculator gives a detailed picture of your amortization schedule once you key in essential information such as desired loan amount, loan tenure, applicable interest rates, etc. You can access the tool by visiting the BankBazaar website, choosing car loan EMI calculator from the "Finance Tools” menu , enter the necessary details and click on "calculate”. You will be redirected to the results page where you can find detailed information on your monthly EMI's and other relevant details of your Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan.

faq.title: Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan FAQs

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount that can be availed?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount that can be availed is Rs.75 lakhs.

items.question: What is the processing fee charged on Flexi Mobile Loan?
items.answer: The processing fees charged on the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan is Rs.4000.00 plus GST for loans up to Rs.10 Lakhs and for loans above Rs.10 lakhs, the processing fee charged is Rs.8000 plus GST.

items.question: What is the applicable loan margin for purchase of new vehicle?
items.answer: The loan margin applicable on new cars is 15%.

items.question: Is insurance coverage provided while availing the loan?
items.answer: Yes, insurance coverage is available on the car loan, to the extent of the loan amount approved by the Bank. The insurance premium is payable by the borrower.

items.question: What is the mode of the payment made to the seller/distributor?
items.answer: The mode of payment for the purchase of the car, to the seller/distributor, is through NEFT/DD/ Account credit/RTGS, etc.

items.question: What is the maximum car loan amount that Karur Vysya Bank offers?
items.answer: The maximum car loan amount that Karur Vysya Bank offers is Rs.75,00,000.

items.question: What is the processing fee levied on the Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: The processing fees levied on the Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan- Flexi Mobile Loan for an amount up to Rs.10 Lakhs is waived. For a loan amount more than Rs.10,00,000, the processing fee levied is Rs.8000 + applicable GST.

items.question: What is the loan margin on the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan for purchase of new vehicle?
items.answer: The loan margin on the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan for purchase of new vehicle is 15%.

items.question: Does the loan scheme offer insurance coverage to the borrower?
items.answer: Yes, the loan scheme offers insurance coverage to the borrower based on the loan amount sanctioned by the Bank. The premium on the insurance is payable by the borrower.

items.question: How is the payment towards the purchase of the car made to the seller/distributor?
items.answer: The payment towards the purchase of the car, to the seller, is made by way of demand draft, NEFT, direct credit to their account, RTGS, etc.

items.question: Does Karur Vysya Bank offer financing for purchase of a pre-owned car?
items.answer: Yes, Karur Vysya Bank offers financing for purchase of a pre-owned car which is not more than 5 years old.

items.question: What is the loan margin applicable for used vehicles?
items.answer: The loan margin applicable on used cars is 25%.

items.question: What is the maximum repayment period for the purchase of a new car under the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan scheme?
items.answer: The maximum repayment period for the purchase of a new car under the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan scheme is 84 months.

items.question: What is the maximum repayment period for the purchase of a used car under the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan scheme?
items.answer: The maximum repayment period for the purchase of a used car under the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan scheme is 60 months.

items.question: What is the primary security that have to be pledged with Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: The primary security that have to be pledged with Karur Vysya Bank is in the form of hypothecation of the car financed by the loan.

items.question: Is collateral security mandatory to avail the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan?
items.answer: No, it is not mandatory to place a collateral security with the Bank to avail the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan.

items.question: What is the collateral security that can be pledged with Karur Vysya Bank to avail the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan?
items.answer: The collateral security that can be pledged with Karur Vysya Bank to avail the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan are- KVP, NSC, Bank Deposits, LIC Policies, Land & Building, and so on.

items.question: Is it mandatory to have a guarantor for the car loan?
items.answer: No, it is not mandatory to have a guarantor in order to avail the Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan.

items.question: Who can act as a guarantor for the Karur Vysya Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: A guarantor should have suitable net worth that is acceptable by the Bank. Preferably, the guarantor should be either the spouse or any member of the primary applicant's family.

items.question: What is the minimum loan amount stipulated by the Bank?
items.answer: The minimum loan amount offered to an applicant is not stipulated by the Bank as of now.

items.question: What kind of vehicle can I purchase using the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan?
items.answer: With the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan, borrowers can purchase new or used cars for business or personal use.

items.question: Can I use the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan to finance a car for rental/ hiring purposes?
items.answer: The car financed using a Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan cannot be used for car hiring purpose.

items.question: What is the interest rate applicable on the Flexi mobile loan for new vehicle?
items.answer: The rate of interest applicable on the Flexi mobile loan for new vehicle is calculated as Base Rate + 0.25%. Thus, current interest rate is 10.65%.

items.question: What is the interest rate applicable on the Flexi mobile loan for old vehicle?
items.answer: The rate of interest applicable on the Flexi mobile loan for new vehicle is calculated as Base Rate + 3.25%. Thus, current interest rate is 13.65%.

items.question: What is the effect of CIBIL score on getting an approval for the Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan?
items.answer: In order to get an approval on your Karur Vysya Bank car loan application, you should have a good CIBIL score or credit rating. This score is used to evaluate your repayment capacity, reliability and creditworthiness. Applicants who have a low credit score have a lower chance of getting a car loan approval.

items.question: How can I calculate the EMI on my Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan?
items.answer: Manually calculating the EMI on your Karur Vysya Bank Flexi Mobile Loan can be done using the formula EMI = [P x R x (1+R)^N]/[(1+R)^N-1], where P = principal or loan amount, R is the rate of interest rate per month [ interest rate per annum can be converted to per month interest as rate per annum divided by 12 x 100], and N = number of monthly instalments.

items.question: Can I calculate my Karur Vysya Bank car loan EMI online?
items.answer: Yes, you can calculate your Karur Vysya Bank car loan EMI online using the online car loan EMI calculator tool offered by BankBazaar.

items.question: How can I know whether I am eligible for a Karur Vysya Bank car loan?
items.answer: In order to check your Karur Vysya Bank car loan eligibility, you can use the online car loan eligibility calculator tool offered by BankBazaar.

items.question: Will the car loan EMIs be deducted directly from the salary of a salaried borrower?
items.answer: Yes, the car loan EMI can be deducted from the salary of a salaried individual, once the employer approves the same.

items.question: How do I get more information on the car loan scheme offered by Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: In order to get more information on the Flexi Mobile Scheme offered by Karur Vysya Bank, you can directly approach a Bank branch or contact the Bank's dedicated customer care service

items.question: How can I contact the Bank's customer care service for car loan related queries or concerns?
items.answer: You can contact the Bank's dedicated customer care service via email: customerservice@kvbmail.com or via the customer care number: 1860 200 1916.

items.question: Can foreigners residing in India apply for this car loan?
items.answer: Yes, all Indian residents can apply for this car loan if they have the required documents and proofs.

items.question: What is the debt-to-income ratio that is considered ideal for the borrower, by Karur Vysya Bank?
items.answer: The borrower should have a net take home pay of 25% of the gross income earned, after paying the loan EMI.

items.question: What are the amendment charges applicable on the loan?
items.answer: The amendment charges applicable on the loan is equal to 0.25% of the sanctioned loan amount.

items.question: What are the documentation charges applicable on a loan amount worth up to Rs. 25 lakhs?
items.answer: The documentation charges applicable on a loan amount worth up to Rs. 25 lakhs is Rs. 1000.

items.question: What kind of cars is financing available for?
items.answer: You can get finance for passenger cars and multiutility cars from leading manufacturers. Financing is also available for imported cars subject to certain terms and conditions.

items.question: Is there a pre-payment option and a pre-payment fee?
items.answer: Yes, you can pre-pay the loan after 6 months after paying a nominal amount as pre-payment fee.

items.question: Do I need a guarantor to be eligible for a KMPL car loan?

items.question: How long does it take to process the loan amount?

items.question: How is the rate of interest calculated?

elements.body: The Nainital Bank Limited is a private Indian bank, Based in Nainital, over the years, the bank has expanded to Uttar Pradesh and especially in Uttarakhand State, and has over 100 branches in Rajasthan, Delhi and Haryana states. In 1975 Government-owned Bank of Baroda (BOB), third largest bank in India, after the State Bank of India and the Punjab National Bank, acquired a majority stake (98.6%) and management control of the bank, and made it a subsidiary. Their deposit products and retail loans help you with your growing financial needs with facilities like Lockers we ensure that your valuables are safe with us. To know more, follow some simple steps given below to get best interest rates.

sections.title: Overview About Nainital Bank Car Loan

elements.body: Nainital Bank Limited has its roots dating back to 1922 when it was established to cater to the banking needs of the regional customers. In 1973, Bank of Baroda was directed by Reserve Bank of India to manage the affairs of Nainital bank. Bank of Baroda has 98.57% of the shares while the remainder of 1.43% shares is held by the public. The bank currently operates across five states in India through over 120 branches. It is a customer-centric bank that services customers financial needs promptly and efficiently.

sections.title: Why choose Nainital Bank Car Loans

elements.body: Nainital offers car loans under the Suhana Safar Scheme that provides customers with financing for both two wheelers and four wheelers. You can get a loan for both new and used cars with very minimal eligibility criteria to fulfill. Enjoy maximum loan amounts with very low margins. Repay the loan with long tenures and easy EMIs.

sections.title: Features of Car Loans from Nainital Bank

elements.body:
• Avail of a loan for new and used cars or jeeps.
  • Loans are available only for new two-wheelers.
  • You can avail of this loan to repay loans of other banks, financial institutions or companies, and continue your loan with Nainital at better interest rates and terms.
  • Enjoy low margins on your vehicle loan.
  • Get long tenures to pay off the car loan in easy EMIs.
  • Farmers can avail of loan repayment schemes on half-yearly basis in accordance to crop patterns.
  • Special concessionary rates are available as a Festive offer.

elements.prefix: Compare policies online and get

sections.title: Nainital Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Nainital Bank has incorporated the MCLR system for determining the interest rate on its various loan products, including its car loan – Suhana Safar car loan scheme. Existing Nainital Bank Car Loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations. The MCLR rate followed by the Bank is as follows:

TenureMCLR Percentage (in effect from April 2016)
Overnight9.00%
1 month9.00%
3 months9.05%
6 months9.15%
1 year9.30%

Base Rate applicable for existing Nainital Bank Car Loan borrowers = 9.75%

sections.title: How to calculate EMI on Nainital Bank Car Loans

elements.body:
To estimate the EMI amount on your car loan, visit BankBazaar.com, and follow these simple steps.

  • Select "Finance Tools” in the tab available on the home page.
  • Under "EMI Calculator”, select "Car Loan EMI Calculator”
  • You need to enter details required for EMI calculation:
    • Loan amount
    • Tenure
    • Interest rate
    • Processing fee
    • And if you would like to make prepayments on your loan
  • Click on "calculate” to find out the necessary details of your car loan.

items.question: Who can apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: All individuals can apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler.

items.question: For what purpose can I apply for a car loan from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: You can apply for a car loan from Nainital Bank for the purpose of purchasing a new or old car or Jeep.

items.question: Can farmers apply for a car loan from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: Yes, farmers can apply for a car loan from Nainital Bank.

items.question: What is rate of interest for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: The rate of interest for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler is Base Rate plus 0.25 percent.

items.question: Can I apply for a car loan from Nainital Bank for the purpose of repaying loans of other banks or financial companies or financial institutions?
items.answer: Yes, you can apply for a car loan from Nainital Bank for the purpose of repaying loans of other banks or financial companies or financial institutions.

items.question: Can I use the loan I get through Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler for commercial purposes?
items.answer: No, you cannot use the loan you get through Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler for commercial purposes.

items.question: What is the maximum amount of loan that I can avail for purchase of new cars through Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: The maximum amount of loan that you can avail for purchase of new cars through Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler is Rs.25, 00, 000.

items.question: What is the maximum amount of loan that I can avail for purchase of old cars through Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: The maximum amount of loan that you can avail for purchase of old cars through Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler is Rs.10, 00, 000.

items.question: Can I calculate the car loan EMI that I have to pay to Nainital Bank in advance?
items.answer: Yes, you can calculate the car loan EMI that you have to pay to Nainital Bank in advance. To calculate, you can use the EMI calculator present on the website of the bank. You can find the link to the EMI calculator in the ‘Tools and Utilities Section’ on the homepage of the bank’s website.

items.question: Is there a margin on the car loans offered by Nainital Bank?
items.answer: Yes, there is a margin on the car loans offered by Nainital Bank.

items.question: What is the loan margin on new cars as per Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: The loan margin on new cars as per Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler is minimum 10 percent of the cost of the car. This percentage includes the sales tax.

items.question: What is the loan margin on old cars as per Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: The loan margin on old cars as per Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler is minimum 35 percent of the present value of the car.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure of Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler in case of new cars?
items.answer: The maximum tenure of Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler in case of new cars is 84 months.

items.question: What is the maximum tenure of Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler in case of used cars?
items.answer: The maximum tenure of Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler in case of used cars is 36 months.

items.question: What is the repayment tenure for farmers who apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: For farmers who apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler, the repayment tenure is fixed on half yearly basis and is dependent on their cropping pattern.

items.question: Can I apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler online?
items.answer: No, you cannot apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler online.

items.question: How to apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: You can apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler from any branch of the bank. To apply you have to visit the Bank branch that is nearest to you and fill up the application form and submit the required documents.

items.question: What documents do I have to provide while applying for a car loan from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: While applying for a car loan from Nainital Bank you have to provide all the KYC documents such as Identity proof, address proof, etc.

items.question: Do I have to submit an income proof when I apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: Yes, you have to submit an income proof when you apply for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler.

items.question: Does Nainital Bank charge a processing fee for car loans?
items.answer: Yes, Nainital Bank charges a processing fee of 0.5 percent plus documentation charges for car loans. The value of this fee is a minimum of Rs.500 plus service tax.

items.question: What is the deviation charge for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: The deviation charge for Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler is Rs.1000 per deviation.

items.question: Does Nainital Bank charge a fee for CIBIl report?
items.answer: Yes, Nainital Bank charges a certain amount of fee for CIBIl report.

items.question: Am I allowed to prepay the car loan I availed from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: Yes, you are allowed to prepay the car loan that you availed from Nainital Bank.

items.question: Will Nainital Bank charge a prepayment fee if I prepay my car loan?
items.answer: If you prepay the car loan fully or partially using your own source of funds, then Nainital Bank will not charge a prepayment fee from you.

items.question: Will Nainital Bank charge a late payment fee in case I fail to pay my car loan EMI on time?
items.answer: Yes, Nainital Bank will charge 2 percent on your unpaid EMI as late payment fee in case you fail to pay your car loan EMI on time.

items.question: How do I pay the car loan EMI to Nainital Bank every month?
items.answer: You can give standing instructions to Nainital Bank to debit the car loan EMI every month from your bank account. You can also pay the EMI via post- dated cheques.

items.question: Will my CIBIL score help me get a good car loan deal from Nainital Bank?
items.answer: Yes, if your CIBIL score is very good, then it will help you get a good car loan deal from Nainital Bank. Banks tend to give loans at good interest rates to people with a high credit score.

items.question: In how much time will Nainital Bank process my car loan application?
items.answer: Nainital Bank will process your car loan application very fast if you are eligible for the loan and if you have provided all the required documents along with the application form to the bank.

items.question: How will Nainital Bank verify and approve my car loan application?
items.answer: Nainital Bank will first verify if you have provided all the correct information and documents in the application process. Once they are sure that everything is in order, they will approve your car loan application quickly and disburse the loan amount within a few hours.

items.question: How can I get more information about Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler?
items.answer: You can get more information about Nainital Bank Suhana Safar Scheme for Financing of Four/ Two Wheeler from the customer care department of the bank. To contact the customer care service of Nainital Bank, you can call up on the phone number mentioned on the website. You can also get more information about this loan scheme from any branch of the bank.

items.title: Nainital Bank Personal Loan Interest Rates

elements.body: Punjab National Bank customers can avail a car loans at affordable interest rates starting from 9.05% and up to 9.50%. The repayment tenure for a car loan can from 1 year and 7 years. The interest rate charged takes into account various factors such as the loan amount, repayment tenure, whether the customer is purchasing a new car or a pre-owned car, and their credit score.

sections.title: Key features of PNB Car Loan

elements.body:
Some of the key features of PNB Car Loan are given below:

  • Repayment tenure up to 7 years for new cars and 5 years from pre-owned cars.
  • Affordable processing fee.
  • Affordable rate of interest.
  • The applicant must have a minimum salary or pension amount of Rs.20,000. This means that a person even with a low earning salary can apply for a car loan from PNB.
  • The margin on the loan is up to 15% of the on-road price of a new car and up to 30% if you are looking to purchase a pre-owned car.

sections.title: Punjab National Bank car loan eligibility

elements.body:
Some of the eligibility criteria you will have to fulfil to be eligible for a car loan from Punjab National Bank are given below:

  • The applicant must avail a car loan from PNB to purchase a vehicle for personal use only.
  • Can either be a salaried individual or a self-employed person.
  • Should have a minimum monthly income or monthly pension of Rs.20,000.
  • Be able to provide collateral if required.

faq.title: Punjab National Bank Car Loan FAQ'S

items.question: For what types of vehicles does Punjab National Bank offer car loans?
items.answer: Punjab National Bank offers car loan for the purchase of new car, jeep, van, Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) and Multi Utility Vehicle (MUV). PNB Car loan is also offered for the purchase of old car, jeep, van, SUV and MUV which are not older than three years.

items.question: Who can apply for a Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Individuals and business concerns (corporate or non - corporate) can apply for Punjab National Bank car loan for purchase of a four-wheeler for private use only.

items.question: What is the loan quantum offered for individuals under Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: For individuals and proprietorship concerns, 25 times of net monthly salary, income or pension or Rs. 100 lakhs, whichever is lower, will be offered as total car loan amount. Car loan quantum higher than the amount mentioned will be considered on merits of case.

items.question: What is the security to be provided for Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: The security prescribed for Punjab National Bank Car Loan is hypothecation of vehicle purchased using the loan.

items.question: Is third party guarantee required for Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, collateral security or third-party guarantee is required for Punjab National Bank Car Loan. However, this may be waived off by the loan sanctioning authority on merits of individual case.

items.question: Will I incur any penalty if I foreclose my PNB car loan floating interest rate scheme?
items.answer: If you have availed the car loan under floating interest rate scheme, no prepayment charges will be levied.

items.question: What is the quantum of finance offered for corporate and non-corporate applicants purchasing a vehicle for business concerns?
items.answer: There is no ceiling on the car loan amount for one or more vehicles purchased for business purposes whether the applicant is a corporate or non-corporate.

items.question: Can the income of immediate family members be added for increasing loan eligibility?
items.answer: Yes, income of immediate family members like parents, spouse and earning children can be added to increase the loan amount and eligibility. However, the income of only one person can be added and that person will also stand as the co-borrower.

items.question: Can agriculturists and farmers apply for Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, customers who are self-employed and involved in agriculture and allied activities can apply for Punjab National Bank Car Loan provided they satisfy the minimum income criteria.

items.question: car loan EMI?How do I find out my monthly
items.answer: EMI is the fixed amount that you must pay to the lender in order to pay off both the principal and interest amount. The EMI amount depends on various factors like tenure, interest rate and principal. You can use an online EMI calculator available on BankBazaar to calculate your monthly instalment amount and also to view your amortization schedule.

items.question: How do I get the application form for Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: The application form for Punjab National Bank Car Loan is available online at PNB's website. Also, you can get a copy of the application form by visiting the nearest branch. You can track the status of the loan application online.

items.question: How do I track my car loan application status online?
items.answer: You can visit the PNB website to view your loan application status online, you will be required to login by entering user name and password. Once you have logged on, you will able to view the car loan application status.

items.question: Do women borrowers get any special benefits for availing Punjab National Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Yes, women borrowers get concession in car loan interest rates when they apply for PNB car loans. The interest rates for women borrowers are as follows.

CategoryRepayment PeriodInterest Rate
