sections.title: Religare Health Insurance Policy Renewal:

elements.body: In order to provide a continuous comprehensive health insurance coverage for yourself and your family, make sure to renew your policy on time. For insurance plans provided by Religare Health Insurance, renewal can be done online through the company website. Renewal premium payment can also be paid online using net banking, credit card, or debit card. Click on the 'Renew' tab available on the top right-hand corner of the page. Enter your policy number and date of birth to initiate the renewal process.

sections.title: Religare Health Insurance Premium Calculator:

elements.body:
The online insurance premium calculator available on the Religare Health Insurance website can be used to calculate the monthly premium and gross premium including tax for the chosen policy. Here is how Religare Health Insurance premium calculator works:

  • Navigate to the insurer's official website.
  • Enter the number of members to be insured (number of adults and children in the case of a floater plan).
  • Provide your contact details such as phone number and email ID.
  • Enter the sum insured amount and policy term in years.
  • Click on calculate and the total premium will be displayed onscreen.

Religare Health Insurance premium calculator is simple and easy to use. Knowing the insurance premium of a policy can help you choose a suitable health insurance plan.

sections.title: Religare Health Insurance Customer Care:

elements.body:
Religare Health Insurance has a dedicated Helpdesk to resolve customer queries on its official website. Visit the website and click on 'Helpdesk' tab which on the top right corner of the page. The following customer service tools can be found under Helpdesk:

  • Customer Support: To give feedback, make a request or register a complaint, click on the Customer Support link and fill in the online form with your policy number and contact details. Queries can be regarding your policy, claim, refund, service, etc. The customer support centre of Religare Health Insurance is dedicated to making the process engaging for its customers.
  • Contact us: For any policy-related queries, you can also contact the company's Customer Service Team on their dedicated toll-free numbers or send them an email. Customers can also use the 'Live Chat' feature on the insurer's website to communicate with the insurer's representative.
  • Branch Locator: Religare Health Insurance branch offices are located across India. The nearest branch office can be located by selecting a state and city from the drop-down box.
  • e-policy: Policyholders can view their e-policy and tax receipt by providing their policy number and date of birth.
  • Hospital Locator: There are over 5420 network hospitals across India. You can use the Hospital Locator tool to check out the list of network hospitals in a particular location by selecting the state and city from the dropdown box. The address, phone number, and list of doctors working at the hospital will be displayed on screen. You can send an email or SMS to the hospital through the insurer's website regarding an appointment.
  • Claim Search: For reimbursement claims, payments are made through online bank transfers for which a cancelled cheque, claim form, and supporting documents have to be submitted by the policyholder to the insurer. Claim forms can be downloaded from the company website.
  • Grievance Redressal: In case you have any complaints or grievances, you can contact the insurer through the toll-free number or email ID provided on the website. Customers can also write to the insurer or walk into the nearest branch. If one is not satisfied with the resolution, the matter can be taken up with a higher authority, through the insurer's website.

Know More About: Religare Health Insurance Customer Care Number

sections.title: Religare Cashless Network Hospitals:

elements.body:
Individuals with a Religare Health Insurance policy can avail cashless hospitalisation at over 5,420 network hospital across India. Medical treatment can be availed at any one of the network hospitals that have tie-ups with Religare Health Insurance. In the case of a cashless treatment, you can avail treatment without paying for the medical expenses upfront. To locate a network hospital in your area, just enter your state and city on the Network Hospital Locator tool. You will instantly get a list of network hospitals with names, phone numbers, and addresses.

Find cashless network hospitals nearby: RELIGARE Cashless Network Hospitals

sections.title: How to File a Claim With Religare Health Insurance?

elements.body:
Unplanned Hospitalisation: In the case of an emergency or unplanned hospitalisation, intimate the insurer within 24 hours of hospitalisation.

  • Display your health card at the network hospital desk.
  • The hospital will submit a duly-filled and signed pre-authorisation request form to the insurance company or it's Third-Party Administrator (TPA) via fax.
  • The claim management will send an approval letter to the hospital.
  • The hospital will proceed with the cashless treatment for the insured member.
  • If the cashless claim is rejected, the insured member can initiate the treatment and file for a reimbursement claim after discharge.

Incurred Claims Ratio of Religare Health Insurance for the year 2017-18

Net Earned Premium (in Crore)Net Claims Paid (in Crore)Incurred Claims Ratio (in %)
Rs.679.67 croreRs.353.21 crore51.97%

Planned Hospitalisation: In the case of a planned hospitalisation, intimate the insurer 48 hours prior to your hospitalisation.

  • The reimbursement claim form has to be submitted to the insurer along with the required supporting documents such as discharge summary, medical reports, hospital bills, pharmacy bills, prescriptions, etc.
  • An approval letter will be sent by the claim management team. You will have to respond to the queries raised by the claim management team for a smooth claim processing experience.
  • The claim amount will be sent to the insured member after approval.

items.question: What are the benefits of buying health insurance?
items.answer: With the help of health insurance, you can enjoy a number of benefits such as nursing care, surgeries, consultation fees, cashless hospitalization for more than 24 hours, consultation fees, diagnostic tests, hospital accommodation etc. Your health insurance provider will pay off the coast incurred in your entire treatment procedure.

items.question: What is a network hospital?
items.answer: A network hospital is a hospital with which your health insurance provider has tie up. In a network hospital, you can enjoy cashless treatment. Religare Health Insurance has tie up with many leading hospitals where you can enjoy cashless hospitalization.

items.question: What is a health card?
items.answer: It is a kind of identity card that your health insurance provider gives you. You need to show this card at the network hospital to get the benefits of health insurance policy.

items.question: What is the meaning of cashless hospitalization? Does Religare Health Insurance provide it?
items.answer: Cashless hospitalization is a benefit you get from your health insurance provider under which your insurance company will pay for your hospitalization cost. Yes, Religare Health Insurance does provide cashless hospitalization facility at network hospitals, across India.

items.question: What is the meaning of a premium?
items.answer: A premium is the total amount of money you pay to your health insurance provider in return for the services it provides.

items.question: What do you mean by a family floater plan?
items.answer: A family floater plan refers to a health insurance policy that includes your entire family under it. It is a customised policy to meet the health needs of your family.

items.question: How is the customer service at Religare Health Insurance?
items.answer: Religare provides 24/7 customer support. You can call them at any time for any of your queries.

items.question: Can I correct the relationship in my policy document?
items.answer: Yes, you can correct or rectify the relationship in your policy. Religare will do it after proper verification. However, it is subject to your declaration of relationship at the time of buying the policy.

items.question: Is it possible to increase or reduce the sum insured in the policy?
items.answer: It is not possible to reduce or increase the sum insured in the main policy during the tenure of the policy. However, you can do it at the time of renewal. It is subject to terms and conditions of the policy.

items.question: Can I add and remove family members in my current policy?
items.answer: You can add and remove family members at the time of renewal of your policy, but not during the tenure of your policy. However, you can buy separate policy for separate members of your family.

items.question: Can I change my date of birth, if it gets written incorrectly in the policy document?
items.answer: Change in your DOB may affect your premium. For further details, you need to contact the nearest branch of Religare Health Insurance.

items.question: What are the formalities do I need to do get a claim?
items.answer: In order to enjoy a hassle-free completion of your claim settlement formalities, you can contact Religare's customer help desk. Also, you can visit its 'Claims' webpage to know more about your particular insurance cover.

items.question: What are the benefits of a health card?
items.answer: Health Card has to be displayed at the time of admission at a network hospital to avail cashless hospitalisation. This ID card has the contact details of the Third-Party Administrator in the case of a medical emergency, you can call the given number for assistance with cashless hospitalisation claims.

items.question: Can I revise the relationship in my plan?
items.answer: Revising relationship in a policy document is subject to verification of details with the proposal form at the time of purchasing the policy. Call the insurer's toll-free number 1800 200 4488 with your policy details or visit the nearest branch office to rectify the relationship in your policy document.

items.question: Can I change my DOB and will that affect my policy?
items.answer: Changing your Date of Birth (DOB) in the policy document can affect your insurance premium. Higher the age, higher the insurance premium.

items.question: What is the need to buy a Religare Health Insurance Policy?
What are the benefits of buying Religare Health Insurance at an early age?
items.answer:
Here is a list of reasons why you should buy health insurance at a young age:

  • Premium of a health insurance policy increases with age.
  • Senior citizen health insurance plans can be restrictive compared to a regular health insurance plan.
  • You can get coverage for medical conditions that may be diagnosed over the years, provided there is no break in the policy.
  • Every claim-free year will give you a no-claim bonus that can be accrued over the policy term, resulting in an increase in your sum insured at no extra cost.
  • You can avail tax deduction on premiums paid towards a health insurance policy under Section 80D of the Income Tax Act, 1961.

items.question: Explain the working of a floater cover under Religare Health Insurance?
items.answer: The floater plan from Religare Health Insurance covers the entire family which includes self, spouse, children, and parents under one single policy and single premium payment. The sum insured can be utilised by a single individual or shared by all the insured members and any number of claims can be made during the policy term, subject to the sum insured limit. A floater plan is cost-effective in comparison to paying premium for an individual policy for each member for the family.

items.question: What are excluded from a standard Religare Health Insurance Policy?
items.answer:
Exclusions of a standard Religare Health Insurance policy includes:

  • There is an initial waiting period of 30 days for all illnesses except an accidental injury.
  • Treatment for AIDS/HIV.
  • Congenital disease treatment.
  • Pregnancy related treatments.
  • Hospitalisation due to a war or nuclear threat.
  • Medical expense incurred due to alcohol or drug abuse.
  • Self-inflicted injuries and suicide attempts.
  • Pre-existing diseases for a period of 4 years since the inception of the policy.

items.question: How does the auto recharge feature under Religare Health Insurance work?
items.answer: If the sum insured and No-Claim Bonus has been exhausted during the policy year, the sum insured will be automatically recharged once in a policy year. The recharge sum insured can be used for future claims but not for an illness or disease for which a claim has already been made in the current policy year.

items.question: What is a No-Claim Bonus under Religare Health Insurance?
items.answer: For every claim-free year, the insurer will provide a No-Claim Bonus to the policyholder in the form of an increase in sum insured (up to 50%) or discount on premium. If a claim is made, the accrued bonus will be reduced by 10%.

items.question: For what reasons can there be a deduction in the claim amount of Religare Health Insurance?
items.answer:
Claim amount can be deducted for the following reasons:

  • Non-medical expenses like snacks and telephone bills are not payable.
  • Treatment details without supporting documents like original bills and prescriptions.
  • If the sum insured is exhausted.
  • If the expenses exceeds specified sub-limits for certain expenses like room rent and doctor's fees.
  • If the policy has a co-payment clause.
  • Investigative or experimental treatment expenses that are not related to the ailment for which the insured member has been admitted are not payable.

items.question: How can an individual make a cashless hospitalisation claim?
items.answer: In the case of an emergency hospitalisation, intimate the insurer within 24 hours of hospitalisation. Intimate the insurance company 48 hours prior to admission for planned hospitalisation. For cashless hospitalisation claims, fill the pre-authorisation request form at the hospital desk, and the network hospital will send the filled form to the insurer. The approval or rejection letter will be sent by the claim management team. In the case of rejection, you can initiate the treatment and file for reimbursement.

items.question: Explain the Claim Processing and Reimbursement under Religare Health Insurance Policy?
items.answer: In the case of an emergency hospitalisation, intimate the insurer within 24 hours of hospitalisation. Intimate the insurance company 48 hours prior to admission for planned hospitalisation. For reimbursement claims, download the claim form from the insurer's website, fill it and submitted it at the nearest branch office along with the supporting documents such as discharge summary, hospital bill, prescription, etc. The approval or rejection letter will be sent by the claim management team. The claim amount will be transferred to the policyholder's bank account.

items.question: How can one cancel his or her Religare Health Insurance Policy?
items.answer: During the free-look period, the policyholder can return the policy and get a refund of the premium after certain deductions if he or she has an objection to the terms and conditions of the policy. Cancellation request can be made at any time during the policy period provided no claims have been made. If a claim has been made and he or she wants to cancel the policy then premium will not be refunded.

items.text: Claim up to Rs. 55,000 deduction under section 80D*
Insurers offer plans with no limit on room rent

elements.body: Max Bupa Health Insurance Company Ltd. (Max Bupa) is a standalone health insurance company. A joint venture between Max India Limited and the UK based Bupa Financial PLC. Bupa has six decades of experience in the healthcare industry and a 11.3 million customer-base in over 190 countries. Max Bupa Health Insurance offers individual, couple, Nuclear family and Extended family health insurance plans.

sections.title: Overview of Max Bupa Health Insurance:

elements.body:
Company Ltd. (Max Bupa) is a collaboration between Max India Limited and Bupa- the UK based healthcare services pioneer. Bupa boasts of an experience of over 6 decades in this competitive industry and has over 11.3 million customers from 190 countries to show for it. Meanwhile, Max India Group is considered a leader in the Indian health and insurance segment that includes hospitals, life insurance and health related clinical research. At Max Bupa, the vision to be India's most preferred health insurance company is the principal driving force, backed by the commitment to form lasting relationships with their cherished customers.

Max Bupa Health Insurance Company Ltd was the only health insurance company to be listed as a Superbrand in the health insurance market in 2015. This standalone health insurance company has 6 decades of experience and expertise in the healthcare industry. Max Bupa Health caters to 29 million customers in 190 countries.

In addition to providing excellent service in healthcare, the company is focused on building a long-term relationship with its customers. The insurance company offers a wide range of health insurance products to suit the varying needs of individuals, couples, nuclear families, and extended families. Listed below are some highlights of Max Bupa Health Insurance:

  • The insurer won the ET Best BFSI Brands Award in 2016 for its 'Customer First' philosophy, innovation, strong equity in the market, and unique products like Max Bupa Walk for Health.
  • Max Bupa Heartbeat Health Insurance was recognised as the Innovation of the Year at Golden Peacock Awards 2015
  • Max Bupa was declared the 'Claim Service Leader of the Year' Award in 2015 at the 5th Indian Insurance Awards.

Over 2.5 million people have been insured with Max Bupa Health Insurance. The company has over 1,400 employees, 26 offices in 16 cities.

sections.title: Why Buy Max Bupa Health Insurance Policy?

elements.body:
Here are some reasons why customers prefer Max Bupa Health Insurance for their health insurance needs:

  • Cashless hospitalisation: Max Bupa Health Insurance offers cashless hospitalisation at 3,500+ network hospitals across India within 30 minutes of receiving the request from the hospital.
  • Comprehensive insurance cover: Max Bupa offers health insurance policies with a sum insured of up to Rs.1 crore. The insurance coverage has low waiting periods.
  • International coverage: Max Bupa Heartbeat Platinum plan is a unique product that offers international cashless treatment for 9 major critical illnesses like organ transplant and cancer through its global network in over 190 countries. Outpatient Department cover is available under this plan.
  • Maternity benefits: Health insurance plans offered by Max Bupa covers maternity related expenses after a 1-year waiting period. A baby born when a maternity claim is payable is automatically covered till the next policy renewal.
  • Health plans for entire family: Max Bupa offers health insurance plans for the entire family from newborn babies to senior citizens under a single policy.
  • Lifelong renewability: All health insurance plans offered by Max Bupa comes with a lifelong renewability option, provided continuous payment of insurance premium.

sections.title: Benefits of Max Bupa Health Insurance:

elements.body:
• Daily cash benefit: For miscellaneous expenses, you can get a daily cash benefit of up to Rs.4,000 per day during the hospitalisation period up to 45 days.
  • Direct claim settlement: There is no involvement of a TPA. Therefore, the claim settlement is direct and quick.
  • World-wide coverage: Insured members can get cashless treatment at a network hospital of Max Bupa Health Insurance anywhere in the world.
  • Renewability for life: All health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa have lifelong renewability option.
  • Discount: Get a discount upon purchasing a 2-year policy. Discount on premium applicable on select policies offered by Max Bupa Health Insurance and that too only in the second year of the policy term.
  • Critical illness plan: A lump sum amount will be paid to the insured in the case of diagnosis of a specified critical illness under the policy, provided he or she survives for 30 days post diagnosis.
  • Personal accident plan: With this rider attached to your base policy, you can get sum insured payout benefit in the case of an accident death, permanent total disability or partial disability.
  • Tax benefit: Get tax deduction on premium paid towards a health insurance policy under Section 80D of the Income Tax Act, 1961.

sections.title: Max Bupa Health Insurance Renewal:

elements.body: All health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa Health Insurance have to be renewed every policy year for continued policy benefits. A 30-day grace period will be given post premium payment due date to make renewal payment. However, policy benefits will not be available during the grace period. If the policyholder fails to renew the policy within the grace period, the policy will lapse. Policy renewal can be done online through the insurer's website. Enter your policy number on the website to know the renewal premium amount and pay using net banking, credit card or debit card.

sections.title: Max Bupa Health Insurance Premium Calculator:

The online premium calculator is simple and easy to use. It is available on the insurer's website. All you have to do is choose a specific plan, enter the chosen sum insured, your personal details such as name, date of birth, city, phone number, and email ID. If you choose co-pay, list how much percentage you are willing to pay. Click on Calculate Premium and get the premium details instantly.

sections.title: How to file a claim with Max Bupa Health Insurance?

elements.body:
There are 2 types of claims you can file with Max Bupa:

  • Cashless Claim: Visit a network hospital and show your health card with policy number and a valid photo identity at the hospital desk. The network hospital will verify your identity and submit a pre-authorisation request to the insurer or TPA. The insurance company or its Third-Party Administrator will process the request and send approval to the hospital. In the case of a rejection, the insured member can get treated at the same hospital but has to pay the medical bills out of his or her pocket, and later make a reimbursement claim for the expenses incurred. In the case of approval, the insurance company will settle the bill directly with the hospital.
  • Reimbursement Claim: In the case of planned hospitalisation, intimate the insurer 48 hours prior to admission. Pay the medical bills upfront, out of your pocket. At the time of discharge, collect all the original medical documents and submit it to the insurer along with a duly-filled and signed claim form which is available on the insurance company's website. The claim will be processed and approved as per the terms and conditions of the policy.

items.question: Why is it important to buy health insurance policy?
items.answer: A health insurance policy helps you to save money by paying off all your medical expenses. With the rising medical expenses, it is a wise move to insure you and your family's health by buying health insurance policies. You can get cashless hospitalization for more than 24 hours with the help of these policies.

items.question: What is a health card?
items.answer: A health card is a part of your health insurance policy. This card enables you to enjoy the benefits of your health insurance policy.

items.question: How do I get cashless hospitalization?
items.answer: You can get cashless hospitalization only in the network hospitals of Max Bupa by showing your health card to the hospital authority.

items.question: What the difference between a network and non-network hospital?
items.answer: A network hospital is a hospital with which your health insurance provider has an official connection. You can enjoy cashless hospitalization in a network hospital. In a non- network hospital, you cannot avail cashless hospitalization and with this hospital, your health insurance provider does not have any tie up.

items.question: As I already have health insurance for myself and my wife from my employer, do I need to buy a separate policy?
items.answer: It's good to buy an alternative health insurance policy to be on the safe side. Because, once you leave or change your present job, your company insurance policy will not cover you and your wife's medical expense. Beside, a separate policy can be an added advantage in case your medical expense is higher than your existing coverage level.

items.question: What is a family floater plan?
items.answer: It is a plan under which you can include the hospitalization expense of your entire family.

items.question: How can I buy Max Bupa Health Insurance Policy?
items.answer: There are many options of buying Max Bupa health insurance policies. You can buy them online.Then you will get your policy instantly. But online facility is available for those people only, who do not need any medical examination. You can also buy Max Bupa health insurance policies over phone or by visiting your nearest branch.

items.question: Do I need to undergo medical examination to buy Max Bupa health insurance policies?
items.answer: You need to undergo medical checkup, if you are buying a new health insurance policy offered by Max Bupa. But for the renewal of your existing policies, you need not go for medical examination.

items.question: What is the duration of health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Ideally, you can buy a policy for a period of 1 or 2 years. If you purchase a policy for two years, you will get discount. This offer is applicable for Heartbeat and Health Companion Health Insurance plans only.

items.question: Can a non- Indian person buy Max Bupa Health Insurance policy?
items.answer: Yes, a non - Indian or a foreigner living in India can also buy health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa. But, the person can claim coverage only within India.

items.question: How to claim Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer:
Max Bupa Health Insurance offers a seamless claims procedure:

  • Cashless claim procedure: Cashless hospitalisation can be availed only in a network hospital. For planned hospitalisation, inform the insurer 48 hours prior to admission and for emergency hospitalisation, intimate the insurer within 24 hours of admission. Display your Max Bupa Health Card at the hospital desk. The hospital will submit a pre-authorisation request to the insurer. The approval or rejection of the request will be conveyed to the hospital via fax or email within 30 minutes. The claim will be settled as per the terms and conditions of the policy.
  • Reimbursement claim procedure: Intimate the insurer within 48 hours of hospitalisation. Submit a claim form along with supporting documents such as original hospital bills, prescription, pharmacy bills, and discharge summary to the insurer. The claim form can be downloaded from Max Bupa Health Insurance website. The insurance company will review the claim request and according approve or reject it. Claim settlement will be done as per the terms and conditions of the policy.

items.question: How good is Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Max Bupa is one of the top health insurance providers in the country. The health insurance plans offered by Max Bupa are designed for individuals, couples, senior citizens, and families. The health plans offer a comprehensive cover and a wide sum insured range. The policies come with a lifelong renewability option. The claim process is hassle-free with no TPA involved.

items.question: What is the tenure of a health insurance plan offered by Max Bupa?
items.answer: Max Bupa Health Insurance plans are available for 1 to 2-years policy period. The policy has to be renewed every year for continued benefits over the policy term. You can get discounts on purchasing a policy for 2 years. The premium discount is applicable for second year for Heartbeat and Health Companion Health Insurance plans.

items.question: What types of medical expenses are compensated by Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: All treatment expenses during hospitalisation are covered under Max Bupa Health Insurance plans including room rent charges.

items.question: Is it necessary to undergo a medical checkup before buying Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: A medical checkup may be required at the time of purchasing a policy but not at the time of renewal. It is advisable to undergo a medical checkup and disclosing any pre-existing conditions at the time of policy inception to avoid any hassle when making a claim.

items.question: Can I avail cashless facility across all the hospitals?
items.answer: No, cashless hospitalisation can be availed only at a network hospital of Max Bupa Health Insurance.

items.question: What is the procedure to avail medical benefits under insurance policy?
items.answer: Max Bupa Health Insurance offers a hassle-free claim process whether it is a cashless claim or reimbursement claim. In the case of a cashless claim, the network hospital has to send a pre-authorisation request to the insurer. In the case of a reimbursement claim, after discharge, you can submit the duly-filled claim form along with the original hospital bills to the insurer. In both cases, the insurer will review your claim request and approve or reject the claim accordingly.

items.question: Who is TPA of Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Max Bupa Health Insurance doesn't have a Third-Party Administrator. This way, the claim settlement solutions are direct and quicker.

items.question: What is a pre-existing disease or condition under Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Any illness, injury, disease or condition detected, treated or diagnosed before 48 hours of purchasing the policy is considered a pre-existing condition.

items.question: Does Max Bupa Health Insurance cover the hospitalization expenses incurred during a medical emergency?
items.answer: Insurance cover of a health insurance policy offered by Max Bupa is only for medical expen
